title: Luxembourg
heading: INTER
content: Luxembourg's INTER (2006 - Ongoing). INTER enables the FNR to initiate bi or multilateral arrangements for project calls in conjunction with other national or international funding bodies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To give Luxembourg’s public research a higher profile in the international context by providing funding for international collaboration. It uses Project grants for public research, Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: CORE
content: Luxembourg's CORE (2007 - Ongoing). A multi-annual thematic research programme to strengthen the scientific quality of Luxembourg’s public research in the country’s priority research domains. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Funding of high quality scientific research, leading to the generation of new knowledge and scientific publications in the leading international peer-reviewed outlets of the respective fields. Development of a strong research basis in Luxembourg which can be exploited for sustainable long-term socio-economic and environmental benefits. Advancement of the research group or institution in view of international visibility and critical mass. Training of doctoral students and advancement of the involved researchers in general. It uses Project grants for public research, Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: ATTRACT
content: Luxembourg's ATTRACT (2007 - Ongoing). The ATTRACT programme is designed for (junior) researchers not yet established in Luxembourg, who demonstrate the potential to become leaders in their field of research. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Providing promising junior researchers the opportunity to set up their own research team within one of the country’s research institutions. Attracting outstanding young talents from abroad. Supporting the Luxembourg research institutions to expand their competences in strategic research areas. It uses Project grants for public research, Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: OPEN
content: Luxembourg's OPEN (2012 - Ongoing). The OPEN programme provides funding for a limited number of high quality research projects in areas that are currently not covered by the FNR’s thematic CORE programme. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To support established researchers to pursue innovative research projects of high scientific quality in emerging research areas in Luxembourg. It uses Project grants for public research, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: PEARL
content: Luxembourg's PEARL (2008 - Ongoing). Offers Luxembourg research institutions funding to enable them to draw established and internationally recognised researchers from abroad It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To accelerate the development and strengthening of Luxembourg’s national research priorities. To attract leading researchers that will develop a research programme in areas of strategic importance to Luxembourg with the potential to generate long term impact. To support the Luxembourg research institutions to expand their competences in strategic research areas. To address the apparent gender gap in leading academic and research positions (The FNR requires that the research institutions ensure that at least 30% of the candidates to be proposed to the FNR in the years 2017-2021 are female researchers.). It uses Project grants for public research, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: NATIONAL CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE IN RESEARCH ON PARKINSONS DISEASE
content: Luxembourg's NATIONAL CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE IN RESEARCH ON PARKINSONS DISEASE (2015 - Ongoing). The NCER-PD is a joint research program by all biomedical research partners in Luxembourg. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To focus on improving the diagnosis and stratification of Parkinsons disease (PD) by combining detailed clinical and molecular data of patients to develop novel disease biomarker signatures. Ultimately, to diagnose PD at an earlier stage and with a higher specificity than is currently possible. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Luxembourg
heading: INTERDISCIPLINARY CENTRE FOR SECURITY, RELIABILITY AND TRUST
content: Luxembourg's INTERDISCIPLINARY CENTRE FOR SECURITY, RELIABILITY AND TRUST (2009 - Ongoing). The SnT conducts internationally competitive research in information and communication technology, ICT, with high relevance creating socio-economic impact. In addition to long-term, high-risk research, SnT engages in demand driven collaborative projects with industry and the public sector. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Digital transformation of firms, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To establish Luxembourg as a European centre of excellence for secure, reliable, and trustworthy ICT systems and services. To achieve excellence by targeting research topics that create high impact, well beyond the academic community. To foster an interdisciplinary environment bringing together expertise from engineering, natural, law, and human/social sciences to address common challenges. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malta
heading: PLUMTRI - MEDITERRANEAN PLATFORM FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
content: Malta's PLUMTRI - MEDITERRANEAN PLATFORM FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION (2016 - Ongoing). PluMTri is a web portal developed as a tool for researchers working in Malta or abroad. Users can make use of the database (Profiles) to make contact with fellow researchers. They can also access news and events related to R&I as well as job opportunities. Those interested in engaging in a debate with other researchers on Maltas smart specialisation areas can request access to the PluMTri Forum. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Develop a network of researchers both in the academic and industrial spheres to encourage inter-disciplinary collaboration, knowledge transfer between academia and industry, as well as form consortia for potential application of funds such as Horizon Europe. The website has a partner search facility to enable interested applicants to join consortia for transnational R&I collaborative projects It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Poland
heading: [NCN] UWERTURA FELLOWSHIP IN ERC-FUNDED PROJECTS
content: Poland's [NCN] UWERTURA FELLOWSHIP IN ERC-FUNDED PROJECTS (2016 - Ongoing). Funding opportunity for research stays in international research teams which hold ERC grants. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): To support researchers planning to apply for ERC grants. To boost the academic profile of candidates applying for ERC grants. To increase the participation of Polish researchers in ERC programmes. It uses Project grants for public research, Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: THEMATIC RESEARCH AND INNOVATION AGENDAS
content: Portugal's THEMATIC RESEARCH AND INNOVATION AGENDAS (2017 - Ongoing). A research, innovation and growth strategy for Portugal, organized around 14 thematic agendas. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, ERA-related strategies, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): Promote the dialogue between the scientific and business communities, combining the capacities and needs of researchers, citizens, business, public administration and civil society organizations. Create a medium- and long-term vision of the Portuguese R&I system and define the approaches for achieving this vision in each of the 14 thematic areas. Construct sources of information to sustain decision-making processes for R&I internationalization strategies and research agendas of institutions and researchers. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Portugal
heading: ATLANTIC INTERACTIONS - ATLANTIC INTERNATIONAL RESEARCH CENTRE
content: Portugal's ATLANTIC INTERACTIONS - ATLANTIC INTERNATIONAL RESEARCH CENTRE (2017 - Ongoing). Atlantic Interactions is a new intergovernmental initiative to unleash the potential of the Atlantic for Society. It fosters knowledge-driven solutions for the Atlantic and Global Societal challenges that require interdisciplinary research and innovation of complex Earth systems through cooperation targeting the Atlantic. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, International STI governance policy, Mission-oriented innovation policies. It has the following objective(s): To foster new paradigms of interaction across the Atlantic and across disciplines to foster new knowledge on ocean, climate and energy sustainability taking advantage of the most advanced technologies to build new and integrated knowledge. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Federal government
heading: BELGIAN BIODIVERSITY PLATFORM
content: Belgium - Federal government's BELGIAN BIODIVERSITY PLATFORM (2010 - Ongoing). The Belgian Biodiversity Platform provides services to the Belgian scientific community engaged in biodiversity research and to policy-makers as well as to practitioners. As a science-policy interface on biodiversity, our work is based around 3 main areas: knowledge brokerage, topical knowledge incubation, Open access to data. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): Answering policy needs. Catalysing the improvement of research processes. Knowledge interfacing and sharing. Enabling data publication and data use. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Federal government
heading: FED-tWIN
content: Belgium - Federal government's FED-tWIN (2017 - Ongoing). FED-tWIN is a federal research program of sustainable research cooperation between the federal scientific institutes and the Belgian universities. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): To fund common research profiles to be performed by PhDs committed half-time in each of the 2 institutions. Info related to the date : Legal basis in 2017 (Law) & 2018 (Royal decree) - First budgetary commitment in 2019 It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: EXPLORATORY RESEARCH PROJECTS
content: Portugal's EXPLORATORY RESEARCH PROJECTS (2012 - Ongoing). Provide quick support for research in new concepts and/or ideas, with reduced and simplified administrative procedures It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Support innovative ideas in all research domains to foster the development of emerging research areas Contribute to the generation of new knowledge or the advancement of a research field It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: LATINAMERICAN CENTRE FOR INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING
content: Argentina's LATINAMERICAN CENTRE FOR INTERDISCIPLINARY TRAINING (2015 - Ongoing). The Center organizes activities aimed at training Latin-American scientist at solving complex problems that require an interdisciplinary approach. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): To train Latin-American scientists in fields that are in the boundary of different disciplines. To boost research in complex problems that demand an interdisciplinary approach. To help build networks for scientific research in Latin America. To provide a working environment that favours disruptive and creative ideas in science. It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: NON-COMPETITIVE FUNDING OF THE ARGENTINE NATIONAL SYSTEM OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
content: Argentina's NON-COMPETITIVE FUNDING OF THE ARGENTINE NATIONAL SYSTEM OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY (1956 - Ongoing). Non-competitive funding provided by the most important public institutions that carry on Science and Technology in Argentina. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Each of the institutions that are part of the National System of Science, Technology and Innovation promote basic and applied research in different sectors with the same objective: to serve the country‘s integral development. That is why, articulation between the system’s institutions, usually government agencies, is so important. CONICET’s objective is the promotion of S&T in Argentina in different fields of knowledge. INTA’s objective is to carry out research and technological innovation activities in value chains, regions and territories to improve competitiveness and sustainable rural development in the country. CNEA’s objective is to advise the Executive on the development of nuclear energy policies aimed to provide technological support to the various domestic industry sectors. CONAE’s objective is to design, implement, monitor, manage and administration of space projects, activities and undertakings nationwide. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Austria
heading: AUSTRIAN PUBLIC DATABASE OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Austria's AUSTRIAN PUBLIC DATABASE OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2011 - Ongoing). The database of research infrastructures is a database containing Austrian research infrastructure and their specific competencies. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide a database of Austrian research infrastructure to support collaboration. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Lithuania
heading: LITHUANIAN ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Lithuania's LITHUANIAN ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2011 - Ongoing). A long-term strategic planning tool for research infrastructures of national importance, including information about Lithuanians current and planned memberships in international research infrastructures. The roadmap is not a funding initiative. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To identify strategic directions for infrastructure development set long-term priorities for research infrastructure policy and development. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Lithuania
heading: R&D ASSESSMENT AND FUNDING SYSTEM FOR HIGHER EDUCATION AND RESEARCH
content: Lithuania's R&D ASSESSMENT AND FUNDING SYSTEM FOR HIGHER EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (2017 - Ongoing). A two-stage R&D assessment and funding system was introduced in Lithuania in 2017, reforming the allocation of State budget funds for R&D to universities and research institutes It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Evaluation and impact assessment, Non-competitive research funding, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): nan It uses Institutional funding for public research, Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Brazil
heading: RESEARCH PRODUCTIVITY GRANT
content: Brazil's RESEARCH PRODUCTIVITY GRANT (1991 - Ongoing). A competitive program for supporting researchers with a grant, in all areas of knowledge, in several levels. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Value researchers who have prominent scientific, technological and innovative production in their respective areas of knowledge. Encourage the scientific, technological and innovative production with quality. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Lithuania
heading: RESEARCHER GROUPS PROJECTS
content: Lithuania's RESEARCHER GROUPS PROJECTS (2010 - Ongoing). This competitive research funding measure has the highest number of projects funded and is the second largest RCL‘s measure by allocated financial resources. The bottom-up nature of this measure ensures that the most creative, innovative and ambitious research ideas of researcher teams’ in all scientific areas will be funded. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To support excellent research on a bottom-up basis without predetermined priorities To promote international cooperation. To promote interdisciplinary research. To encourage engagement of young researchers. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Denmark
heading: INTERNATIONAL NETWORK PROGRAMME
content: Denmark's INTERNATIONAL NETWORK PROGRAMME (2009 - Ongoing). The International Network Programme (INP) is aimed at giving researchers from both the public and the private sector an opportunity to establish networks with researchers from selected countries of strategic priority to the Danish Agency for Higher Education and Science. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): International Network Programme supports network activities between Danish and foreign researchers from Brazil, China (incl. Hong Kong), India, Israel, Japan, USA, the Republic of Korea, and South Africa. For applications with an Arctic focus, partner countries may also include Canada, Russia, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, Greenland and/or the Faroe Islands. Funding may be awarded to projects where there is not already an established collaboration between the project partners. The aim of the programme is to give researchers an opportunity to build the foundation for future cooperation and to explore new research partnerships of a potentially high value. Thus, the scheme funds networking activities and not traditional research activities. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: REFORM OF THE INCENTIVES PROGRAM FOR RESEARCHERS AT UNIVERSITIES
content: Argentina's REFORM OF THE INCENTIVES PROGRAM FOR RESEARCHERS AT UNIVERSITIES (2017 - Ongoing). Reform the Program through the creation of a National System of University Researchers (SiNDIU) to prioritize scientific research and experimental development (R&D) in the field of national universities, and highlight the role that these develop within the Argentine scientific-technological system. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Research careers, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Contribute to the strengthening of research in the university field. Improve the scientific and technological productivity of the research faculty. Establish homogeneous criteria to evaluate scientific and technological activity. Tend to convergence with other researchers systems in the country. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Austria
heading: COMPLEXITY SCIENCE HUB VIENNA
content: Austria's COMPLEXITY SCIENCE HUB VIENNA (2015 - Ongoing). The Complexity Science Hub Vienna pools varying initiatives in Austria regarding Complexity Science, System Analysis and Big Data Science It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Different institutions have different focal points and interests regarding Complexity Science. Complex systems comprise not only social, financial, socio-economic and organic systems, but also concern cities, infrastructure, traffic & supply, public administration and communication. Hence, by pooling these resources, the generation of knowledge can be accelerated and international relevance and visibility are improved. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Finland
heading: ACADEMY OF FINLAND PROGRAMME FOR DEVELOPMENT RESEARCH
content: Finland's ACADEMY OF FINLAND PROGRAMME FOR DEVELOPMENT RESEARCH (2017 - Ongoing). The Academy Programme for development research (Develop) provides funding to multidisciplinary, problem-based research that targets global development issues, helps boost development in developing countries and makes good use of Finnish knowledge and expertise in the field. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research and innovation for developing countries. It has the following objective(s): produce knowledge that can help solve problems related to, for example, health, natural resources, the economy and education brings knowledge on how international, national and cultural systems work and about the limitations that these systems present to and the opportunities they offer for development It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Thailand
heading: THAILAND GRAND CHALLENGES RESEARCH PROGRAMME
content: Thailand's THAILAND GRAND CHALLENGES RESEARCH PROGRAMME (2014 - Ongoing). Thailand Grand Challenges Program is an integrated and interdisciplinary research program with clear targets It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): To support research projects promising results that can be practically utilized with high social and economic impact for the country. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Flanders
heading: INTERNATIONALISATION SUPPORT SCHEMES (MOBILITY, COOPERATION, CONTACTS) FROM FWO
content: Belgium - Flanders's INTERNATIONALISATION SUPPORT SCHEMES (MOBILITY, COOPERATION, CONTACTS) FROM FWO (1993 - Ongoing). FWO support schemes for internationalisation. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, International mobility of human resources, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To support international mobility, international cooperation and international contacts. It uses Project grants for public research, Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: JOINT R&D PROJECT
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's JOINT R&D PROJECT (2017 - Ongoing). The Joint R&D project call (previously known as Team-up) involves an active participation of both academic units and industrial teams with an aim of strengthening knowledge, transferring IP from academic research to the industry and turning it into prototypes that lead to new business opportunities. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Digital transformation of firms, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To foster R&D related collaboration between academia and industry in the Brussels-Capital Region. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: PROSPECTIVE RESEARCH PROGRAMME
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's PROSPECTIVE RESEARCH PROGRAMME (2017 - Ongoing). Through its Prospective Researchprogramme, Innoviris is financing projects led by academic researchers at a Brussels university or college which focus on the future and cover areas of importance to the Brussels Capital Region. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies. It has the following objective(s): To develop and enrich the knowledge available on Brussels urban complexity. The recent thematic calls for the programme were focused on sustainable tourism and the future of governance. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: Co-Creation
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's Co-Creation (2015 - Ongoing). This programme targets applied research and innovation projects which will be part of a co-creation dynamic and will be implemented in living labs which they will establish with the end users as partners. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Multi-stakeholder engagement. It has the following objective(s): Through the Co-create programme, Innoviris wishes to bring closer the Brussels population, the world of research and innovation and the corporate world. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: NATIONAL BIOECONOMY STRATEGY
content: Germany's NATIONAL BIOECONOMY STRATEGY (2020 - Ongoing). The National Bioeconomy Strategy constitutes a framework for national efforts in the area of bioeconomy to combine economy and ecology to ensure a more sustainable use of resources. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Public research strategies. It has the following objective(s): Develop bioeconomy solutions for the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Recognise and harness the potential of the bioeconomy within ecological boundaries. Enhance and apply biological knowledge. Establish a sustainable raw material base for industry. Promote Germany as the leading location for innovation in the bioeconomy. Involve society and strengthen national and international collaboration. It uses Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities, Strategies, agendas and plans, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Slovenia
heading: SUPPORT TO EARLY CAREER RESEARCHERS
content: Slovenia's SUPPORT TO EARLY CAREER RESEARCHERS (2016 - Ongoing). With the involvement of researchers and their research potential the incentive will focus on the implementation of research projects with the cooperation of research organisations and the economy. Specific attention will be given to researchers who are returning to Slovenia after completing their research or educational work at international research and/or higher education institutions and who bring experience and know-how from abroad back home. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, International mobility of human resources, Intersectoral mobility, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Support researchers careers. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Thailand
heading: RESEARCH CHAIR GRANT
content: Thailand's RESEARCH CHAIR GRANT (2008 - Ongoing). Research Chair Grant is a funding program, aiming to support quality research projects that will create significant social and economic impact, with an emphasis on building a strong research team. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To foster and strengthen a research team consisting of senior and junior scientists as well as students, supporting career development at different levels of seniority. To support research with high social and economic impact. To support collaboration between academic and the industry or society. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Thailand
heading: SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND
content: Thailand's SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND (1991 - Ongoing). The Science and Technology Development Fund is designed for implementing activities for S&T development. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To support research, development, design and engineering that will lead to technology transfer. To promote human resource development and S&T infrastructure development. To provide analytical services, infrastructure service, business and investment to enhance the nation’s competitiveness. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Thailand
heading: GRAND CHALLENGES FUNDING SCHEME: SOCIETAL PROGRAM AREAS
content: Thailand's GRAND CHALLENGES FUNDING SCHEME: SOCIETAL PROGRAM AREAS (2016 - Ongoing). Thailand Grand Challenges Program funds research projects leading to results that can be practically utilized with high social and economic impact for the country. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To fund integrated and interdisciplinary projects with clear targets, with results that can be utilized to improve quality of life and create economic and social impact. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Thailand
heading: GRAND CHALLENGES FUNDING SCHEME: HEALTH AND PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM
content: Thailand's GRAND CHALLENGES FUNDING SCHEME: HEALTH AND PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM (2016 - Ongoing). Thailand Grand Challenges Program funds research projects with results that can be practically utilized with high social and economic impact for the country. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To fund research in integrated and interdisciplinary projects with clear targets with results that can be utilized in health sector and public health system. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Iceland
heading: STRATEGIC RESEARCH FUND
content: Iceland's STRATEGIC RESEARCH FUND (2018 - Ongoing). Strategic competitive funding for specified research topics. The current topic was announced in 2018. There are plans for allocating fund this year in line with defined societal challenges. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Foster research on targeted topics, identified by the science and technology policy council. Need to fund a mixture of basic and applied research. All results to be published open access. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Argentina's RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2008 - Ongoing). Argentinean National Systems (Networks) are designed to make public funding available for the whole scientific community and the productive sector. It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To promote access to facilities: X Ray, Microscopy, Magnetic Resonance, Mass Spectrometry, Hugh Performance Computing, Laser, Advanced Networks, Bioteriums, Magnometry, Flow Cytometry. To promote access to databases: Ocean Data, Biological Data, Climate Data, Genomic Data and Digital Repositories. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Flanders
heading: RESEARCH GRANTS
content: Belgium - Flanders's RESEARCH GRANTS (1993 - Ongoing). The research grant supports young and/or established researchers with an individual research expense grant. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It has the following objective(s): The research grant supports young and/or established researchers with an individual research expense grant. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Flanders
heading: RESEARCH PROJECTS
content: Belgium - Flanders's RESEARCH PROJECTS (1993 - Ongoing). Research projects are initiated by researchers active in an institute of the Flemish Community. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Advance fundamental scientific research. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Portugal
heading: INTERFACE PROGRAMME
content: Portugal's INTERFACE PROGRAMME (2017 - Ongoing). Programme to promote collaborative innovation, tech transfer, knowledge valorisation and the creation of Innovation networks. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Intersectoral mobility, Research infrastructures, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): To create added value through knowledge valorisation. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Technology extension and business advisory services, Grants for business R&D and innovation, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Russian Federation
heading: SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION
content: Russian Federation's SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION (2011 - Ongoing). The portal contains up-to-date and systematic information about the network of centers for the collective use of scientific equipment and unique scientific facilities the Russian Federation, including those supported by the Russian Ministry of Science and Higher Education within the framework of federal target programs “Research and development in priority areas for the development of the scientific and technological complex” for 2007-2013 and 2014-2020 and constituting the core of the modern national research infrastructure. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Monitoring research infrastructure and equipment. Linking the providers and potential customers of scientific services. Monitoring the research results derived with the use of research equipment. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: New Zealand
heading: VISION MĀTAURANGA CAPABILITY FUND
content: New Zealand's VISION MĀTAURANGA CAPABILITY FUND (2013 - Ongoing). The Fund invests in the development of skilled people and organisations that plan to undertake, or are undertaking, research that supports the themes and outcomes of our Vision Mātauranga policy. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Gender balance and inclusiveness, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): Strengthen capability, capacity, skills and networks between Māori and the science and innovation system increase understanding of how research can contribute to the aspirations of Māori organisations and deliver benefit for New Zealand. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Costa Rica
heading: NATIONAL POLICY FOR A KNOWLEDGE-BASED SOCIETY AND ECONOMY
content: Costa Rica's NATIONAL POLICY FOR A KNOWLEDGE-BASED SOCIETY AND ECONOMY (2017 - Ongoing). Its an initiative of the Costa Rican state, consensus with civil society, the private sector and academia to articulate the countrys efforts in a long-term vision, with respect to scientific and technological progress and its impact economic, social and environmental. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cross-disciplinary research, Horizontal policy coordination, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Its main objective is the promotion, strengthening and diffusion of knowledge as well as scientific and technological development in benefit of the Costa Rican society. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Denmark
heading: RESEARCH2025 - promising future research areas
content: Denmark's RESEARCH2025 - promising future research areas (2016 - Ongoing). Knowledge base for prioritising strategic research funding through co-creation. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Public research strategies. It has the following objective(s): Mapping societys greatest research needs as a basis for political priorities. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Federal government
heading: HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTING PROJECT
content: Belgium - Federal government's HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTING PROJECT (2017 - Ongoing). Belgium has joined European cooperation on high performance computing in June 2017. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): This project aims to build together a pan European world-class digital infrastructure for the future. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Federal government
heading: SCIENCECLOUD PROJECT
content: Belgium - Federal government's SCIENCECLOUD PROJECT (2017 - Ongoing). The Science Cloud is a specific ICT space foreseen for the Federal Research Institutes. It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Develop a common ICT infrastructure wherein the Federal Research Institutes can install their data sources and applications. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Estonia
heading: ETAIS - ESTONIAN SCIENTIFIC COMPUTING INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Estonia's ETAIS - ESTONIAN SCIENTIFIC COMPUTING INFRASTRUCTURE (2010 - Ongoing). The Estonian Scientific Computing Infrastructure is a part of the Estonian national roadmap of research infrastructures. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide computing and storage resources for Estonian scientific community (and in the future also to other public sector users and industry). It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: FUND FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH
content: Chile's FUND FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH (2004 - Ongoing). This program seeks to enhance scientific and technological development in the country, through the funding of research projects based in cooperative and multidisciplinary work. The program encourages the formation of scientific research groups, inside research institutions, with the purpose of strengthening the development of sciences and technology, as well as, human capital formation. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Promote advanced scientific and technological research. Achieve an international scope and establish networks. Joint development of science-based technologies, in partnership with the private and the productive sector. Apply results in real situations. Training of researchers. Formation and training of postgraduate students. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: BASAL FINANCING FOR THE GENERATION OF PUBLIC GOODS
content: Chile's BASAL FINANCING FOR THE GENERATION OF PUBLIC GOODS (2015 - Ongoing). This program seeks to generate and maintain enabling technological capabilities in entities that fulfil a public mandate, in order to provide goods and services of public interest for competitiveness in strategic sectors for the country. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Generate and maintain enabling technological capabilities in technological entities, for the provision of goods and services of public interest for competitiveness, spheres and / or strategic sectors, contributing to the closing of gaps in advanced human capital, infrastructure and technological equipment with a vision of long term. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: Competence centres
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's Competence centres (2000 - Ongoing). Innoviris finances various collective research centres or guidance centres that exchange information, stimulate innovation, and improve the technical expertise within a number of sectors (food, construction, high-tech). It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Non-competitive research funding, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): Facilitate information exchanges, best practices, training with regard to innovation, and collaboration. Offer direct and personalised advice to companies Enable rapid testing of innovative ideas It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTING NATIONAL SYSTEM
content: Argentina's HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTING NATIONAL SYSTEM (2010 - Ongoing). The national state, has under the orbit of the mincyt the National System of High Performance Computing, whose purpose is to consolidate a national network of high performance computing centers belonging to the interconnected scientific and academic system, to meet the growing demand of the scientific community and technological in the areas of storage, mesh computing, high performance and high performance, visualization and other emerging technologies. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Promote policies that help maximize the use of equipment used in these areas, which has been acquired with public funds. Contribute to the efficient management of available resources and the achievement of public and private financing for the improvement of the network for the provision of services. Provide facilities for the acquisition of new equipment and improvement of existing ones. Promote the training of trained human resources through common programs. Promote the integration of the centers to the international R + D + i community. Generate a proper system for the issuance and validation of certificates. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: MINHO ADVANCED COMPUTING CENTER
content: Portugal's MINHO ADVANCED COMPUTING CENTER (2017 - Ongoing). FCT, UMinho and UTAustin protocol that will trigger the installation process of the first supercomputer in Portugal, in the first quarter of 2018, along with the creation of Minho Advanced Computing Centre (MACC). It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To install a new infrastructure to develop new areas of computing in Portugal, complementing the existing resources in the regions of Lisbon and Tagus Valley and the Centre in this area of research. To serve scientific and business applications, particularly in areas that include climate, maritime safety, support to fisheries, monitoring of patterns of mobility in cities, encouraging biodiversity, risk management in forests and applications for health, including bioinformatics. To serve AIR Centre. To facilitate the future adoption of the National Open Science Policy. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Brazil
heading: SINAPAD
content: Brazil's SINAPAD (2004 - Ongoing). The Programme consists of a network of high performance computers implemented by the Ministry of Science and Technology and is geographically distributed in 9 unities named "National Centres of High Performance Computing" run by universities and ICT institutes in Brazil. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide services of high performance computing, by demand, to universities, research institutes and other private or public institutions. Support the development of high performance computing services and applications. Foster and support the qualification of human resources. Transfer HPC knowledge and technology. Publicize the culture and applications of HPC. It uses Institutional funding for public research, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Peru
heading: PROJECTS OF APPLIED RESEARCH IN CONSTRUCTION AND SANITATION
content: Peru's PROJECTS OF APPLIED RESEARCH IN CONSTRUCTION AND SANITATION (2017 - Ongoing). Generate new knowledge and applications in the public domain, through scientific research and technological development that provide solutions and alternatives for the construction and sanitation sectors in Peru. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Promote the development of lines of research established by SENCICO to address the problems of the construction and sanitation sector. Promote collaborative work between academia, research institutions and the private sector linked to construction and sanitation. Train young researchers to incorporate a new generation of scientists in the public and private sectors. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: ERC COMPLEMENTARY SCHEME
content: Slovenia's ERC COMPLEMENTARY SCHEME (2010 - Ongoing). The aim of the ERC Complementary Scheme is to provide incentives for those applicants from Slovenian research organizations who were positively assessed by the ERC peer review process, and nevertheless not approved for co-financing. It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): The objective of this scheme is to obtain favorable conditions for refining both researcher’s scientific excellence and the original idea of the project. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: TARGETED RESEARCH PROGRAMME PROJECTS
content: Slovenia's TARGETED RESEARCH PROGRAMME PROJECTS (2001 - Ongoing). Target research programmes represent a system created in 2001 for inter-sectoral cooperation in planning and implementing networked R&D projects for specific areas of public interest. CRP represent a special form of scientific and research programme of MIZŠ in cooperation with the ARRS contributes to setting and implementing strategic development objectives for Slovenia in cooperation with other ministries. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Ensure target-oriented research support to prepare long-term development planning documents and system-level solutions for implementation at the national level and for priority areas at the individual, inter-sectoral, and inter-departmental or inter-ministerial levels. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: CO-FINANCING DOCTORAL STUDIES OF PUBLIC HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS
content: Slovenia's CO-FINANCING DOCTORAL STUDIES OF PUBLIC HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS (2017 - Ongoing). Funding at the level of higher education institution is determined by the annual decision of the minister responsible for higher education, taking into account the number of third-level graduates of the public higher education institution in the last five years. It is part of the following theme(s): Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Support to PhD studies. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: TEAMING PROJECTS
content: Slovenia's TEAMING PROJECTS (2017 - Ongoing). Complementary measure to the H2020 widening call where national authorities support projects with cofinancing. The aim of the instrument is to support a new institution which is created on a different basis as existing ones (collaboration with an advanced partner, consortium type of collaboration, different governance structure of the institution). It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Internationalisation in public research, Research infrastructures, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Goal of the measure is to establish and support one large national research centre (of excellence) with sufficient research capacity in terms of HR and research infrastructure. The aim is also introduction of a new governance system, which will influence existing ones as well. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Colombia
heading: NATIONAL NETWORK OF GEOSCIENCE LABORATORIES
content: Colombia's NATIONAL NETWORK OF GEOSCIENCE LABORATORIES (2013 - Ongoing). The RNLG aims to develop technologies and applications in strategic areas of earth sciences, which contribute to advance knowledge and evaluation of the Hydrocarbon Potential and other non-renewable natural resources in areas with possible new reserves. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Strengthening of the national scientific community and the research infrastructure for earth sciences. To reduce uncertainty in decision-making for the sectors development. To encourage private investments in hydrocarbon exploration and exploitation activities. To promote partnerships between research centers. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: France
heading: FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO INSTITUTIONS WHICH INTEGRATE GENDER IN RESEARCH CONTENT
content:
France's FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO INSTITUTIONS WHICH INTEGRATE GENDER IN RESEARCH CONTENT (2011 - Ongoing). Financial support to some NGOs (for e.g. EFiGiES, Mnémosyne, ANEF) for informing and stocktaking gender equality Policy (for e.g., Mnémosyne awards the best MA dissertation on a gender-related topic).
Financial support for VIRAGE (Violences et rapports de genre) Survey, especially its part on universities. It is part of the following theme(s): Embedding sex- and gender-specific analysis in research, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Support institutions integrating a gender dimension in research content and teaching. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Croatia
heading: Croatian Science Foundation
content: Croatia's Croatian Science Foundation (2014 - Ongoing). In 2014 CSF open a first in line of calls form comepetitive research projects. Success rate for this programme is between 25-30% and every year between 100 and 200 new projects are evaluated as eligible for funding. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, International mobility of human resources. It has the following objective(s): nan It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments.

title: Colombia
heading: GUATIGUARÁ TECHNOLOGICAL PARK. SUPERCOMPUTING AND SCIENTIFIC CALCULATION CENTER
content: Colombia's GUATIGUARÁ TECHNOLOGICAL PARK. SUPERCOMPUTING AND SCIENTIFIC CALCULATION CENTER (2012 - Ongoing). The Technology Park of Guatiguará is an organization whose purpose is to generate, appropriate and transfer knowledge, through R & D, entrepreneurship, incubation, acceleration, addressed to the productive transformation and the increase of the wealth of its region and the country. As part of its infrastructure and services, it has the Supercomputing and Scientific Calculation Center of the Industrial University of Santander, which supports and strengthens research and extension activities. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Support for R & D and innovation in High Performance Computing, Scientific Calculation and Scalable Architectures for academic, scientific and industrial, public or private needs. To provide access to specific high-performance and large-scale computing architectures. Training in high performance computing and scientific calculation. To develop strategic projects between IT companies, research centers and universities. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Malta
heading: SUPERCOMPUTER AT UNIVERSITY OF MALTA
content: Malta's SUPERCOMPUTER AT UNIVERSITY OF MALTA (2011 - Ongoing). The provision and hosting of a supercomputer infrastructure at the University of Malta. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The main objective is to provide the University with a super computing laboratory to conduct a wide range of applied research. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malta
heading: PARTICIPATION IN MARTERA
content: Malta's PARTICIPATION IN MARTERA (2017 - Ongoing). It is an ERANET co-fund scheme of Horizon 2020 with an overall goal to strengthen the European Research Area in maritime and marine technologies as well as blue growth. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, International co-operation, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Ocean technology transfer and commercialisation, Support for a sustainable ocean economy. It has the following objective(s): Enabling synergies among national and European research in marine and maritime sectors. To tackle complex projects through trans-national collaboration which cannot be accomplished by one nation alone. To provide a better chance for innovation to enter into new markets. Enabling a cross cutting perspective in technology development leading to innovations capable of benefiting more than one sector, hence increasing the impact of the funded transnational project. To bring industry and research actors across borders together to strengthen Europes economic position underpinning blue growth. To create critical mass and focus excellence on pre-competitive breakthroughs. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: Extreme Light Infrastructure Attosecond Light Pulse Source
content: Hungary's Extreme Light Infrastructure Attosecond Light Pulse Source (2014 - Ongoing). It is a laser facility that aims to host the most intense beamline system worldwide, develop new interdisciplinary research opportunities with light from these lasers and secondary radiation derived from them, and make them available to an international scientific user community. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The primary mission of the ELI-ALPS Szeged research facility is to make a wide range of ultrashort light sources accessible to the international scientific community user groups. Laser driven secondary sources emitting coherent extreme-ultraviolet (XUV) and x-ray radiation confined in attosecond pulses is a major research initiative of the infrastructure. The secondary purpose of the facility is to contribute to the necessary scientific and technological developments required for high peak intensity and high power lasers. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Netherlands
heading: STRATEGIC AGENDA FOR RESEARCH FACILITIES IN THE APLLIED SCIENCE INSTITUTES (RTOS)
content: Netherlands's STRATEGIC AGENDA FOR RESEARCH FACILITIES IN THE APLLIED SCIENCE INSTITUTES (RTOS) (2017 - Ongoing). The Strategic Agenda creates the framework for making choices regarding the most urgent TO2 facilities for the period 2017-2021. It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Creating the framework for making choices regarding TO2 research facilities. Presenting a more strategic and coordinated manner and an integral perspective on this topic. The core of this Strategic Agenda is a global assessment of the facilities. Creating the urgency for public funds as none are currently attached to this Agenda. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: European Union
heading: EUROPEAN RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE CONSORTIUM LEGAL FRAMEWORK
content: European Union's EUROPEAN RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE CONSORTIUM LEGAL FRAMEWORK (2009 - Ongoing). EU Legal Form for pan-European Research Infrastructures. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): This specific legal form is designed to facilitate the joint establishment and operation of research infrastructures of European interest which are owned by different EU Member States and other countries. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: BRITISH SCIENCE WEEK
content: United Kingdom's BRITISH SCIENCE WEEK (1995 - Ongoing). BSW is a ten-day celebration of Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths held across the UK in March each year. It promotes STEM activities among the UK population with a particular emphasis on hard to reach and under-served audiences. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Science, technology and innovation culture. It has the following objective(s): To promote STEM activities among the UK population and ensure it is seen as an integral part of culture . To support hard to reach and under-served communities in developing an appreciation for STEM topics that resonate with their lived experience It uses Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Austria
heading: THE AUSTRIAN SOCIAL SCIENCE DATA ARCHIVE
content: Austria's THE AUSTRIAN SOCIAL SCIENCE DATA ARCHIVE (2016 - Ongoing). AUSSDA is a core social science research infrastructure in Austria, offering research data and archiving services. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): AUSSDA strives to become the leading research infrastructure for the social sciences in Austria, offering high quality, sustainable, and easy-to-use solutions for archiving digital data, along with world-wide access to it. Support the open data movement and work towards maximizing the potential for data use within our user group. Deliver services to researchers, students, educational institutions as well as media representatives and the public. Generate scientific and social impact. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: POST-DOCTORAL PROJECTS
content: Slovenia's POST-DOCTORAL PROJECTS (2003 - Ongoing). A post-doctoral project may be a basic or applied research activity implemented so that a researcher can acquire additional post-doctoral experiences and knowledge. A post-doctoral project can be only carried out by one researcher - a post-doctoral researcher. A post-doctoral researcher is a researcher for whom no more than three years have passed since the defence of their first doctorate of science. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): To achieve a greater development of human resources. To improve the career opportunities for researchers. To select successful project proposals that meet all prescribed conditions and offer the best research performance indicators. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: INITIATIVE FOR NATIONAL GRID OF HIGH-PERFORMANCE COMPUTING RESOURCES
content: Slovenia's INITIATIVE FOR NATIONAL GRID OF HIGH-PERFORMANCE COMPUTING RESOURCES (2009 - Ongoing). SLING is a consortium for the development of a grid network and the management of dispersed computing infrastructures in Slovenia at the Academic and Research Network of Slovenia (Arnes). It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Providing access to national high-performance computing infrastructure. It uses Institutional funding for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: MTA PREMIUM POST DOCTORATE RESEARCH PROGRAMME
content: Hungary's MTA PREMIUM POST DOCTORATE RESEARCH PROGRAMME (2016 - Ongoing). The programme provides post-doctoral premium support to be used in MTA’s research centres and legal entity research institutes as well as Hungarian universities and Hungarian public institutions conducting scientific research according to their statutes for a fixed employment contract of 36 months for Hungarian and foreign researchers. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Provide to young researchers the possibility of realizing their research programs. Help to participate successfully in other programs of excellence (e.g. ERC, Momentum [Lendület] program). Support the mobility of the young generation of researchers: to draw in foreign researchers for domestic research, and to help young researchers returning from abroad be involved in the work of Hungarian places of research. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: CALL FOR PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED IN BILATERAL SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY COOPERATION
content: Hungary's CALL FOR PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED IN BILATERAL SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY COOPERATION (2021 - Ongoing). The call financed from the National Development, Research and Innovation Fund provides funding for the mobility of participants and exchange of expertise in order to foster the launch of research projects in the framework of bilateral trans-border science and technology (S&T) cooperation or the deepening of such existing collaborations. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Cover travel costs of outgoing Hungarian researchers or PhD students Cover Living costs of outgoing Hungarian researchers or PhD students in the destination country Cover Project-related travel costs of outgoing Hungarian researchers or PhD students within the destination country Dissemination of results achieved in the project Participation in international conferences It uses Project grants for public research, Labour mobility regulation and incentives as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: FUNDING INTERNSHIP PROGRAMMES FOR HUNGARIAN STUDENTS STUDYING IN THE UK, GERMANY, THE NETHERLANDS, AUSTRIA
content: Hungary's FUNDING INTERNSHIP PROGRAMMES FOR HUNGARIAN STUDENTS STUDYING IN THE UK, GERMANY, THE NETHERLANDS, AUSTRIA (2017 - Ongoing). The call aims to provide summer internship opportunities at domestic businesses and research organisations for talented Hungarian university students studying in the United Kingdom, Germany, the Netherlands and Austria It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research, Intersectoral mobility. It has the following objective(s): To enable students to participate in the research, development and innovation activities of businesses or research organisations. It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: CALL FOR RESEARCH PROJECTS BASED ON INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION
content: Hungary's CALL FOR RESEARCH PROJECTS BASED ON INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION (2007 - Ongoing). The call for project proposals based on international cooperation promotes cooperation between domestic research groups and their foreign partners, thus strengthening the international embeddedness of Hungarian science. Costs of mobility are also covered. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): The programme aims at international cooperation based on discovery research activities indicated in the research and work plan. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: CALL FOR PROPROSALS POSTDOCTORAL EXCELLENCE PROGRAMME
content: Hungary's CALL FOR PROPROSALS POSTDOCTORAL EXCELLENCE PROGRAMME (2016 - Ongoing). Funding for young scientists within six years after their Ph.D. Funding is granted based on previous achievements and scientific merit of the proposed research outlined in the grant application. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): The funding aims to provide an income for talented young researchers thereby helping them to start their research career. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: FUNDING RESEARCH TEAMS WITH INTERNATIONALLY OUTSTANDING IMPACT
content: Hungary's FUNDING RESEARCH TEAMS WITH INTERNATIONALLY OUTSTANDING IMPACT (2017 - Ongoing). Funding for research teams with significant achievements in terms of a highly cited paper published in the last three years. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): The funding aims to promote further high impact research by research groups with outstanding publication activity. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Cyprus
heading: CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
content: Cyprus's CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION (2017 - Ongoing). The centres of excellence for R&I (CoEs) are established through the Teaming action of Horizon 2020. The CoEs contribute greatly to the enhancement of the extroversion of the Cyprus R&I system and provide a framework for fostering innovation and for deepening cooperation with neighbouring countries. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Internationalisation in public research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Non-competitive research funding, Research infrastructures, Structural change of the public research system, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): Fostering research and innovation excellence in specific scientific fields/disciplines Widening participation in research and innovation processes Creating nodes for scientific cooperation in the region, enabling constructive partnerships between research institutions in the Eastern Mediterranean and the Middle East Fostering cooperation with the private and public sectors and the academia, research community It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: DFG COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH CENTRES
content:
Germany's DFG COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH CENTRES (1968 - Ongoing). Collaborative Research Centres are long-term university-based research institutions, established for up to 12 years, in which researchers work together within a multidisciplinary research programme. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): The realisation of excellent research within the group The development of priority areas and structural development at the applicant university/universities
Interdisciplinary cooperation Support of early career researchers and equal opportunity for women and men in research It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: RESEARCH NETWORKS
content:
Spain's RESEARCH NETWORKS (2013 - Ongoing). The "Research Networks" dynamization actions are activities for the creation and development of networks of research groups aimed at creating:
Thematic networks: constituted by researchers framed in the same or similar thematic area of knowledge as well as by researchers with common objectives that require a multidisciplinary approach.
Strategic networks: constituted by Spanish managers or researchers who participate in European research initiatives or who advise, expand or disseminate scientific and technological knowledge among representatives of State bodies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Enhance collaborative work in science through the creation and development of research networks. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Spain
heading: PROJECTS "EXPLORE SCIENCE" AND "EXPLORE TECHNOLOGY"
content: Spain's PROJECTS "EXPLORE SCIENCE" AND "EXPLORE TECHNOLOGY" (2013 - Ongoing). The aim of the call is to finance basic or technological research projects, whose results may represent a significant advance in knowledge, through the approach and development of new approaches or methodologies that are unattainable in another way and that, due to the nature of the knowledge generated, could have a marked transversal character. For this reason, the Explora projects have been designed to finance the exploration of heterodox and radically innovative ideas. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): The aim is to promote scientific curiosity and intellectual audacity in fundamental and applied research by promoting imaginative and radical research proposals whose viability could be considered low in conventional programs because they clash with established ideas in their field and also risky technological proposals. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: South Africa
heading: STRATEGIC HEALTH INNOVATION PARTNERSHIPS
content: South Africa's STRATEGIC HEALTH INNOVATION PARTNERSHIPS (2008 - Ongoing). SHIP is a new innovative product development programme within the South African Medical Research Council, that has the goal of developing new or improved diagnostics, vaccines, prevention strategies and treatments to address South Africa’s major health problems. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): seek, manage and fund multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional product research, development and innovation projects from discovery to proof-of-concept enhance the capacity of South African science in the research and development of novel or improved drugs, vaccines, and other biological, diagnostics and medical devices in the identified priority diseases facilitate, through partnerships with local universities, science councils and the private sector, the transfer of research outputs into improved health outcomes and/or social benefit develop pathways to facilitate the seamless movement of new products and services from the laboratory to the marketplace lead the world in addressing fundamental scientific gaps in addressing these diseases. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: TECHNOLOGY INNOVATION AGENCY PROGRAMMES
content: South Africa's TECHNOLOGY INNOVATION AGENCY PROGRAMMES (2008 - Ongoing). TIA is a national public entity that serves as the key institutional intervention to bridge the innovation chasm between research and development from higher education institutions, science councils, public entities, and private sector, and commercialisation. TIA established the following funds: the Seed Fund, the Technology Development Fund and the Commercialisation Support Fund. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): TIA’s focus is on technology development; from proof of concept to the pre commercialisation. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING OF PUBLIC RESEARCH INSTITUTES
content: Spain's INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING OF PUBLIC RESEARCH INSTITUTES (1986 - Ongoing). Institutional funding is distributed through block funding based on historical allocation. Performance-based mechanisms do not apply. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To fund the salaries of researchers with permanent contracts, current costs and other operational costs such as infrastructures. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: SOUTH AFRICAN RESEARCH CHAIRS INITIATIVE
content: South Africa's SOUTH AFRICAN RESEARCH CHAIRS INITIATIVE (2006 - Ongoing). SARChI is designed to attract and retain excellence in research and innovation at South African public universities through the establishment of Research Chairs at public universities in South Africa with a long-term investment trajectory of up to fifteen years. It is part of the following theme(s): Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Non-competitive research funding, Research and innovation for society strategy, Research careers, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To strengthen and improve research and innovation capacity of public universities for producing high quality postgraduate students and research and innovation outputs Expand the scientific research and innovation capacity of South Africa Improve South Africa’s international research and innovation competitiveness while responding to social and economic challenges of the country Create research career pathways for young and mid-career researchers, with a strong research, innovation and human capital development output trajectory. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED INSTITUTIONS DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
content: South Africa's HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED INSTITUTIONS DEVELOPMENT GRANTS (2015 - Ongoing). The Department of Higher Education and Training has recently established the historically disadvantaged institutions development grants ring-fenced for competition between similar type of institutions. This grant deems disadvantaged students to be African and Coloured students who are South African citizens. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding.
