It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: NATIONAL RESEARCH FOUNDATION FUNDING INSTRUMENTS
content: South Africa's NATIONAL RESEARCH FOUNDATION FUNDING INSTRUMENTS (1998 - Ongoing). The NRF promotes and supports research through funding, human resource development and the provision of National Research Facilities in all fields of natural and social sciences, humanities and technology. It is part of the following theme(s): International mobility of human resources, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The NRF provides services to the research community especially at Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) and Science Councils, with a view to promote high-level human capital development. The NRF aims to uphold excellence in all its investments in knowledge, people and infrastructure. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: CIFAR RESEARCH PROGRAM AND KNOWLEDGE MOBILIZATION ACTIVITIES
content: Canada's CIFAR RESEARCH PROGRAM AND KNOWLEDGE MOBILIZATION ACTIVITIES (2017 - Ongoing). The canadian institute for advanced research CIFAR identifies and selects questions and scientific themes of importance through a competitive process. It then facilitates the establishment and supports the continued work of global research networks (“CIFAR programs”) focused on advanced, fundamental research aimed at addressing these important challenges. Research networks are supported for five-year renewable terms, with renewal informed by expert, peer-reviewed, advice. It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Support the advancement of scientific research with a specific focus on fostering international, interdisciplinary collaboration and high risk-high impact research It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: CATALYST FUNDING
content: Canada's CATALYST FUNDING (2017 - Ongoing). Catalyst funds are awarded to high-risk/high-reward research projects championed by Canadian Institute for Advanced Research fellows It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Support high-risk/high-reward research It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Malta
heading: FUNDING FROM UNIVERSITY OF MALTA RESEARCH, INNOVATION AND DEVELOPMENT TRUST
content: Malta's FUNDING FROM UNIVERSITY OF MALTA RESEARCH, INNOVATION AND DEVELOPMENT TRUST (2011 - Ongoing). RIDT aims to strengthen investment in high-calibre research and development across every faculty and department within the University, and on a national level, and to foster the commercial exploitation of this research. It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): furthering the advancement of research, innovation and development in all areas of study, knowledge and activity in Malta. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Serbia
heading: PROGRAM FOR EXCELLENT PROJECTS OF YOUNG RESEARCHERS
content: Serbia's PROGRAM FOR EXCELLENT PROJECTS OF YOUNG RESEARCHERS (2019 - Ongoing). PROMIS is the first funding instrument launched by the newly established Science Fund of the Republic of Serbia and it provides funding opportunities for young researchers on a competitive basis. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Including excellent young researchers in scientific research projects Improving the professional capacities of young researchers early in their careers Enabling young PhDs to manage their own research projects Improving the capacity of young researchers to apply for other national and international sources of funding (EU in particular) Creating new project teams Supporting excellent ideas and research that will positively effect society and the economy It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Serbia
heading: PROGRAM FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROJECTS IN THE AREA OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
content: Serbia's PROGRAM FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROJECTS IN THE AREA OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (2020 - Ongoing). This program supports research in the areas of general AI, machine learning, natural language processing, planning, knowledge reasoning, computer vision and speech communication and intelligent systems. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Supporting excellence and relevance of scientific research in the area of artificial intelligence Fostering the application of research results in AI in the private sector Developing human resources in the AI sector It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Serbia
heading: PROGRAM FOR THE COOPERATION OF SERBIAN SCIENCE WITH DIASPORA
content: Serbia's PROGRAM FOR THE COOPERATION OF SERBIAN SCIENCE WITH DIASPORA (2019 - Ongoing). This instrument of the Science Fund provides vouchers for researchers to travel and spend time in research institutions abroad with the objective of establishing collaboration with diaspora researchers (in research institutions or the private sector), It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Establishing collaboration with diaspora for the purpose of improving, exchanging knowledge and establishing or improving collaboration, joint work on scientific research problems and challenges, publishing joint papers or patents, receiving supporting in developing new services, commercialization and technology transfer and preparing joint project proposals for funding sources outside of Serbia. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Serbia
heading: SPECIAL RESEARCH PROGRAM FOR COVID-19
content: Serbia's SPECIAL RESEARCH PROGRAM FOR COVID-19 (2020 - Ongoing). As a response to the global COVID-19 pandemic, the Science Fund of the Republic of Serbia launched a special call for proposals for research aimed at solving or mitigated health and other consequences of the pandemic. Due to special circumstances, an expedited evaluation procedure for introduced. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To finance projects which will contribute to an efficient scientific response to the COVID-19 pandemic and enable better preparedness and societal response to the pandemic. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Serbia
heading: RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP
content: Serbia's RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP (2018 - Ongoing). This is the first Research Infrastructure Roadmap adopted in Serbia which showcases existing RIs in the country and sets a path for future RI development. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To define the principles of research infrastructure development and usage, equipment sharing, to showcase existing research infrastructures and to establish mechanisms for selection of future investments. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Montenegro
heading: Grants for Scientific Research Projects
content: Montenegro's Grants for Scientific Research Projects (2018 - Ongoing). Grants for scientific research projects are allocated on a competitive basis to projects in line with the priorities of the Strategy for scientific research activities: energy, ICT, new materials, products and services, medicine and health, agriculture and food production, sustainable development and tourism and science, education and identity. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Increasing the capacity of research teams in Montenegro in order to strengthen quality and sustainable partnerships and support excellence with the goal of contributing to the development of a knowledge based society and international competitiveness. Engaging young researchers (PhDs and post-docs) on projects to prevent brain drain and improve research capacities of Montengro's scientific research institutions. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Montenegro
heading: Grants for establishing Centres of Excellence
content: Montenegro's Grants for establishing Centres of Excellence (2012 - Ongoing). Research carried out in the previous period in Montenegro in certain domains has achieved solid international recognition in terms of quality. The intention behind creating new centres of excellence is to use the financing period to create conditions for a significant increase in research activity and its further intensification in the promising areas for Montenegro, defined by the Strategy of Scientific Research Activity and the Smart Specialisation Strategy, as well as by other national and local policies and plans. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Creating or significantly improving products or services for a precisely defined economic branch, which can help existing companies in Montenegro to improve their international competitiveness by integrating advanced scientific concepts, technologies and innovations into traditional economic sectors. Creating a research base for a priority state or local policy that would provide the public sector with the knowledge and specific services needed in the transformation of society (e.g. digital society, energy efficient cities, ecological Montenegro, etc.), and contribute to the creation of future markets for innovative services and products. Creating a scientific research area in Montenegro that has the potential for exceptional results on the global level, which would provide a competitive advantage to the national economy and a better position of Montenegrin science on the global stage, leading also to the possibility of exponential growth in science and innovation. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Montenegro
heading: Grants for co-financing scientific research activities
content: Montenegro's Grants for co-financing scientific research activities (2010 - Ongoing). This instrument represents one of the key mechanisms for supporting the scientific research community in Montenegro in areas that are most important. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): This scheme is one of the key mechanisms for providing support to the scientific research community, in those domains where Montenegrin scientists and researchers need it the most. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Montenegro
heading: Programme for implementation of Open Science principles in Montenegro
content: Montenegro's Programme for implementation of Open Science principles in Montenegro (2020 - Ongoing). In 2020 the Ministry of Science adopted a Programme for implementation of Open Science principles in Montenegro with the Action Plan (2020-2022). It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Harmonization and implementation of the "Open Science" principles with the EU Open Science Action Plan It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Montenegro
heading: South East European International Institute for Sustainable Technologies
content: Montenegro's South East European International Institute for Sustainable Technologies (2017 - Ongoing). SEEIIST is a regional initiative led by Montenegro to create a regional research infrastructure It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Science for Peace Scientific Excellence International Collaboration Sustainable development of society Education Technology Transfer, Development of powerful digital network and high performance computing and Big Data handling It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Republic of North Macedonia
heading: Education Strategy
content: Republic of North Macedonia's Education Strategy (2018 - Ongoing). The Education Strategy of the Republic of Macedonia for 2018-2025 is the basis of the activities of the institutions in the Republic of Macedonia in the field of education for the period till 2025. It builds on the current state in the educational system and aims at their gradual development according to the established priorities. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): Return of the autonomy of universities, including academic freedom, and preventing possibilities to pressurise members of the academic community; Improvement of education system infrastructure with a purpose to increase inclusiveness, access,energy efficacy and digitalisation; Standardisation of the activity of the higher education system in line with the European criteria and ensuring the rule of law while establishing and operationalisation of higher education institutions; It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: ACTION PLAN FOR DIGITALISATION AND AI IN MOBILITY
content: Germany's ACTION PLAN FOR DIGITALISATION AND AI IN MOBILITY (2018 - Ongoing). To implement the Federal Government's national AI strategy, BMVI has drawn up the action plan "Digitalization and AI in Mobility". It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): To make "Mobility 4.0" effective and sustainable by exploiting the great efficiency potential of digital innovations and artificial intelligence in mobility for all modes of transport and for the entire mobility system with regards to the climate targets and the European Green Deal. To allow digital applications and AI to develop their full potential in mobility and to make them tangible for citizens. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Networking and collaborative platforms, Centres of excellence grants, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: REALITY LAB FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN CIVIL PROTECTION
content: Germany's REALITY LAB FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN CIVIL PROTECTION (2019 - Ongoing). As a living lab, the Reality Lab for Artificial Intelligence in Civil Protection, it aims to offer an interface between the Security Research Community, AI researchers and industry. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Ethics of emerging technologies, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research infrastructures, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): To test and develop solutions that make AI based technologies accessible and useable for practitioners/responders. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: REAL-WORLD TEST FIELD FOR DIGITAL MOBILITY
content: Germany's REAL-WORLD TEST FIELD FOR DIGITAL MOBILITY (2020 - Ongoing). nan It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation. It has the following objective(s): To test and demonstrate the potential of digitalization for sustainable, efficient and user-centered mobility. It uses Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: THE 11TH DEVELOPMENT PLAN OF TURKEY- AI TECHNOLOGIES
content: Türkiye's THE 11TH DEVELOPMENT PLAN OF TURKEY- AI TECHNOLOGIES (2019 - Ongoing). Published by the Presidency of the Republic of Turkey, the Development Plan aims to transform Turkey’s economic structure and improve the welfare of its people, including through breakthroughs in technology and innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To improve the capacity to produce and use knowledge by establishing an efficiently functioning research and innovation ecosystem. To increase R&D and innovation activities that would support high value-added products and services. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Portugal
heading: EURO HPC SUPERCOMPUTER
content: Portugal's EURO HPC SUPERCOMPUTER (2020 - Ongoing). The European High Performance Computing Joint Undertaking (EuroHPC JU) and the Minho Advanced Computing Centre (MACC) have launched a call for tender for the procurement of a petascale supercomputer, capable of executing more than one Petaflop, or 1 million billion calculations per second. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To foster better science and enhance innovation in Europe by providing access to leading edge HPC infrastructures and services to a wide range of users from the research and scientific community as well as the industry and the public sector. To develop top-of-the-range exascale supercomputers for processing big data, based on European technology. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Australia
heading: CSIRO'S MACHINE LEARNING AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE FUTURE SCIENCE PLATFORM
content: Australia's CSIRO'S MACHINE LEARNING AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE FUTURE SCIENCE PLATFORM (2018 - Ongoing). The MLAI FSP's cross disciplinary teams solve fundamental problems in scientific and data-driven research applications, creating a new ongoing capability within CSIRO to address core research challenges for the benefit of Australia. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Ethics of emerging technologies, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): To deliver lasting impact to areas of strategic interest across CSIRO by exploiting and advancing ML/AI research. To make the platform and the people we train to become a capability that fundamentally changes the way CSIRO undertakes core research challenges. To deliver new machine learning and artificial intelligence solutions to age-old problems, novel solutions, and platforms for emerging challenges in a data driven world. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: Competition for financing/co-financing scientific-research and research-development projects in FBiH
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's Competition for financing/co-financing scientific-research and research-development projects in FBiH (2003 - Ongoing). Every year, the FBiH Ministry of Education and Science announces a competition for financing / co-financing scientific-research and research-development projects in the FBiH. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Project-based funding of projects in the field of technical, biotechnical, humanities, social sciences, natural sciences and biomedicine and health. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: Competition for co-financing scientific research activities in RS
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's Competition for co-financing scientific research activities in RS (2018 - Ongoing). The Ministry of science, technology, higher education and information society organizes an annual call for proposals for co-financing research activities in basic, applied and development research It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Competitive project-based funding for research activities. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: Roadmap of Research Infrastructures in the Republic of Srpska
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's Roadmap of Research Infrastructures in the Republic of Srpska (2019 - Ongoing). Research Infrastructures Roadmap is a key strategic document for improvement of Scientific and research system in the Republic of Srpska and a tool for the identification of research potential in order to direct further development of research infrastructures. It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Identification of existing RIs in the Republic of Srpska, together with centres and laboratories which are candidates for list of national RIs, belongs to national and/or regional level RIs. Ensuring that investments in RIs from public sources, i.e. from budget of the ministries in charge for research and innovation in the Republic of Srpska, in general, are in line with national R&I priorities. Ensuring that identification of use of and benefits from identified existing RIs in the Republic of Srpska, together with centres and laboratories which are candidates for list of national RIs, must be part of regular monitoring and evaluation of research and academic sector in the Republic of Srpska. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: HUMAN-CENTERED NATIONAL GUIDELINES FOR AI ETHICS
content: Korea's HUMAN-CENTERED NATIONAL GUIDELINES FOR AI ETHICS (2020 - Ongoing). Ethical standards for AI for the development and use of trustworthy artificial intelligence. It is part of the following theme(s): Ethics of emerging technologies, High-risk high-reward research, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Research integrity and reproducibility, Science, technology and innovation culture. It has the following objective(s): Build a foundation for social deliberation and discussion to establish artificial intelligence ethics. Secure social trust in artificial intelligence technology. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Science and technology regulation, Standards and certification for technology development and adoption, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments.

title: Ukraine
heading: Roadmap on integration of scientific and innovation system of Ukraine into European Research Area
content: Ukraine's Roadmap on integration of scientific and innovation system of Ukraine into European Research Area (2021 - Ongoing). Ukrainian ERA Roadmap is a strategic document that contains precise list of actions, instruments and indicators under eight priority areas, defined by the EU for effective implementation of the European Research Area It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Ukrainian ERA Roadmap was designed in order to ensure comprehensive and effective integration of research and innovation system of Ukraine into European Research Area It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Ukraine
heading: State order for scientific and technical (experimental) developments and scientific and technical products
content:
Ukraine's State order for scientific and technical (experimental) developments and scientific and technical products (1996 - Ongoing). The list of the most important scientific and technical (experimental) developments in priority directions of development of science and technology within the framework of the state order for the most important scientific and technical (experimental) developments and scientific and technical products.
The list is updated annually. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Implementation of scientific and technical (experimental) developments to meet the priority state needs. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research, Tax or social contributions relief for firms investing in R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Ukraine
heading: Contest of projects of scientific works and scientific-technical (experimental) developments of young scientists
content:
Ukraine's Contest of projects of scientific works and scientific-technical (experimental) developments of young scientists (2016 - Ongoing). The Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine conducts a competitive selection of projects of scientific works, scientific-technical (experimental) developments of young scientists, working (studying) in higher educational institutions, scientific institutions, related to the management of the MES, further scientific works and scientific-technical (experimental) developments at the expense of the general fund of the state budget and their management.
The competition is held once a year. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The purpose of the Contest is to provide support for young scientists, creation of research groups by them to solve urgent problematic issues, formation of creative generation of young scientists in various fields of science, competitive in the international labor market, consolidation of talented young scientists in the scientific sphere and development of scientific career by young scientists. The results of the Contest are the basis for the works and developments. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: China
heading: NATIONAL BASIC RESEARCH PROGRAMME (973 PROGRAMME)
content: China's NATIONAL BASIC RESEARCH PROGRAMME (973 PROGRAMME) (1997 - Ongoing). The National Basic Research Programme aims to develop basic research, innovation and technologies in line with national targets for economic and social development. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The National Basic Research Programme (973 Programme) is an on-going keystone research programme aimed to develop basic research, innovation and technologies in line with national targets for economic and social development. Its strategic objectives are to stimulate original innovations and address scientific issues important for national socio-economic growth. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: China
heading: NATIONAL HIGH TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMME (863 PROGRAMME)
content: China's NATIONAL HIGH TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMME (863 PROGRAMME) (1986 - Ongoing). The National High Technology Programme (863 Programme) aims to stimulate the development of advanced technologies in fields that are key for Chinas socio-economic development. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To establish foundations for high technology industries in important fields for Chinas national development. To support R&D in selected key technologies. To nurture technological expertise. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: China
heading: KNOWLEDGE INNOVATION PROGRAMME
content: China's KNOWLEDGE INNOVATION PROGRAMME (1998 - Ongoing). The Knowledge Innovation Programme (KIP) allocates additional resources to the most promising institutes and research fields of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) to improve R&D performance and capability. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, International STI governance policy, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To increase commercialisation of research outputs. To support research and innovation in CAS institutes. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Technology extension and business advisory services, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: China
heading: R&D INFRASTRUCTURE AND FACILITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME
content: China's R&D INFRASTRUCTURE AND FACILITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME (2005 - Ongoing). The Programme aims to adjust, enrich, and strengthen S&T capacity of national S&T research centres and reinforce the national research base. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide support to various S&T activities involving basic data and national standards, resource specimens, etc. The priority of the programme is the provision of a platform for the S&T research community (including both public and private sector) to share the use of state-funded S&T infrastructure. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: China
heading: MEDIUM AND LONG-TERM PLAN FOR KEY NATIONAL TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE CONSTRUCTION
content: China's MEDIUM AND LONG-TERM PLAN FOR KEY NATIONAL TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE CONSTRUCTION (2012 - Ongoing). Public research infrastructures will be developed in life science, environmental science, materials science, space science and other fields by the Medium and Long-Term Plan for Key National Technology Infrastructure Construction (2012-2030). It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To improve research infrastructure of public research organisations and HEIs in the fields of environmental studies, energy studies, material studies, nuclear physics, astronomy and engineering. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Japan
heading: JAPAN SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY AGENCY
content: Japan's JAPAN SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY AGENCY (1957 - Ongoing). The Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST) is one of the core institutions responsible for the implementation of science and technology policy in Japan, including the government’s Science and Technology Basic Plan. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To achieve innovation in science and technology through creative research and development. To maximize research outcomes by managing research resources on the virtual network. To develop the nation’s infrastructure for science and technology to accelerate innovation in science and technology. It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: Japan
heading: NEW ENERGY INDUSTRIAL TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT ORGANISATION
content: Japan's NEW ENERGY INDUSTRIAL TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT ORGANISATION (1980 - Ongoing). The New Energy Industrial Technology Development Organisation (NEDO) provides funding on targeted technology development which involves the co-operation of universities, industry and other research actors. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Addressing energy and global environmental problems: NEDO promotes greater utilization of new energy and improved energy conservation. NEDO also contributes to a stable energy supply and the resolution of global environmental problems. Enhancing industrial technology: With the aim of raising the level of industrial technology, NEDO pursues research and development of advanced new technology. NEDO provides funding on targeted technology development which involves the co-operation of universities, industry and other research actors. It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: POLICE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY CRIME UNIT
content: United Kingdom's POLICE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY CRIME UNIT (2013 - Ongoing). The Police Intellectual Property Crime Unit (PIPCU) is an operationally independent law enforcement unit dedicated to tackling serious and organised intellectual property crime (counterfeiting and piracy) affecting physical and digital goods. It is part of the following theme(s): Intellectual property rights in public research, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): PIPCU is dedicated to tackling serious and organised intellectual property crime (counterfeiting and piracy) affecting physical and digital goods. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Slovenia
heading: INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH PROJECTS
content: Slovenia's INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH PROJECTS (2005 - Ongoing). Interdisciplinary research projects include the co-funding of basic, applicative, postdoctoral projects, and targeted research programme projects which are evaluated/propsed for funding by Interdisciplinary Research Council (ARRS) as atypical, multi or interdisciplinary projects not fitting within the traditional science disciplines. The share of funds for interdisciplinary research projects is steadily increasing from 2007. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): ARRS established Interdisciplinary Research Council to encourage interdisciplinary research. It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Wallonia
heading: OP IN PROGRAMME
content: Belgium - Wallonia's OP IN PROGRAMME (2012 - Ongoing). Support for organisational innovation or corporate process innovation It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): OP IN aims to grant financial support to organisational and/or process innovation projects It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: Technology Transfer Offices (TTOs) and Knowledge Transfer Offices (KTOs)
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's Technology Transfer Offices (TTOs) and Knowledge Transfer Offices (KTOs) (2006 - Ongoing). Innoviris funds several Technology Transfer Offices (TTOs) or Knowledge Transfer Office (KTOs) that facilitate exchanges between academia and business and promote the transfer of innovative ideas to the business sector. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Non-competitive research funding, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Valorisation of scientific results (technology transfer) Connecting academia and the business sector Managing intellectual property Supporting project development (e.g. identification of partners) It uses Technology extension and business advisory services as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: Applied PHD
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's Applied PHD (2011 - Ongoing). Funding of PhD students involved in public-private collaborative projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research, Intersectoral mobility, Research careers, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Applied PHD is a measure which encourages doctoral students to carry out their PhD in collaboration with a Brussels enterprise, through collaborative projects between the academic and private sector. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: South Africa
heading: CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE
content: South Africa's CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE (2004 - Ongoing). The CoEs are physical or virtual centres of research that concentrate existing research excellence and capacity and resources to enable researchers to collaborate across disciplines and institutions on long-term projects that are locally relevant and internationally competitive in order to enhance the pursuit of research excellence and capacity development. The focus of the programme is on basic research, human capital development and knowledge generation/production. While targeted at funding basic research per se, the Centres of Excellence (CoE) programme provides subvention/top-up salaries to key research and administrative staff with the view to attaining a relatively satisfied R&D workforce. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Embedding sex- and gender-specific analysis in research, Non-competitive research funding, Research and innovation for society strategy, Research careers, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The Centres of Excellence (CoEs) programme aims to consolidate all the available human capital, infrastructure and financial resources towards focused multi- and inter-disciplinary research projects across different institutions (universities, science councils and other PRIs). The CoE programme targets, in an integrated manner, the development of the new generation of researchers, by creating a platform for long term interdisciplinary research collaboration. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: NRF - NATIONAL NANOTECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT PROGRAMME
content: South Africa's NRF - NATIONAL NANOTECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT PROGRAMME (2015 - Ongoing). The National Research Foundations National Nanotechnology Equipment Programme is a dedicated source of funding for the purchase or development of state-of-the-art research equipment in the nanotechnology field. The NNEP forms part of the implementation of the NNS, which is directed at positioning South Africa as a player in this rapidly advancing area of science and technology, by supporting the acquisition of research equipment for the analysis and characterisation of nanomaterials. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Stimulate and support increased nanotechnology research by investing strategically in equipment for the characterisation of nanomaterials in support of the NNS; Build human resource capacity and infrastructure capacity in the area of nanoscience and nanotechnology Promote regional, national and international research collaborations in nanoscienceand nanotechnology Encourage access to equipment for research and training by postgraduate students Support the creation of new and novel devices for the application of nanotechnology in various areas Support and strengthen the strategic objectives of the NNS. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Peru
heading: FONDECYT FUNDS FOR SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT FOR PUBLIC UNIVERSITY LABORATORIES
content: Peru's FONDECYT FUNDS FOR SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT FOR PUBLIC UNIVERSITY LABORATORIES (2015 - Ongoing). FONDECYT, with funds transferred by the Ministry of Education (MINEDU), finances up to 90% of the total acquisition cost of scientific equipment for public university laboratories. The equipment should cost at least PEN S/. 600,000.00 and maximum PEN S/. 1250,000.00. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Upgrade the equipment of public universities. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Poland
heading: POLISH ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Poland's POLISH ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2011 - Ongoing). The Polish Roadmap for Research Infrastructures is a strategic document to guide the development of future research initiatives of a national and international scale. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The purpose of the Polish Roadmap for Research Infrastructures is to guide the development of future research infrastructure initiatives of a national and international scale in a long-term. At the same time, it corresponds to the European approach of linking national research strategies with the European ones under the auspices of the European Strategy Forum on Research Infrastructures (ESFRI). As an equivalent of the ESFRI, Roadmap PRRI is open for all scientific domains. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Poland
heading: MECHANISM FOR FINANCING RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE AND OPERATING RESEARCH UNITS
content: Poland's MECHANISM FOR FINANCING RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE AND OPERATING RESEARCH UNITS (2013 - Ongoing). On 6 August 2013, the Council of Ministers adopted a draft law concerning the acquisition of CIT tax by firms of limited partnerships and limited joint-stock. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): nan It uses Tax or social contributions relief for firms investing in R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: European Union
heading: EUROPEAN BATTERY INNOVATION PROJECT
content: European Union's EUROPEAN BATTERY INNOVATION PROJECT (2021 - Ongoing). The second Important Project of Common European Interest (IPCEI) in battery value chain to complement research and innovation of the first IPCEI in the battery value chain, which is expected to contribute to the development of a whole set of new technological breakthroughs, including different cell chemistries and novel production processes, and other innovations in the battery value chain, in addition to what will be achieved thanks to the first battery IPCEI. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Green energy transitions, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To encourage Member States to support highly innovative projects that make a clear contribution to economic growth, jobs and competitiveness so that they will provide incentives to companies to carry out the investment. To support research and innovation in the battery value chain. To develop technologies and processes that go beyond current technology and will allow major improvements in performance, safety and environmental impact. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Multi-annual institutional funding for research programme in public research institutes and universities
content: Croatia's Multi-annual institutional funding for research programme in public research institutes and universities (2013 - Ongoing). This initiative allowed public research institutes and universities to benefit from multi-annual institutional funding for research, with funding amounts determined on the basis of institutional performance indicators. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): Promote an efficient and responsible public research system It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Establishment of integrated doctoral degree programmes and/or doctoral schools
content: Croatia's Establishment of integrated doctoral degree programmes and/or doctoral schools (2014 - Ongoing). Founding integrated doctoral degree programmes and/or doctoral schools is one of the aims pointed out in UniRi Strategy 2014-20. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): By 2020. there should be 30% of doctorates awarded through integrated doctoral degree programmes/schools It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Croatian Web Archive
content: Croatia's Croatian Web Archive (2004 - Ongoing). This initiative provides a collection of web resources as part of the Croatian national heritage It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Long-term preservation of web resources as part of the Croatian national heritage It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Digital Academic Repository
content: Croatia's Digital Academic Repository (2010 - Ongoing). This initiative provides access to digital versions of the oldest doctoral and master theses from Croatian universities It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide open access to Croatian doctoral and master theses It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: National Theses Repository
content: Croatia's National Theses Repository (2015 - Ongoing). This initiative provides access to digital versions of scientific research, intellectual and creative property of Croatian scientific institutions It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide open access to scientific research, intellectual and creative property of Croatian scientific institutions It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Open access mandate for thesis and dissertations (in the Act on scientific activity and higher education)
content: Croatia's Open access mandate for thesis and dissertations (in the Act on scientific activity and higher education) (2013 - Ongoing). Croatian Law on science and higher education mandates that all higher education theses should be available in open access in corresponding university library repository. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To increase the availability of Croatian higher education thesis and dissertations (in open access) It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Croatia
heading: Strategic Committee for Reserach Infrastructure
content:
Croatia's Strategic Committee for Reserach Infrastructure (2015 - Ongoing). Strategic Committee for Reserach Infrastructure is a a body of prominent and independent experts in particular fields of science that counsel the Minister of Science, Education and Sports on different issues related to research infrastructure in Croatia.
New members have been apointed in 2017. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Duties and objectives of the Committee: recommending guidelines for development of national research infrastructures in Croatia and linking institutions in planning and implementation of large infrastructure projects of national importance with the purpose of increasing investment efficiency suggesting annual plan for procurement and investment in servicing of research infrastructure in order to assist planning of national budget, including an adequate human resources encouraging setting of transparent valuation system of infrastructure projects, equipment procurement projects and projects envisaging usage of foreign or international infrastructures considering requests for establishment of new or joining existing ESFRI projects and ERICs. counselling Croatian ESFRI delegates
considering requests and providing recommendations for joining other international infrastructure projects/institutions in line with the set criteria
recommending guidelines for development of measures that will entice cooperation of academia and industry in financing new equipment and joint usage of research infrastructure
suggesting revision of Croatian research and innovation infrastructure Roadmap in line with the relevant strategic documents on the national and European level
fostering networking activities and participating in providing information to research community, business sector and public on relevance and availability of research infrastructure
assessing relevance of joining international research infrastructures and memberships financing It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Israel
heading: ADVISORY COMMITTEE FOR CENTRAL RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THE ACADEMY
content: Israel's ADVISORY COMMITTEE FOR CENTRAL RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THE ACADEMY (2013 - Ongoing). The committee, using area-focused sub-committees, prepared a set of prioritized recommendation for its establishment. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To prepare a mapping of existing research infrastructures. To create a recommendation for a prioritized roadmap of necessary infrastructures, as well as a mechanism for updating them regularly. To regularly examine proposals and opportunities for setting up of new infrastructures and establishing partnerships in existing international infrastructures. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Australia
heading: STRATEGIC ROADMAP FOR AUSTRALIAN RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Australia's STRATEGIC ROADMAP FOR AUSTRALIAN RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE (2016 - Ongoing). The National Research Infrastructure Roadmap identifies priority research infrastructure for the coming decade in areas that will underpin research in which Australia can and needs to excel, to deliver long-term national benefit and foster strategic international partnerships. It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide advice to the Australian Government on future priorities for strategic investment in those key national research infrastructure capabilities that would support and develop Australia’s research capacity and underpin research and innovation outcomes over the next five to ten years. To work closely with the research sector, stakeholders and experts on identifying strategic priorities and future planning for national research infrastructure (NRI) facilities. To conduct regular priority setting and investment planning, acknowledging technology and scientific changes over time. To provide guidance to Government to support critical national research infrastructure facilities, such as projects within the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS), to operate with long term certainty. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Australia
heading: ARC CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE
content:
Australia's ARC CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE (2003 - Ongoing). ARC Centres of Excellence involve significant collaboration which allows the complementary research resources of universities, publicly funded research organisations, other research bodies, governments and businesses to be concentrated to support outstanding research. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, High-risk high-reward research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To undertake highly innovative and potentially transformational research that aims to achieve international standing in the fields of research envisaged and leads to a significant advancement of capabilities and knowledge. To link existing Australian research strengths and build critical mass with new capacity for interdisciplinary, collaborative approaches to address the most challenging and significant research problems. To develop relationships and build new networks with major national and international centres and research programs to help strengthen research, achieve global competitiveness and gain recognition for Australian research. To build Australia’s human capacity in a range of research areas by attracting and retaining, from within Australia and abroad, researchers of high international standing as well as the most promising research students. To provide high-quality postgraduate and postdoctoral training environments for the next generation of researchers. To offer Australian researchers opportunities to work on large-scale problems over long periods of time.

To establish Centres that have an impact on the wider community through interaction with higher education institutes, governments, industry and the private and non-profit sector. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Austria
heading: BENEFIT PROGRAMME (INTELLIGENT TECHNOLOGIES FOR OLDER PEOPLE)
content: Austria's BENEFIT PROGRAMME (INTELLIGENT TECHNOLOGIES FOR OLDER PEOPLE) (2008 - Ongoing). The Austrian programme "benefit” promotes research and development of ICT products and services aimed at maintaining and improving the quality of life of older people and helping them to live more independently as long as possible. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Digital transformation of firms. It has the following objective(s): Enhancing innovation for improving the quality of life of older people It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Austria
heading: RESEARCH PROGRAMME EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCES
content: Austria's RESEARCH PROGRAMME EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCES (2013 - Ongoing). ESS supports interdisciplinary, multidisciplinary and transdisciplinary projects, long-term research projects and projects on currently little investigated themes with a scientific pioneering function in the study of the Earth System. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Fill in gaps in the Austrian research landscape exploring the system of earth. Support of interdisciplinary projects, long-term research projects and pioneering research. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Austria
heading: ACDH AUSTRIAN CENTRE FOR DIGITAL HUMANITIES
content: Austria's ACDH AUSTRIAN CENTRE FOR DIGITAL HUMANITIES (2014 - Ongoing). The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities (ACDH) is a centre for digital methods and repositories in the humanities. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To foster digital methods in the various fields of the humanities. To offer a portfolio of services, including a repository for digital language resources. To host and publish data. To develop software. To establish a tightly knit network of specialised knowledge centres to offer advice and guidance to the research community. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: INCENTIVE SYSTEM FOR TECHNOLOGICAL R&D IN COMPANIES (SI I&DT) - CO-PROMOTION PROJECTS
content: Portugal's INCENTIVE SYSTEM FOR TECHNOLOGICAL R&D IN COMPANIES (SI I&DT) - CO-PROMOTION PROJECTS (2014 - Ongoing). The Incentive System for Research & Technological Development in Companies (SI I&DT) is one of three incentive systems set up for the period 2014-2020 to deal with the different stages of development and integration of companies in the global market. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The Incentive System for Research & Technological Development in Companies (SI I&DT) – Co- Promotion Projects aims at intensifying national R&D efforts and creating new knowledge in order to increase companies competitiveness and foster articulation among them and between these and organisations in the S&T System. Therefore, this initiative intends to accelerate the diffusion, the transfer and use of technologies, knowledge and R&D results to be used in the productive process. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Costa Rica
heading: INCENTIVES FUND FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT
content: Costa Rica's INCENTIVES FUND FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT (2016 - Ongoing). Costa Ricans (individuals and legal entities) can make use of these funds for additional financial aid grants, according to Law No. 7169 which benefits graduate students, researchers, private, public and academic institutions of higher education among others. The Incentives Fund aims to provide financial support to plans, programmes and projects aimed at contributing to the achievement of STI policy objectives set by institutional planning instruments. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Internationalisation in public research, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Provide financial budget to plans, programs and projects developed under the objectives and scientific, technological and innovation policies established in the National Plan for Science, Technology and Innovation. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Costa Rica
heading: VENTURE FUND FOR RESEARCH
content: Costa Rica's VENTURE FUND FOR RESEARCH (2013 - Ongoing). The Venture Fund for Research (FORINVES) is a fund established under the agreement signed between Costa Rica and the Inter-American Development Bank on 1988, ratified by Law No. 7099. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Competitive research funding, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The Venture Fund for Research (FORINVES) aimed to encourage and support R&D activity in Costa Rica. The fund is aimed at Costa Rican, public and private nonprofit legal entities that present and develop R&D proposals, these can be submitted individually or jointly by two or more entities. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Costa Rica
heading: NATIONAL CENTRE FOR BIOTECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION
content: Costa Rica's NATIONAL CENTRE FOR BIOTECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION (2007 - Ongoing). CENIBIOT aims to contribute to Costa Ricas economic and social development by integrating biotechnology and the agro-industry sector. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To integrate biotechnology in the agroindustry sector. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: BILATERAL S&T AGREEMENTS
content: Hungary's BILATERAL S&T AGREEMENTS (1986 - Ongoing). Hungary has signed 36 intergovernmental and 10 interinstitutional STI agreements so far. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International STI governance policy. It has the following objective(s): The primary objective of bilateral STI cooperation agreements is to provide a general framework for supporting bilateral scientific cooperation by grants, mobility financing, organisation of S&T seminars and workshops. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: PERFORMANCE BASED OVERHEAD FUNDING IN PUBLICLY FUNDED R&D PROJECTS
content: Türkiye's PERFORMANCE BASED OVERHEAD FUNDING IN PUBLICLY FUNDED R&D PROJECTS (2014 - Ongoing). Regarding the academic RDI support programs of TUBITAK, the legislation for funded RDI project overheads has been updated in a way to increase according to the performance of the institution. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To enhance R&D performances of universities. to trigger R&D and innovation based activities within the academic institutions. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: INCENTIVE PROGRAM FOR INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS
content: Türkiye's INCENTIVE PROGRAM FOR INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS (1993 - Ongoing). TÜBİTAK provides financial incentives to academic researchers for their international academic publications since 1993 It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To increase the impact and visibility of international publications originating from Turkey. It uses Science and innovation challenges, prizes and awards as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: NATIONAL NEW IDEAS AND PRODUCTS R&D FUNDING PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's NATIONAL NEW IDEAS AND PRODUCTS R&D FUNDING PROGRAM (2013 - Ongoing). The aim of the program is to support applied research and / or experimental development projects for the purpose of developing a new national / international product / process / method / model that will decrease dependence on foreign technology and / or increase international competitiveness. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To decrease dependence on foreign technology and / or increase our country's competitiveness. To provide financial support for R&D projects which aim to develop frequently imported devices and materials domestically, without violating the patent rules. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: 6550 LAW ON SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Türkiye's 6550 LAW ON SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2014 - Ongoing). The research infrastructures are evaluated and funded based on their performance, in accordance with The Research Infrastructures Law (Law 6550) which was enacted in 10 July 2014 and secondary level legislation was enacted in 28.08.2015. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Research infrastructures, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): To enhance competitiveness and sustainability of research infrastructures. It uses Institutional funding for public research, Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Science and technology regulation as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: UNIVERSITY-INDUSTRY COLLABORATION GRANT PROGRAMME
content: Türkiye's UNIVERSITY-INDUSTRY COLLABORATION GRANT PROGRAMME (2007 - Ongoing). TUBITAK 1505 "The Support Program for University-Industry Cooperation" aims to promote the transfer of knowledge stock and technologies of universities and public research institutions to industry, based on the technological needs of companies, which are residing in Turkey and committing to exploit the project outputs in Turkey. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): To contribute to the production, dissemination and commercialization of knowledge and technology via multi-disciplinary RDI projects To increase the effectiveness of university-industry collaboration To encourage SMEs to involve more in R&D activities To bridge the technological competence gap between university and industry It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Chile
heading: NATIONAL PRIZE OF INNOVATION
content: Chile's NATIONAL PRIZE OF INNOVATION (2007 - Ongoing). This initiative gives visibility to those individuals, organizations and businesses that are making significant changes in the society through innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Science, technology and innovation culture. It has the following objective(s): The objective of this initiative is to distinguish good ideas able to value added. Such ideas should be able to benefit the society and to create economic value for the innovator. It uses Science and innovation challenges, prizes and awards as policy instruments.

title: Russian Federation
heading: NATIONAL RESEARCH UNIVERSITY INITIATIVE
content: Russian Federation's NATIONAL RESEARCH UNIVERSITY INITIATIVE (2009 - Ongoing). The National Research University (NRU) initiative aims to provide competitive financial support (mainly as institutional funding) for leading universities carrying out cutting-edge programmes for education, R&D and knowledge transfer. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): Promoting at the global level HEIs capable to boost human capital in S&T, to create and commercialise new technologies, to develop innovative approaches to professional education and training. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: DESIGN COUNCIL - MENTORING SERVICE
content: United Kingdom's DESIGN COUNCIL - MENTORING SERVICE (2007 - Ongoing). The Design Council offers a mentoring service helping private, public and university sectors to understand how to use and embed design in their business to innovate and grow. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): helping private, public and university sectors to understand how to use and embed design in their business to innovate and grow. It uses Intellectual property regulation and incentives as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Flanders
heading: INCREASED MULTIDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH
content:
Belgium - Flanders's INCREASED MULTIDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH (2010 - Ongoing). Multidisciplinary research is increasing overall. Examples are combined initiatives of nanotechnology and biotechnology.

FWO has since 2010 a standing panel on interdisciplinary research for predoctoral and postdoctoral fellowships and for projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Perform research that better fits the increasing complexity and multidisciplinary of science. (NERF) is an interdisciplinary research center, empowered by imec, KU Leuven and VIB. NERF studies neuronal circuits and develop new technologies to link circuit activity to brain function. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Wallonia
heading: FINANCING OF INFRASTRUCTURES AND EXCEPTIONAL FACILITIES
content: Belgium - Wallonia's FINANCING OF INFRASTRUCTURES AND EXCEPTIONAL FACILITIES (2013 - Ongoing). Exceptional financing of infrastructures and facilities It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide funding of exceptional facilities, equipement and infrastructures for Universities, High Schools and Research centres. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Wallonia
heading: SUPPORT FOR THE INTEGRATION OF UNIVERSITIES INTO ESFRI
content: Belgium - Wallonia's SUPPORT FOR THE INTEGRATION OF UNIVERSITIES INTO ESFRI (2015 - Ongoing). Support of infrastructure projects identified in the ESFRI Roadmap It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Wallonia supports financially the participation of French-speaking Universities in ESFRI projects to integrate them in the leading consortia linked to ESFRI Infrastructures. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Brussels Capital
heading: RESEARCH PLATFORMS
content: Belgium - Brussels Capital's RESEARCH PLATFORMS (2010 - Ongoing). The program Research platforms, a program previously known as Bridge, supports collaborative and multidisciplinary academic projects that guarantee the transfer of knowlegde to industry, the non-profit sector, or the public sector. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Digital transformation of firms, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): To stimulate the transfer of knowledge to industry, non-profit, or the public sector. To stimulate research on areas of key importance to the Brussels region. To stimulate cooperation between different kind of RDI actors. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Mexico
heading: National Programme of Quality Graduate Programmes
content: Mexico's National Programme of Quality Graduate Programmes (1991 - Ongoing). El PNPC otorga reconocimiento a la calidad de la formación de los programas de posgrado con el fin de incrementar las capacidades científicas, humanísticas, tecnológicas y de innovación del país, y así, contribuir al bienestar social de la población, la sustentabilidad y la atención a los problemas prioritarios nacionales. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, International mobility of human resources, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): Fomentar la mejora continua y el aseguramiento de la calidad del posgrado nacional, para incrementar las capacidades científicas, humanísticas, tecnológicas y de innovación del país, que incorporen la generación y aplicación del conocimiento como un recurso para el desarrollo de la sociedad y la atención a sus necesidades, contribuyendo así a consolidar el crecimiento dinámico y un desarrollo más equitativo y sustentable del país. It uses Standards and certification for technology development and adoption as policy instruments.

title: Mexico
heading: Cátedras Conacyt
content: Mexico's Cátedras Conacyt (2013 - Ongoing). Generación de una masa crítica de capital humano altamente calificado, mediante la incorporación de investigadores al mercado del conocimiento, y alcanzar así niveles de competitividad y productividad global. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Formar una masa crítica de capital humano altamente calificado que incremente y fortalezca la capacidad de generación, aplicación y transferencia de conocimiento en los temas y las áreas prioritarias para el país, mediante la incorporación de investigadores a instituciones públicas de educación superior e investigación. It uses Labour mobility regulation and incentives as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: HIGH-TECH STRATEGY 2025
content:
Germany's HIGH-TECH STRATEGY 2025 (2018 - Ongoing). The High-Tech Strategy 2025 sets the mid-term strategic orientations for Germanys R&D and innovation activity: reinforce the S&T base, enhance innovation and job creation, and help address global challenges to improve peoples lives. The HTS also aims to improve and accelerate the transfer of research into new products and services. The High-Tech Strategy 2025 focuses on three major
fields of action. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): 1 Tackling the major societal challenges
The strategy focusses on research that is geared to current and future needs and that is relevant to people’s everyday lives. The goal is to achieve technological and non-technological innovations, including social innovations, which focus on benefiting the people. To this end, the strategy is developing missions and setting concrete goals which unite the support of science, business and society. The High-Tech Strategy 2025 is specifically promoting research into issues that are relevant to the German economy and society. The Focus is in particular on the areas of Healthcare, Sustainability, Climate Action and Energy, Mobility, Urban and Rural Areas, Safety and Security, and Economy and Work 4.0. 2 Strengthening Germany’s future competencies
The strategy aims to systematically and consistently evolve future competencies for a progressive Germany. To this end, it is promoting key enabling technologies that also open up new and disruptive innovation potential with their broad range of applications and strengthen the German economy in international competition. At the same time, the promotion of research and technology is accompanied with additional training and further education measures. 3 Establishing an open innovation and venture culture
For innovative results, the strategy promotes innovative forms of cooperation that create spaces for ideas and involve new actors in the innovation process. To ensure that research results feed even more effectively into practical application, the strategy is strengthening transfer, supporting open forms of innovation and the development of leapfrog innovations, promoting entrepreneurial spirit and innovative strength in SMEs. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Malta
heading: SMART SPECIALISATION STRATEGY AS PART OF THE NATIONAL R&I STRATEGY 2020
content: Malta's SMART SPECIALISATION STRATEGY AS PART OF THE NATIONAL R&I STRATEGY 2020 (2014 - Ongoing). As expressed in Malta's 2020 national R&I Strategy (published in 2014), eight thematic areas of smart specialization have been identified. These are: tourism product development; maritime services; aviation and aerospace; health, with a focus on healthy living, active ageing and e-health; resource-efficient buildings; high value-added manufacturing with a focus on process and design; and aquaculture. In addition, ICT was identified both as a horizontal enabler across all specialisation areas, as well as a Smart Specialisation niche in itself. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cluster policies, Cross-disciplinary research, National ocean strategies and policy coordination, Ocean technology transfer and commercialisation, Support for business research, development and innovation, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Identify, through an entrepreneurial discovery process, those niches within the economy where Malta could have a particular advantage in innovation. It is intended that Malta R&I activities align with the eight thematic areas as outlined in the strategy. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: PERFORMANCE AGREEMENTS
content: Germany's PERFORMANCE AGREEMENTS (1995 - Ongoing). The funding system of the German higher education sector is undergoing a period of change. The detailed state control by Länder is being increasingly replaced with the autonomous action of HEIs. HEIs have increasing scope as regards specific measures to implement the agreed objectives. HEIs have been given greater flexibility in the use of the funds thanks to the introduction of global budgets, for instance. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): The relationship between the Länder and HEIs is increasingly marked by agreements on objectives and performance requirements, which define the deliverables. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Germany's ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2011 - Ongoing). The German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) had conducted a pilot process to draw up a roadmap for large research infrastructures (RIs). This 2013 published roadmap provides an overview of RIs that were selected in this process or that were currently being established. One distinguishing feature is that it only includes those projects for which there is in principle a public funding intention. In August 2015, after an evaluation of the pilot process, a revised and consolidated national roadmap process was announced, which was concluded in September 2019 with the announcement of the prioritised concepts for the new updated roadmap for RIs. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The efficient access to large RIs is essential for every scientific system. High investment costs and long-lasting construction phases of RIs require a fair strategic prioritisation process. The national RI roadmap process serves to prepare and prioritise - in terms of research policy - future and long-term investments in national and international scientific infrastructures with German involvement. General objectives of the national RI roadmap process are - the applicability to all scientific disciplines, - the support of political decisions on contribution to European/international RIs, - the realisation of a transparent process with external assessment - and the provision of planning reliability for selected projects at an early stage. In principal, though always subject to unforeseeable budgetary constrains, considerable public funding of (mainly) the investment costs of prioritised projects is intended for the development phases that should have a maximum duration of 10 years. On the other hand, the planned duration of the user-financed utilisation phases of RIs must be at least 10 years following their completion. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Malta
heading: INTERNATIONALISATION PARTNERSHIP AWARD SCHEME+
