content: Malta's INTERNATIONALISATION PARTNERSHIP AWARD SCHEME+ (2015 - Ongoing). The Scheme supports research and innovation (R&I) collaborative initiatives and is divided into two options. Option A provides opportunities for collaborative initiatives between Maltese entities and at least one foreign entity of proven track record of excellence. Option B provides opportunities for Maltese entities intending to submit a Horizon Europe proposal as the coordinator of a consortium to engage a service provider (local or foreign) who will be supporting the applicant through proposal writing and submission. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Intersectoral mobility, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): To enable academia and industry to create and sustain international collaborative networks focused on developing joint R&I. To contribute towards achieving the goals of the R&I Strategy with the potential that of any such activities become self-sustaining or generate longer-term outcomes. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Ireland
heading: SFI SPOKES PROGRAMME
content: Ireland's SFI SPOKES PROGRAMME (2013 - Ongoing). Science Foundation Ireland (SFI) Research Centres link scientists and engineers in partnerships across academia and industry to address crucial research questions; foster the development of new and existing Irish-based technology companies; attract industry that could make an important contribution to Ireland and its economy; and expand educational and career opportunities in Ireland in science and engineering. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): to enable the addition of new industrial and academic partners and projects to a SFI Research Centre, so allowing the Centre to expand and develop in line with new priorities and opportunities. ensure that the Research Centre retains its ability to do cutting edge research and its industrial relevance, and so enhance its sustainability. The Spokes programme also provides a vehicle to link together, in a meaningful and relevant way, different Research Centres. ensure that the Research Centre retains its ability to do cutting edge research and its industrial relevance, and so enhance its sustainability. The Spokes programme also provides a vehicle to link together, in a meaningful and relevant way, different Research Centres. The Spokes Programme has been designed to deliver excellent basic, oriented research results and discoveries in targeted projects associated with SFI Research Centres and hence will deliver significant economic and societal impact during the lifetime of the programme. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TUBITAK 3501 - CAREER DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's TUBITAK 3501 - CAREER DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (2007 - Ongoing). TÜBİTAK Career Development Program encourages scientists with PhD degree and who are at the beginning of their scientific careers by providing project funds for their studies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): To promote the R&D activities of young scientists with PhD degree or specialization in their early career; hence contributing the enhancement of their scientific competency To support young scientists to pursue their careers as researchers and lecturers It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: European Union
heading: EUROPEAN OPEN SCIENCE CLOUD
content: European Union's EUROPEAN OPEN SCIENCE CLOUD (2016 - Ongoing). The European Open Science Cloud offers Europes 1.7 million researchers and 70 million science and technology professionals a virtual environment to store, share and re-use their data across disciplines and borders, generated by the Big Data revolution. It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The objective of the European Open Science Cloud is to integrate existing networks, data and high-performance computing systems and e-infrastructure services across scientific fields, within a framework of shared policies, standards and investments. Making research data openly available can help boost Europes competitiveness, especially for start-ups, SMEs and companies who can use data as a basis for R&D and Innovation, and can even spur new industries. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: European Union
heading: EUROPEAN STRATEGY FORUM ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: European Union's EUROPEAN STRATEGY FORUM ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2002 - Ongoing). ESFRI acts as an informal body, composed of representatives of national authorities responsible for political decision-making and funding of research infrastructures with a mandate to support a coherent and strategy–led approach to policy making on research infrastructures in Europe. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To facilitate multilateral initiatives acting as an incubator for pan-European and global research infrastructures To establish a European Roadmap for research infrastructures and stimulate the implementation of these facilities It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: Slovenia
heading: MULTILATERAL PROJECTS, INFRASTRUCTURES, REGIONAL INITIATIVES AND INTERNATIONAL ORGANISATIONS IN THE FIELD OF RESEARCH
content: Slovenia's MULTILATERAL PROJECTS, INFRASTRUCTURES, REGIONAL INITIATIVES AND INTERNATIONAL ORGANISATIONS IN THE FIELD OF RESEARCH (1991 - Ongoing). The Ministry of Education, Science and Sport systematically promotes and supports the participation of Slovenian R&D organisations in multilateral projects/initiatives and infrastructures co-financed by the European Union, United Nations agencies and other international and intergovernmental organisations. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The increase of international multilateral co-operation. Excellent and internationally comparable scientific system. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Denmark
heading: Strategy 2.0 for the Danish involment in European Spallation Sourcce
content:
Denmark's Strategy 2.0 for the Danish involment in European Spallation Sourcce (2020 - Ongoing). The European Spallation Source (ESS) is a multi-disciplinary research facility, which Denmark together with Sweden is cohosting. In order to exploit the full potential of the Danish investment in ESS, an independent working group has worked out a strategy for the Danish ESS effort. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The strategy focus on the following 8 key target scenarios:

The strategy identifies 8 target scenarios within to main focus areas. For each target scenario the strategy contain one or more initiatives which the working group has proposed to organize.

Focus area A: ESTABLISHMENT OF LEADING RESEARCH ENVIRONMENTS RELATED TO MATERIALS TECHNOLOGY ESS FORMS THE BASIS FOR GROUND-BREAKING INNOVATION AND GREEN TRANSION
Target scenario 1: World class materials research environments must form the basis for exploiting ESS potential
1.1. Establishment of further lighthouse environments at Danish universities
1.2. Annual summit meeting with ESS light-house environments
Target scenario 2: Tripling the neutron user environment should ensure adequate international clout for the Danish materials research environments
2.1 Action plan for training new neutron users
2.2. New and intensified focus on life science
2.3 Outlining a possible ESS-EMBL partnership
Target scenario 3: Comprehensive bridge building with ESS must give researchers in Denmark access to leading knowledge environments
3.1. Agreement on Danish involvement in the ESS operational phase
3.2. Preparation of Danish strategy for collaboration with ESS DMSC
3.3 Investigating the options for a Danish “outstation” by ESS

Focus area A: ESS FORMS THE BASIS FOR GROUND-BREAKING INNOVATION AND GREEN TRANSION
Target scenario 4: Danish companies and knowledge institutions must produce materials research for specific green solutions
4.1. Focus on the potential of materials research in relation to the green transition
4.2 Nordic conference on the contribution of materials research to the green transition
4.3 Action plan on the green transition and materials research
Target scenario 5: Cooperation and experience sharing between companies, universities and GTSs must be a source of new ideas and innovation
5.1 Exploration and establishment of a common industrial portal to help companies with advanced materials analysis
5.2 Strengthened involvement and collaboration with the business promotion system
Target scenario 6: The discoveries and results from materials research must be exploited through commercialisation and spin-outs
6.1 Analysis of the need for a materials oriented entrepreneur initiative
Target scenario 7: New value propositions must strengthen the marketing efforts with respect to foreign companies
7.1 Better knowledge base concerning the target group of relevant companies as well as the preparation of value propositions and marketing initiatives
Target scenario 8: ESS establishes opportunities for high-tech supplier companies
8.1 Examination and action plan for the Danish supplier contribution to ESS It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Netherlands
heading: NWO - ORGANISATIONAL RETRUCTURING
content: Netherlands's NWO - ORGANISATIONAL RETRUCTURING (2015 - Ongoing). On 27 November 2015 the Dutch National Research Agenda was published. The Agenda enhances multi- and disciplinary research and strengthens joint programming. The new structure of NWO should encourage multidisciplinary research as well. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): NWO is changing. The biggest change is that once the new NWO Act becomes effective on 1 February 2017, NWO will have a structure with an Executive Board, a separate NWO Institutes Organisation (Netherlands Foundation of Scientific Research Institutes) and three domains that are closely connected with each other: Sciences (former EW, CW, ALW, N/FOM); Applied and Engineering Sciences (former TW/STW) and Social Sciences and Humanities (former MaGW en GW). The intention is for NWO and the current ZonMw to integrate into a new organisation with effect from 1 January 2019. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: BIOECONOMY STRATEGY
content: South Africa's BIOECONOMY STRATEGY (2014 - Ongoing). The vision is for South Africa’s bio-economy to be a significant contributor to the country’s economy by 2030 in terms of the gross domestic product (GDP). It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cross-disciplinary research, Public research strategies, STI plan or strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): to strengthen socio-economic outcomes in the agriculture, industry, environment and health sectors, based on biotechnology and life science research, development and innovatio to leverage biotechnology in order to realise national imperatives in improving access and affordability of health care provide sufficient nutrition at lower costs create skilled jobs in manufacturing protect environmental resources. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Iceland
heading: SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY POLICY AND ACTION PLAN
content:
Iceland's SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY POLICY AND ACTION PLAN (2020 - Ongoing). The Science and Technology Policy Council issued a new policy for Science and Technology for the period 2020 to 2022, with an associated action plan. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, ERA-related strategies, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy, Targeted support to SMEs, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): - Research and innovation in Iceland should have a framework that is internationally competitive.
- Icelandic institutions and enterprises should increase their participation in international research and innovation.
- Value creation based on knowledge should be strengthened and jobs in knowledge industries increase.
- Research and innovation should benefit society in tackling societal challenges. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Iceland
heading: INFRASTRUCTURE FUND
content: Iceland's INFRASTRUCTURE FUND (2013 - Ongoing). The infrastructure fund supports research infrastructures in Iceland by co-financing purchase of equipment, databases, software and any other research infrastructure that is important for scientific progress. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the Infrastructure Fund is to improve the support for research infrastructures. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: The International Science and Business Belt
content: Korea's The International Science and Business Belt (2012 - Ongoing). Korea is attracting foreign hi-tech firms and research institutes into the "International Science and Business Belt (ISSB)" currently under development by providing them with tax incentives and financial support. In creative research environment, ISSB is designed to become a national growth hub, where global talents, science and businesses interact with each other. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): ISBB with creative research environment is designed to become a national growth hub, where global talents, science and businesses interact with each other. The Central District of the ISBB will function as a hub of basic science research and house the Institute for Basic Science (IBS) and RAON, a Korean Rare Isotope Accelerator. Outstanding scientists from home and aboard will be provided with pleasant residential environment of a global standard, which will help them settle down with ease and convenience. In order to facilitate the translation of basic science research outcomes into practical applications, a science-based business environment will also be created, where researchers and related industries can work together closely. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Colombia
heading: COLOMBIA BIO
content: Colombia's COLOMBIA BIO (2015 - Ongoing). Colombia BIO is a national strategy aimed at turning Colombia into one of the most important bio-economies in the region. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research, Research and innovation for society strategy. It has the following objective(s): Promoting conditions to know, assess, preserve and use biodiversity, contributing to sustainable and social inclusive economic development. Strengthening research capacity to know, assess, preserve and use biodiversity and its ecosystem resources in a sustainable manner. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Costa Rica
heading: NATIONAL SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION PLAN
content: Costa Rica's NATIONAL SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION PLAN (2015 - Ongoing). The National Plan of Science, Technology and Innovation 2015 - 2021 defined five strategic areas: education, health, environment and water, energy, food and agriculture. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cross-disciplinary research, Embedding sex- and gender-specific analysis in research, Internationalisation in public research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): Contribute to social welfare and strength countrys knowledge based activities through social appropriation, articulation and application of Science, Technology and Telecommunications. It uses Project grants for public research, Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Lithuania
heading: INTEGRATED SCIENCE, STUDIES AND BUSINESS CENTRES
content: Lithuania's INTEGRATED SCIENCE, STUDIES AND BUSINESS CENTRES (2009 - Ongoing). Five Integrated Science, Studies and Business Centres (Valleys) are being developed with a view to building up research, studies and knowledge economy clusters of international level. Valley means concentration (totality of entities) of the capacities in research, studies and knowledge-intensive business generally in one area, with common or interrelated infrastructure, geared towards building knowledge economy and thus enhancing Lithuania’s economic competitiveness. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To concentrate, upgrade and optimise the infrastructure that would facilitate the development of high technologies and other most viable sectors of science, technology and business. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Hungary
heading: NATIONAL RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE REGISTER
content: Hungary's NATIONAL RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE REGISTER (2011 - Ongoing). The National Research Infrastructure Register is a tool for the research, education and innovation community looking for services offered by these infrastructures. It aims at contributing to the transparency of national research funding by providing the taxpayers with relevant information on the operation and development of research infrastructures supported by public funds. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide a searchable database providing information on major research infrastructures in Hungary in all fields of science. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: NATIONAL ROADMAP OF UNIQUE SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Spain's NATIONAL ROADMAP OF UNIQUE SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURES (2007 - Ongoing). The National Roadmap of Unique Scientific and Technological Infrastructures is a strategic instrument of the National (State) Plan for Scientific and Technological Research and Innovation. It has been updated in November 2018. It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To support the development of scientific and technological infrastructure facilities within Spain that serve to the entire technological and industrial community, both national and international. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: PARTICIPATION IN THE EUROPEAN STRATEGIC FORUM ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Spain's PARTICIPATION IN THE EUROPEAN STRATEGIC FORUM ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE (2009 - Ongoing). The European Strategic Forum on Research Infrastructures (ESFRI) is a strategic instrument created by the Member States and the European Commission to develop the scientific integration of Europe and to strengthen its international outreach. It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): ESFRI delegates have been nominated by the Research Ministers of the MMEE to develop a joint vision and a common strategy, including regularly updated Roadmaps. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Norway
heading: IDÉLAB
content: Norway's IDÉLAB (2014 - Ongoing). Idélab events gather a group of researchers and innovators from different disciplines and backgrounds to develop ground-breaking research projects in multi-day workshops, and the most promising proposals receive funding. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Generate ground-breaking projects in the interface between subjects areas and disciplines for the solution of societal challenges. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: CANADA 150 RESEARCH CHAIRS
content: Canada's CANADA 150 RESEARCH CHAIRS (2018 - Ongoing). nan It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): nan It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: CONNECTION PROGRAM
content: Canada's CONNECTION PROGRAM (2019 - Ongoing). Program to realize the potential of social sciences and humanities research for intellectual, cultural, social and economic influence, and benefit and impact on and beyond the campus, by supporting specific activities and tools that facilitate the flow and exchange of research knowledge. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Enable the multidirectional flow of social sciences and humanities research knowledge among researchers, across academia and within society to enhance intellectual, cultural, social and economic benefits and impact. Increase the accessibility and use of social sciences and humanities research knowledge among academic and non-academic audiences. Support development of reciprocal relationships among social sciences and humanities researchers, and between researchers and potential co-creators or users of knowledge. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: SEED FUNDING PROGRAM IN GREEN HYDROGEN WITH CANADA
content: Germany's SEED FUNDING PROGRAM IN GREEN HYDROGEN WITH CANADA (2020 - Ongoing). The initiative aims to establish bi-national networks and partnerships with Canadian actors for the research and development of innovative solutions in the field of hydrogen technologies along the entire value chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Green energy transitions, Internationalisation in public research, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Establish cooperation between universities and non-university research institutions in Germany with universities in Canada Support research projects with clear practical relevance, which will contribute materially to a future hydrogen market and lead to new technologies, products and/or services in specific application areas. It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: DIFFERENT SUPPORT GRANTS FOR DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGIES IN REPUBLIC OF SRPSKA
content:
Bosnia and Herzegovina's DIFFERENT SUPPORT GRANTS FOR DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGIES IN REPUBLIC OF SRPSKA (2018 - Ongoing). Financial support for technology development projects, procurement equipment and participation in professional gatherings on the development of technologies It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): 1) Development of technologies for Testing and introduction of modern or significant
improved existing technologies, with the ability to check on
model, prototype or pilot technology. 2) Provision of modern equipment that introduces new or significant
improves existing technology:
2.1. Construction, manufacture and testing of modern equipment (own
development)
2.2 Procurement of equipment. 3) Participation in expert meetings on the development of technologies in the country, It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Canada
heading: COVID-19 VACCINE TASK FORCE
content: Canada's COVID-19 VACCINE TASK FORCE (2020 - Ongoing). Volunteer task force to provide invaluable insight to the Government of Canada. It is part of the following theme(s): Governance arrangements to tackle COVID-19, International STI governance policy, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Help the Government of Canada make sound evidence‑based decisions to protect the health and safety of Canadians during the pandemic. Prioritize vaccine projects seeking support for activities in Canada. Attract promising international vaccine candidates, or partner with developers of non‑Canadian vaccine candidates. Optimize the tools needed to develop vaccines. Support effective research and development, and supply chain coordination for COVID-19 vaccine projects. Facilitate solutions to manufacture the most promising COVID-19 vaccines in Canada; and identify opportunities to enhance business connectivity globally to secure access to vaccines with key commercial sponsors. It uses Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts, Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: RULEBOOK ON CRITERIA FOR REALIZATION AND FINANCING OF PROGRAMS OF INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH ASSOCIATES
content:
Bosnia and Herzegovina's RULEBOOK ON CRITERIA FOR REALIZATION AND FINANCING OF PROGRAMS OF INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH ASSOCIATES (2018 - Ongoing). This Ordinance prescribes the criteria and procedure for
realization and financing of the program of international scientific research cooperation. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, International mobility of human resources, International STI governance policy, Non-competitive research funding, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Financial support for the programs of international scientific cooperation refers to the part:
1) participation in abroad scientific conferences, 2) stay or arrival of foreign scientists by invitation, 3) scientific study stays abroad and scientific training in a foreign scientific institution, 4) participation in scientific research programs of the European Union and 5) bilateral scientific research cooperation It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malta
heading: FUSION R&I: RESEARCH EXCELLENCE PROGRAMME
content: Malta's FUSION R&I: RESEARCH EXCELLENCE PROGRAMME (2020 - Ongoing). Bottom-up funding scheme for early stage research. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To strengthen national and international collaborations To generate new knowledge and build capacity for future areas. To build capacity in new multidisciplinary areas To fund early stage impactful research with new avenues of economic growth It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malta
heading: FUSION R&I: INFECTIOUS DISEASES PROGRAMME
content: Malta's FUSION R&I: INFECTIOUS DISEASES PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). The Infectious Diseases Programme is a top-down research funding programme targeting research areas related to infectious diseases It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the Infectious Diseases Programme is to funnel R&I investment into research areas which can prevent and mitigate future diseases outbreaks It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: MAINSTREAMING GRASSROOTS INNOVATION PROGRAM
content: Malaysia's MAINSTREAMING GRASSROOTS INNOVATION PROGRAM (2016 - Ongoing). Aims to enhance grassroots innovation's development efforts and commercialisation, including the provision of capacity building opportunities to local grassroots innovators. (TRL 3-6) It is part of the following theme(s): Access to finance for innovation, Business innovation policy strategies, Entrepreneurship capabilities and culture, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Non-competitive research funding, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, Targeted support to SMEs, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises. It has the following objective(s): Supporting enterprises based on innovation and sustainable business as well as applying entrepreneurial elements to innovators through Innovation Grants. The Innovation Community Diffusion Program disseminates innovation products to chosen communities in collaboration with NGOs to identify community problems that can be solved with innovation. Creating an entrepreneurial ecosystem through forging partnerships between innovators and stakeholders in order to redouble efforts to bring investment to the commercialization stage in rural regions. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: COOPERATIVE PHD PROGRAM
content: Hungary's COOPERATIVE PHD PROGRAM (2020 - Ongoing). Cooperative PhD program launched in 2020. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Research careers, STEM skills. It has the following objective(s): The Aim of the Cooperative Doctoral Programme ('KDP') is to further increase the number of workers in the field of R&D and innovation, primarily in the fields of STEM (mathematics, science, engineering and INFORMATION technology), who wish to increase their professional knowledge with the latest scientific research results and are committed to the social and economic exploitation of their knowledge. It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Switzerland
heading: NOMIS FOUNDATION
content:
Switzerland's NOMIS FOUNDATION (2015 - Ongoing). The foundation serves as a catalyst for scientific and human progress by supporting interdisciplinary research, establishing collaborative research networks and developing strategic partnerships. In addition to providing financial support, NOMIS endeavors to develop and strengthen the conditions conducive to the pursuit of high-risk basic research. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): NOMIS Awards are presented to exceptional and pioneering researchers who have made significant contributions in basic research, have the manifest potential for transformative future discoveries, and have the ability to inspire the world around them. Their bold ideas and unique approaches involve interdisciplinary collaboration and apply a broad range of methods, building bridges across the boundaries of disciplines. The NOMIS Award enables these exceptional, established scientists to continue exploring unconventional academic paths, thereby opening up new research fields and collaborations. NOMIS fellowships support emerging, early-career researchers who, like other NOMIS researchers, demonstrate the potential to lead groundbreaking, high-risk basic research. With interdisciplinary collaboration at the heart of their innovative ideas and approaches, these researchers build bridges across the boundaries of disciplines.

NOMIS research grants support unconventional research projects led by researchers who have demonstrated exceptional scientific capabilities and leadership. The grants enable scientists to spearhead pioneering research to answer bold questions and advance yet unexplored approaches across scientific and academic disciplines. We award research grants to investigators with an excellent track record in leading groundbreaking, high-risk basic research. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TURKISH ACADEMY OF SCIENCES STEM CELL WORKING GROUP
content: Türkiye's TURKISH ACADEMY OF SCIENCES STEM CELL WORKING GROUP (2014 - Ongoing). TÜBA - Stem Cell Working Group organizes several meetings and courses at national and international level with the participation of all relevant partners and publishes reports on the subject. It is part of the following theme(s): Ethics of emerging technologies, Evaluation and impact assessment, High-risk high-reward research, Research integrity and reproducibility. It has the following objective(s): To stimulate RDI on stem cell technologies that will allow the acquisition of new information that may benefit patients, as well as the renewal of the basic knowledge in cell biology. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: THE PLAN TO ESTABLISH CAMPUS INNOVATION PARK
content: Korea's THE PLAN TO ESTABLISH CAMPUS INNOVATION PARK (2019 - Ongoing). Plan to transition an idle sites within universities into an urban high-tech industrial complex by supplying corporate occupancy facilities, housing, welfare, and convenience facilities for companies and research institutes. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Horizontal policy coordination, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research infrastructures, Targeted support to SMEs, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises. It has the following objective(s): Create a new ecosystem for innovative growth in or near universities with excellent conditions through a cooperation system between ministries. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: FUND MILAN JELIC
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's FUND MILAN JELIC (2014 - Ongoing). The mission of the "Dr Milan Jelic" Fund is to encourage talented young people in Republika Srpska to improve their potential and achieve results by which they will be recognized as an intellectual elite, whose acquired knowledge and skills will be the basis for the development of Republika Srpska. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Provide financial support to postgraduate students It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: NATIONAL SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION POLICY
content: Malaysia's NATIONAL SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION POLICY (2021 - Ongoing). The NSTIP was formulated to strengthen the position of STI in the development of an innovation-based economy, while introducing the concept of Science, Technology, Innovation and Economy (STIE) to emphasize the importance of STI, as a basis to support economic growth and to achieve the goal of becoming a high-tech nation. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Digital transformation of firms, Entrepreneurship capabilities and culture, Gender balance and inclusiveness, International mobility of human resources, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for developing countries, Research and innovation for society strategy, Research careers, Science, technology and innovation culture, STEM skills, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): To mobilize the STIE sector through the strengthening of responsive STI governance. To strengthen the development of local industry’s technological drive through Research, Development, Commercialization & Innovation (R,D,C&I). To increasing the number of adaptive local STI talent. To mainstream the enculturation and adaptation of science, technology, innovation and economy (STIE). It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Horizontal STI coordination bodies, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND 1
content: Malaysia's TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND 1 (2021 - Ongoing). Technology Development Fund 1 (TeD 1) is open to researchers and companies interested in implementing research and development projects (R&D) to produce new processes and products in the field have been identified by the Government. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises. It has the following objective(s): Develop existing concepts related to design technologies, processes or products that have the potential to be commercialized. Stimulate the growth of research and technology development among Government Research Institutes, STI Agencies, Institutions Higher Education and industry. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: NATIONAL SCIENTIFIC FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT
content: Malaysia's NATIONAL SCIENTIFIC FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT (2017 - Ongoing). In line with NSTIP 2021-2030 Action Plan It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The National Scientific Facilities & Equipment (NSFE) aims to encourage sharing of facilities and scientific equipment among STI community and enhance research and development (R&D) cooperation. The initiative also plans to encourage the industrial and public sector to collaborate in R&D activities. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Networking and collaborative platforms, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Peru
heading: Doctoral programs in strategic and general areas
content: Peru's Doctoral programs in strategic and general areas (2018 - Ongoing). Increase the availability of human capital I + D + i, seeks to increase the number of researchers with a doctorate degree dedicated to research activities, technological development and innovation in the same way that they respond to the needs of the country with quality results It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research and innovation for developing countries. It has the following objective(s): Increase the availability of human capital I + D + i, seeks to increase the number of researchers with a doctorate degree dedicated to research activities, technological development and innovation in the same way that they respond to the needs of the country with quality results It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Peru
heading: Improvement of the research infrastructure
content: Peru's Improvement of the research infrastructure (2018 - Ongoing). Improvement of Infrastructure for Research, seeks to modernize, update and strengthen the equipment for research in universities and research centers co-financing their acquisition, in order to accelerate the generation of applied research. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Improvement of Infrastructure for Research, seeks to modernize, update and strengthen the equipment for research in universities and research centers co-financing their acquisition, in order to accelerate the generation of applied research. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Peru
heading: Researchers Incorporation
content: Peru's Researchers Incorporation (2018 - Ongoing). Increase in the availability of human capital for science, technology and innovation, seeks to strengthen lines of research through the incorporation of researchers trained abroad It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Increase in the availability of human capital for science, technology and innovation, seeks to strengthen lines of research through the incorporation of researchers trained abroad It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Peru
heading: Research projects
content: Peru's Research projects (2017 - Ongoing). Increase in funds for strategically oriented research and technological innovation subprojects and programs, seeks to promote research, with emphasis on strategic areas, through the financing of applied research, technological development and innovation subprojects It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Increase in funds for strategically oriented research and technological innovation subprojects and programs, seeks to promote research, with emphasis on strategic areas, through the financing of applied research, technological development and innovation subprojects It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: 10-10 MYSTIE FRAMEWORK
content: Malaysia's 10-10 MYSTIE FRAMEWORK (2020 - Ongoing). This Framework provides a systematic approach to transform Malaysia into a knowledge-intensive economy by design. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To enhance the competitiveness and sustainability of Malaysian industries To enhance the quality of life of the people (rakyat). To bridge the innovation chasm through collaborative platforms It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Information services and access to datasets, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND 2
content: Malaysia's TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FUND 2 (2021 - Ongoing). Technology Development Fund 2 (TeD 2) is open to researchers and companies interested in implementing research and development projects (R&D) to produce new processes and products in the field have been identified by the Government. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research and innovation for developing countries, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): Develop existing concepts related to design technology, process or product towards commercialization in order to reduce the gap of failure (valley of death). Stimulate the growth of research and technology development through a network of cooperation between Government Research Institutes, Government STI Agencies , Institute of Higher Education with industry. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: BRIDGING FUND
content: Malaysia's BRIDGING FUND (2021 - Ongoing). The funding is developed towards technology development, creation of new products and services are important to generate wealth and well-being of the community as well as enhance the competitive advantage of the country's R&D It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research and innovation for developing countries, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): Reducing the gap of failure (valley of death) between the pre-phases commercialization to commercialization Increase the level of readiness of R&D products in order to penetrate the market It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: APPLIED RESEARCH FUND
content: Malaysia's APPLIED RESEARCH FUND (2021 - Ongoing). Expected output from this Applied Innovation Fund (AIF) funding is a new product, process, system or Intellectual Property right Right) which is beneficial to customers, businesses and society. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Increase the participation of innovators in innovative activities and encourage technological innovation of products, processes, systems or new services that have the potential to be commercialized. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Canada
heading: IDEA TO INNOVATION GRANTS
content: Canada's IDEA TO INNOVATION GRANTS (2003 - Ongoing). Grants to provide funding to college and university faculty members to support research and development projects with recognized technology transfer potential. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Accelerate the pre-competitive development of promising technology originating from the university and college sector and promote its transfer to a new or established Canadian company. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Canada
heading: NSERC GRANTS EXTENSION
content: Canada's NSERC GRANTS EXTENSION (2020 - Ongoing). 12-month extensions provided, where applicable, to grant recipients who request them because of COVID-19, regardless of whether they have received a previous time extension of any length for any reason. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Allow grantees to continue spending grant funds, and institutions to delay the processing of residual grant funds, per the NSERC/SSHRC Guidelines for the General Research Fund. Mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on researcher funding It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: NSERC DISCOVERY GRANTS EXTENSION
content: Canada's NSERC DISCOVERY GRANTS EXTENSION (2020 - Ongoing). Option for all active Discovery Grants to elect to receive a one-year extension with funds at their current funding level. It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): To mitigate the impacts of COVID-19 pandemic on research and researchers. Support funded researchers and highly qualified personnel. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: NUCLEAR MALAYSIA AS A TECHNICAL SUPPORT ORGANIZATION FOR INDUSTRY
content: Malaysia's NUCLEAR MALAYSIA AS A TECHNICAL SUPPORT ORGANIZATION FOR INDUSTRY (1984 - Ongoing). The agency Nuclear Malaysia plays a vital role in providing technical support and services as a Technical Support Organization (TSO). It is part of the following theme(s): Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provides technical support and services to promote the application of nuclear S&T, for the safe management of nuclear technology and radioactive waste in the country. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: DISCOVERY FRONTIERS
content: Canada's DISCOVERY FRONTIERS (2011 - Ongoing). Grants support a limited number of large international activities, opportunities or projects that are of high priority in the context of advanced research in Canada. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Identify and capitalize on emerging opportunities where Canada can benefit from its world-class capacity to take a leadership role in key areas of research and innovation. Address national research priorities and global challenges by supporting a small number of major new transformative and integrative activities. These initiatives will generate substantial impact from a one-time injection of funding for a defined period, addressing challenges and seizing leadership opportunities in areas of national importance. Bring together groups of researchers in new ways to address a major research challenge. The groups will incorporate new and emerging ideas, and combine their complementary expertise to conduct transformative, paradigm-changing research. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Belgium - Wallonia
heading: BEWARE FELLOWSHIP 2
content: Belgium - Wallonia's BEWARE FELLOWSHIP 2 (2020 - Ongoing). is a BEWARE Fellowship 2mechanism to promote the mobility of researchers (male or female) to Wallonia, by financing their stay. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, International mobility of human resources. It has the following objective(s): To promote the mobility of researchers to Wallonia. To attract high qualified researchers in Walloon SMEs, universities, university colleges and research centres. It uses Project grants for public research, Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: GRANT "SUPPORT TO TECHNOLOGICAL CULTURE AND INNOVATION IN BIH"
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's GRANT "SUPPORT TO TECHNOLOGICAL CULTURE AND INNOVATION IN BIH" (2005 - Ongoing). Annual grant in the amount of 117 000 BAM It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Science, technology and innovation culture. It has the following objective(s): To support innovators It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: KNOWLEDGE RESOURCE FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY EXCELLENCE
content: Malaysia's KNOWLEDGE RESOURCE FOR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY EXCELLENCE (2019 - Ongoing). Upgraded as an Integrated Science, Technology and Innovation (STI) Data and Information Platform. Designed with a better web interface and more user-friendly system features such as elastic search, dynamic reporting, option for bulk upload, Web-based equipment & services booking and more. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): To be the main reference center for the country's STI strategic information to support the needs of the STI community through quality knowledge management. To facilitate the flow and access of STI information between the government and private sectors to support national policy in the development of STI. To facilitate the flow and access of STI information between the government and private sectors to support national policy in the development of STI. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: STEM HUB
content: Malaysia's STEM HUB (2021 - Ongoing). STEM HUB is one of the core components of the program is to improve the infrastructure through STEM HUB and use an online learning system that allows teachers to have access to high quality infrastructure and resources. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide facilities for teachers to meet their needs to implement HOTS in the delivery of STEM -related curricula. STEM HUB as a communication center, integration-based learning center, design center, support center, loan center to support teacher programs. Enabling participants to collaborate with MOE through PSTEMN as well as strategic educational partners. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TUBITAK 2247-A NATIONAL OUTSTANDING RESEARCHERS PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's TUBITAK 2247-A NATIONAL OUTSTANDING RESEARCHERS PROGRAM (2020 - Ongoing). The scope of this program is to provide support for projects which having groundbreaking goals, offering the opportunity to meet significant gaps at scientific and technological areas and providing new perspective to researchers, and/or having potential of important discovery and/or inventions at every single area of science and technology; and for researchers working on these projects in Turkey. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, High-risk high-reward research, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): To support outstanding researchers for their projects having groundbreaking goals and RDI activities in Turkey It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TUBITAK 2247-D NATIONAL EARLY STAGE RESEARCHERS PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's TUBITAK 2247-D NATIONAL EARLY STAGE RESEARCHERS PROGRAM (2021 - Ongoing). The scope of this program is to provide support for projects which having groundbreaking goals, offering the opportunity to meet significant gaps at scientific and technological areas and providing new perspective to researchers, and/or having potential of important discovery and/or inventions at every single area of science and technology; and for young researchers working on these projects in Turkey. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Gender balance and inclusiveness, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To provide financial support for young researchers for their projects with groundbreaking goals and RDI activities in Turkey It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: ELECTRICAL & ELECTRONICS ROADMAP: TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT
content: Malaysia's ELECTRICAL & ELECTRONICS ROADMAP: TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT (2021 - Ongoing). This roadmap is to establish an E&E one stop-center, development of market-pull moon-shot programs, and the creation of emerging technology open innovation programs. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Public research strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To establish solid governance and a one stop-center to provide support to the industry in terms of technical advisory and advocacy and shared facility. Creation of market-pull moon-shot program by harmonizing inter-ministries policies, strategies and investments, which will enable more SMEs and local companies/ vendors to participate in the implementation of projects in identified niche areas Creation of emerging technology open innovation program  to support market pull moon-shot program and encourage R&D program to develop Malaysian made critical components/ systems/ integration needed in niche sectors. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts), Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: NATIONAL BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY ROADMAP 2021-2025
content: Malaysia's NATIONAL BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY ROADMAP 2021-2025 (2021 - Ongoing). The roadmap will steer Malaysia to embrace the blockchain technology, which is a critical driving factor in Malaysia’s digital transformation. It is part of the following theme(s): Building more resilient societies and economies, High-risk high-reward research, Public research strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To provide solution at business issues ranging from fraud management to supply chain monitoring that can potentially increase efficiency and reduce costs. To be a reference for blockchain deployment across sectors and encourage local application development. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: NATIONAL BIOTECHNOLOGY POLICY
content: Malaysia's NATIONAL BIOTECHNOLOGY POLICY (2005 - Ongoing). The Malaysian Government recognized biotechnology as one of the key strategic drivers to propel the country’s social and economic development in pursuit of the status of a developed nation. For this purpose, the Government launched the National Biotechnology Policy (NBP) in year 2005 to further develop three economic sectors namely agriculture, healthcare and industrial manufacturing, as well as to support the growth of an enabling eco-system throughout the scientific, academic and business communities in the country. It is part of the following theme(s): Public research strategies, Research infrastructures, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): To develop three economic sectors namely agriculture, healthcare and industrial manufacturing, as well as to support the growth of an enabling eco-system throughout the scientific, academic and business communities in the country. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts), Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY - AGRICULTURAL R&D SUPPORT PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY - AGRICULTURAL R&D SUPPORT PROGRAM (2007 - Ongoing). The R&D projects designed by public research institutions affiliated to the ministries, universities, TÜBİTAK R&D institutes/centers, non-governmental and professional organizations and private sector are supported. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To determine the priorities of the agricultural sector of Turkey To improve the scientific and technological capacity on determined priority themes in agriculture. To facilitate knowledge and technology transfer to related stakeholders It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: SCIENCE COUNCIL
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's SCIENCE COUNCIL (2005 - Ongoing). Science Council of the FBiH Ministry of Education and Science consists of high ranking academics in different scientific fields that come from different Universities in FBiH. The Council consists of 6 members from 6 different scientific fields. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): Science Council of the FBiH Ministry of Education and Science evaluates the projects submitted on FMES public calls (Competition for financing/co-financing of scientific research and research-development projects in FBiH) and ranks projects according to their scientific value. The Council also monitors the implementation of scientific-research projects funded by FMES and the results published in reference scientific journals and databases. It uses Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malta
heading: MCST-TÜBİTAK 2021 JOINT CALL FOR R&I PROPOSALS
content: Malta's MCST-TÜBİTAK 2021 JOINT CALL FOR R&I PROPOSALS (2021 - Ongoing). This Call is a Participating State Initiated Activity launched by the Malta Council for Science and Technology and the Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TÜBİTAK), and forms an integral part of the PRIMA Programme. It supports researchers and innovators from both countries to strengthen their scientific expertise and networks, enabling them to collaborate further in future annual PRIMA Calls. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Internationalisation in public research, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): The call aims to strengthen the research and innovation capacities in Malta and Turkey, in the fields of Water Management, Sustainable Farming Systems and Agro-food Value Chain. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Federal government
heading: Belgian Co-ordinated Collections of Micro-organisms
content: Belgium - Federal government's Belgian Co-ordinated Collections of Micro-organisms (2010 - Ongoing). Belgian biological resource center based on inter research, which provides services of quality in microbial and genetic resources for academia and industry. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Acquire, preserve and distribute microbial and genetic resources. Increase the understanding of microorganisms and their function in ecosystems. Identify and characterize biological materials. Foster the application of biological resources. Offer customer-oriented services. It uses Technology extension and business advisory services, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malta
heading: FUSION TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME
content: Malta's FUSION TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME (2015 - Ongoing). Grant for applied research which may have economic viability It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation. It has the following objective(s): To grant funds for the development of innovative technologies or services. To encourage the collaboration of the public and private sectors. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: NAHRIM WATER R&D OUTLOOK 2030
content: Malaysia's NAHRIM WATER R&D OUTLOOK 2030 (2021 - Ongoing). NAHRIM Water R&D Outlook, 2030 is divided into 4 major areas, which are as follows: Water, Coastal & Oceanography, Water Environment, and cross-cutting fields. There are 4 cross-cutting fields that support the main research: hydroclimate (climate change, precipitation magnitudes), physical and numerical modelling, data collecting with analyzing data and product. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Public research strategies. It has the following objective(s): To promote MoU signing, R&D collaboration, Strategic partnership. To promote community-based programs, Program with strategic partners. To promote research, development & innovation/ accreditation/ exhibition for products related to water pollution and environment, innovation / technology IPR product, and National and international recognition, laboratory accreditation (ISO) and Sampling guidelines. To promote commercialisation and innovation and technology product. To promote fellowship, internship, and contract for Service. To enhance consultation activities and technical advisory. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: NATIONAL WATER RESOURCES POLICY
content: Malaysia's NATIONAL WATER RESOURCES POLICY (2012 - Ongoing). The security and sustainability of water resources shall be made a national priority to ensure adequate and safe water for all, through sustainable use, conservation and effective management of water resources enabled by a mechanism of shared partnership involving all stakeholders. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): To set directions & strategies for collective action to ensure the security & sustainability of Water Resources through integrated & collaborative mechanisms involving all related stakeholders at all levels. To provide means & measures to complement existing policy directions related to Water Resources to ensure their sustainable & equitable use, as well as protect the environment, integrity of ecosystem & natural heritage. To provide a platform to strengthen Water Resources intelligence & uniform practices through the streamlining of standards, measures, methods & approaches. To set out the means & measures for the adoption of Water Resources conservation plans at multiple scale to complement & strengthen existing land, resources, physical & other related development plans. To build the capacity of all stakeholders for effective participation & collaboration in Water Resources governance at multiple scale & levels focusing on developing human resources, science, technology & practices as well as encouraging investment in research, development & innovation. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Austria
heading: AUSTRIAN SOCIETY FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
content: Austria's AUSTRIAN SOCIETY FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (2020 - Ongoing). The Austrian Society for Artificial Intelligence (ASAI) is a non-profit association for the promotion of Austria as a research location in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) with all its scientific and technical sub-disciplines as well as related inter- and transdisciplinary aspects. ASAI considers itself as platform for the AI community in Austria. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Digital transformation of firms, Ethics of emerging technologies, Non-financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): - Strengthening research excellence in Austria in an international context - Support in setting up international lighthouse projects - Increasing the attractiveness of the location for young researchers - Consultation for all relevant ministries It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Brazil
heading: NATIONAL INNOVATION POLICY
content: Brazil's NATIONAL INNOVATION POLICY (2020 - Ongoing). The National Innovation Policy will guide the government action related to fostering innovation activities in the economy and society, improving synergy among agencies and bringing more effectiveness to the public policies related to innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Evaluation and impact assessment, High-risk high-reward research, Horizontal policy coordination, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy, Strategic policy intelligence, Structural change of the public research system, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): To coordinate government action. To bring higher productivity both to companies and other institutions that perform innovation in the country, following the directions of the national innovation law. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Hungary
heading: Hungarian National Large Scale Research Infrastructure Database
content: Hungary's Hungarian National Large Scale Research Infrastructure Database (2021 - Ongoing). Database of the Hungarian Large Scale Research Infrastructures of International Interest It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To have an inventory of the Hungarian large scale research infrastructures in order to enhance open science and innovation To enable the use of RIs for national and international researchers. It uses Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: INTERNATIONAL FUTURE LABS FOR GREEN HYDROGEN
content: Germany's INTERNATIONAL FUTURE LABS FOR GREEN HYDROGEN (2021 - Ongoing). The initiative will establish International Future Labs to study current research and development issues in the field of green hydrogen. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions, International mobility of human resources, Internationalisation in public research, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): Advance excellence-focused international research cooperation along the entire value creation chain (up to Technology Readiness Level 4). Broaden the portfolio of German research expertise in hydrogen technology in accordance with current and future needs. Provide impetus for pioneering climate innovations by German companies based on green hydrogen and establish sustainable international knowledge networks. Raise Germany’s research profile in international competition. It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Finland
heading: CO-INNOVATION FUNDING
content: Finland's CO-INNOVATION FUNDING (2019 - Ongoing). Funding for collaboration of companies and research organizations on the development of new knowledge and innovations to serve as a basis for international business activities. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): Increase collaboration of researchers with both companies and international partners. Enhance the research organization's competence, and accelerate the utilization of research data and development of new export products. Reinforce both the Finnish and international networks. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Finland
heading: CO-CREATION FUNDING
content: Finland's CO-CREATION FUNDING (2019 - Ongoing). Business Finland's funding to a research organization covers 60% of the project's approved total eligible costs. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To support the Co-Innovation joint action carried out by the research organization in close cooperation with its new partnering companies. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Austria
heading: TIME MACHINE ORGANISATION
content: Austria's TIME MACHINE ORGANISATION (2019 - Ongoing). The Time Machine Organisation (TMO) is the leading international organisation for cooperation in technology, science and cultural heritage and the institutional governing framework that ensures the sustainability and economic independence of the Time Machine project. It is part of the following theme(s): Digital transformation of firms, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Provide a platform for carrying out projects of different kinds in different funding programmes with different consortia (consulting in terms of funding instruments, finding appropriate partners, project management etc.) Develop technologies in order to further advance the digital use and reuse of cultural heritage Build an infrastructure that implements the goals and activities of the Time Machine (servers, databases, platforms, etc.) as well as strengthen the practical capabilities of the Time Machine Organisation and its members Create an environment for continuous exchange of knowledge, best practice and expertise in order to boost current and future developments (online knowledge base, Time Machine events like the Time Machine conference 2019, workshops, national stakeholder meetings, special networking events etc.) Provide open source tools and technologies Offer support in different fields (use of technologies and infrastructure, project building, etc.) It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: INDUSTRIALIZATION EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
content: Türkiye's INDUSTRIALIZATION EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (2020 - Ongoing). The Presidential Decree No. 68 on the Industrialization Executive Committee (the “Decree”) was published in the Official Gazette No. 31274 dated 14th October 2020. The Decree establishes the Industrialization Executive Committee (the “Committee”), a high-level body, which is likely to have a say in the fields of industry, technology and public procurement in Turkey going forward. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Horizontal policy coordination, Public research strategies. It has the following objective(s): To improve domestic production and technological capability through various ways including public procurement To facilitate investment, production and financing processes To encourage the localization of critical products in supply chains and enrich domestic production diversity, and take steps to strengthen the capital structures of manufacturing industry companies To strengthen the Turkish industry and technology ecosystem To ease the control of public procurements in line with the indigenous production priorities To increase competitiveness It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Procurement programmes for R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: FUNDING INITIATIVE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MODELS OF DATA INTERMEDIARIES
content: Germany's FUNDING INITIATIVE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MODELS OF DATA INTERMEDIARIES (2021 - Ongoing). The Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) is promoting the implementation of projects for the conception, establishment and further development of existing data intermediaries as a contribution to the Federal Government's data strategy. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Ethics of emerging technologies, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): Establishment of neutral data trustees to contribute to the consolidation and security of data stocks and enable their controlled use for a defined group of users, especially within the scientific system for research purposes oriented towards the common good. Strengthen the position of data providers regardless of whether they are individuals or organizations through an appropriate access management system and protective measures to ensure information security and data protection. It uses Project grants for public research, Information services and access to datasets, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP OF THE FEDERATION OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
content:
Bosnia and Herzegovina's RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP OF THE FEDERATION OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA (2021 - Ongoing). Research Infrastructure Roadmap of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBiH) summarizes the existing research potential of the Federation of BiH with a particular focus on the identification of research facilities, equipment, instrumentation and international cooperation, including the involvement of the FBiH in large European Research Infrastructures and projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Public research strategies, Research infrastructures, Science, technology and innovation culture, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): 1. Increase investments in R&D. 2. Make distinction between teaching and research activities - enable higher engagement of teaching staff in research activities. 3. Establish conditions for the re-functioning of academic and research network BIHARNET. 4. Create a Smart Specialization Strategy taking into account the research potential identified in RI Roadmap. 5. Intensify activities for the participation in DARIAH infrastructure and consider the possibility of participating in other Large pan-European infrastructures. 6. Improve the Legal and policy framework. Analysis of the current legal and policy framework has shown insufficient regulation in the area of R&D in the Federation of BiH. Only a few Cantons have regulated this area, while others do not have legal and policy documents that regulate R&D.
