In the context of the development of RIs, it is important to clearly define which organizations are considered as scientific research organizations. Additionally, the terms “Research Infrastructures” and Research Infrastructure Roadmap” should be defined within legal and policy documents on the Cantonal and Federation level.

7. Encouraging Open Access to RI. As a result of the “Open Access Research Infrastructure in the Western Balkans Support Programme” implemented by RCC secretariat in 2020, the University of Sarajevo, the University of Zenica and the University of Bihać adopted an Open Access Policy to Research Infrastructures. Building on the experience gained in this program, the FBiH Ministry of Education and Science should encourage other research institutions to adopt their own Open Access Policy documents. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: PRESIDENCY OF DEFENCE INDUSTRIES SECTORAL STRATEGY DOCUMENT
content: Türkiye's PRESIDENCY OF DEFENCE INDUSTRIES SECTORAL STRATEGY DOCUMENT (2018 - Ongoing). The document includes sectoral technology, design and production capabilities and also initiatives used to support and promote funding of organizations, universities, institutions and companies working on defence technologies between 2018-2022. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Public research strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To fund Presidency of Defence Industries (SSB) projects through the Defense Industry Support Fund. To ensure full cooperation between universities, SMEs, technology producing companies and major players in the defence sector. To encourage participation of local companies to the procurement. To increase the technological depth and competitiveness of sub-industry and SMEs operating in the defense industry. To guide institutions about Government Support and Incentives for Defense and Aviation Technology Investments To develop future technology base, promote dual use and encourage the cooperation of industry, university, research institutes and SMEs . It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: COVID-19 AND SOCIETY CALL
content: Türkiye's COVID-19 AND SOCIETY CALL (2020 - Ongoing). TÜBİTAK has launched "COVID-19 and Society: Social, Human and Economic Effects of the Pandemic, Problems and Solutions" call in order to reveal the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on socio-economic, social and industrial developments. The scope of these effects extended to behavioral changes, equality of opportunity, accessibility of work, education, food supply and communication as well as psychological and sociological changes. It is part of the following theme(s): Building more resilient societies and economies, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Stimulus for STI systems, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): To examine the current and/or anticipated problems and effects of the global pandemic of COVID-19 from the perspective of social and human sciences; and to propose solutions to those problems and effects. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TRUBA - TURKISH NATIONAL E-SCIENCE E-INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Türkiye's TRUBA - TURKISH NATIONAL E-SCIENCE E-INFRASTRUCTURE (2003 - Ongoing). TÜBİTAK ULAKBİM High Performance and Grid Computing Center is a national center providing high performance computing and data storage for all research institutions and researchers in Turkey. This center is referred to as the Turkish National e-Science e-Infrastructure (TRUBA) with the decree of the TÜBİTAK Executive Board. The expanding and reinforcement of computing and data storage resources needed for our researchers to compete with their colleagues in the national and international arenas is carried out by the recommendations of the Turkish National e-Science e-Infrastructure Advisory Board. It is part of the following theme(s): Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide high-performance computing and data storage to all research institutions and researchers in Turkey. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: RESEARCH ON THE INTERNATIONALISATION OF VOCATIONAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING
content: Germany's RESEARCH ON THE INTERNATIONALISATION OF VOCATIONAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING (2017 - Ongoing). The initiative aims to strengthen and expand institutionalized vocational education and training research for international cooperation. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research, STEM skills, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): Increase the accessibility of German academic expertise in the field of vocational education and training research and the training of academic vocational education and training staff to foreign partners. Support foreign partners in reforming their national vocational education and training systems. Promote the establishment of an interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary research network on international cooperation in vocational education and training. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts), Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts, Standards and certification for technology development and adoption, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TUBITAK 1002 - SHORT TERM R&D FUNDING PROGRAM
content: Türkiye's TUBITAK 1002 - SHORT TERM R&D FUNDING PROGRAM (2004 - Ongoing). The aim of the Short Term R&D Funding Program is to support emergency, short-term, small-budget research and development projects to be carried out in universities, research hospitals and research institutes. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To support emergency, short-term, small-budget research and development projects to be carried out in universities, research hospitals and research institutes. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: FUNDING JUNIOR RESEARCH GROUPS IN EMPIRICAL EDUCATION RESEARCH
content: Germany's FUNDING JUNIOR RESEARCH GROUPS IN EMPIRICAL EDUCATION RESEARCH (2021 - Ongoing). The Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) supports empirical education research projects of research groups to strengthen the national research landscape and the need for longer-term employment prospects after completion of doctorate programmes. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Public research strategies, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): Support holders of junior professorships or those in the early career phase in contributing to their scientific profile acquiring performance and professional science skills. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: FUNDING INITIATIVE FOR RESEARCH ON REDUCING BARRIERS TO EDUCATION
content: Germany's FUNDING INITIATIVE FOR RESEARCH ON REDUCING BARRIERS TO EDUCATION (2019 - Ongoing). The initiative provides funding to research and development projects in the field of educational research with the aim of reducing educational barriers. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Gender balance and inclusiveness, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): Investigate the conditions for success and support the research-based development of practical approaches for promoting and supporting the education of children and young people in disadvantaged social and spatial circumstances. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts, Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: COHE REGULATION ON “JOINT APPLICATION AND RESEARCH CENTERS IN HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS”
content: Türkiye's COHE REGULATION ON “JOINT APPLICATION AND RESEARCH CENTERS IN HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS” (2020 - Ongoing). With the regulation on "Joint Application and Research Centers In Higher Education Institutions" Joint Application and Research Centers are established by the coordinator higher education institute with the cooperation of more than one state higher education institution. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): To conduct research that will contribute to scientific and technological development in priority areas determined within the scope of national goals and policies It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Science and technology regulation as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: ORGANIZATION AND OPERATION REGULATION OF GRADUATE EDUCATION AND TRAINING INSTITUTES
content: Türkiye's ORGANIZATION AND OPERATION REGULATION OF GRADUATE EDUCATION AND TRAINING INSTITUTES (1983 - Ongoing). According to the Organization and Operation Regulation of Graduate Education and Training Institutes (Article 5/d), an interdisciplinary institute with a different name from a faculty or department may be established in the Graduate School of Natural and Applied Sciences, Social Sciences and Health Sciences. Researchers from different disciplines take part and carry out joint research activities. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): To take part and carry out joint research activities of researchers from different disciplines It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TENMAK - COMPETITIVE RESEARCH FUNDING FOR ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES
content: Türkiye's TENMAK - COMPETITIVE RESEARCH FUNDING FOR ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES (2021 - Ongoing). Competitive research funding program for energy technologies is planned for the upcoming years in order to carry out, make, organize, support, establish and coordinate technical studies by TENMAK. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Mission-oriented innovation policies. It has the following objective(s): To increase and sustain the competitiveness of our country in the field of energy, mineral, ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, clean energy and nuclear technology To meet the need for finance in energy sector innovation Ro ensure the production of new products and the development of existing ones in energy sector To provide and encourage a strong scientific environment for researchers in energy sector To meet the R&D needs of affiliated, related and related institutions and organizations of the Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: PLANS FOR NON-COMPETITIVE RESEARCH FUNDING IN ENERGY BY TENMAK
content: Türkiye's PLANS FOR NON-COMPETITIVE RESEARCH FUNDING IN ENERGY BY TENMAK (2021 - Ongoing). Non-competitive (invitation-based) research funding program is on preparation in order to realize, organize, support, establish and coordinate technical studies in energy sector by TENMAK (Turkish Energy, Nuclear and Mineral Research Agency) It is part of the following theme(s): Mission-oriented innovation policies, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To increase and sustain the competitiveness of our country in the field of energy, mineral, ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, clean energy and nuclear technology To meet the need for innovation in energy sector To ensure the production of new products and the development of existing ones To provide and encourage a scientific environment for researchers To meet the R&D needs of affiliated, related and related institutions and organizations of the Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources. It uses Procurement programmes for R&D and innovation, Institutional funding for public research, Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TENMAK NUCLEAR ENERGY RESEARCH INSTITUTE
content: Türkiye's TENMAK NUCLEAR ENERGY RESEARCH INSTITUTE (2020 - Ongoing). TENMAK Nuclear Energy Research Institute (NÜKEN) performs all kinds of research, development, innovation, design, technology acquisition, production, testing, localization activities which enable the use of ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, nuclear energy and nuclear technology. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To perform all kinds of research, development, innovation, design, technology acquisition, production, testing, localization studies that will make it possible to benefit from ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, nuclear energy and nuclear technology in the scientific , technical and economic development of our country. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TENMAK RARE EARTH ELEMENTS RESEARCH INSTITUTE
content: Türkiye's TENMAK RARE EARTH ELEMENTS RESEARCH INSTITUTE (2018 - Ongoing). TENMAK Rare Earth Elements (REE) Research Institute (NATEN) performs basic and applied research and development activities in order to develop and produce critical products and technologies related to rare earth elements (REE) and other critical elements. It is part of the following theme(s): Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To develop REE production technologies from domestic or resources and alternative sources in our country To create a reliable and sustainable REE supply chain for our country To develop advanced technological material production technologies containing rare earth elements It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TENMAK BORON RESEARCH INSTITUTE
content: Türkiye's TENMAK BORON RESEARCH INSTITUTE (2003 - Ongoing). TENMAK Boron Research Institute conducts programs and projects in order to perform RDI on developing Boron products and technologies, as well as to expand their usage areas. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To increase the economic contribution of boron in our country by focusing on developing high value-added boron products and technologies and expanding their usage areas To perform and support R&D activities To transform RDI into production and added value It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: TENMAK UPCOMING TARGETED SUPPORT TO SMES
content: Türkiye's TENMAK UPCOMING TARGETED SUPPORT TO SMES (2021 - Ongoing). Competitive research funding programs for SMEs in energy, mineral, ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, clean energy and nuclear technology will be announced soon in the second half of 2021. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): To increase and sustain the competitiveness of our country from the R&D studies and studies whose feasibility has been completed in the fields of energy, mineral, ionizing radiation, particle accelerators, clean energy and nuclear technology. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Australia
heading: ARC INDUSTRIAL TRANSFORMATION RESEARCH HUBS
content: Australia's ARC INDUSTRIAL TRANSFORMATION RESEARCH HUBS (2012 - Ongoing). The Industrial Transformation Research Hubs scheme provides funding to Eligible Organisations to engage in cutting-edge research on new technologies and economic, commercial and social transformation which support the development of research outcomes that benefit industry partners in the Industrial Transformation Priorities by supporting collaborative research activities between the Australian higher education sector and industry. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): To encourage collaborative R&D projects between universities and organisations outside the Australian higher education sector that will solve challenging industry issues relevant to the Industrial Transformation Priorities. To drive growth, productivity and competitiveness within key growth sectors. To leverage national and international investment in targeted industry sectors, including from industry and other research end-users. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Australia
heading: ARC LINKAGE LEARNED ACADEMIES SPECIAL PROJECTS
content: Australia's ARC LINKAGE LEARNED ACADEMIES SPECIAL PROJECTS (2002 - Ongoing). Linkage Learned Academies Special Projects funds the Learned Academies to undertake projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To support the development of Australian research by provide the Learned Academies and the Australian Council of Learned Academies with the flexibility to achieve that objective. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: FUNDING FOR RESEARCH PROJECTS ON LATE SYMPTOMS OF COVID-19
content: Germany's FUNDING FOR RESEARCH PROJECTS ON LATE SYMPTOMS OF COVID-19 (2021 - Ongoing). The initiative represents a funding line to access and develop the available scientific knowledge on the late symptoms of Covid-19 (long-Covid) and make it available for use in practice. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Mitigating long-term impacts of COVID-19, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Leverage local knowledge and experience relating to late symptoms of Covid-19. Provide better care for patients with late symptoms in the long run. Reveal areas that would be benefit from further research, particularly with regards to "long-Covid." It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: PERFORMANCE MONITORING INDEX OF RESEARCH UNIVERSITIES
content: Türkiye's PERFORMANCE MONITORING INDEX OF RESEARCH UNIVERSITIES (2017 - Ongoing). In order to evaluate research/candidate research universities performance, TUBITAK and Council of Higher Education has developed special performance evaluation tool, which ranks the research universities in Turkey. As a result of the performance evaluation, 16 research and candidate research universities are ranked according to 33 indicators under 3 dimensions: "Research Capacity", "Research Quality" and "Interaction and Cooperation". It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): To increase the research oriented competition among the research/candidate research universities To evaluate research universities performance deeply with various research capacity, quality and collaboration indicators To determine top 11 university as a research university and last 5 university as a candidate research universities To specify top 5 research universities with the highest performance, which are provided additional allowance as an incentive and appreciation It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Portugal
heading: INTERNATIONAL RESEARCH PROGRAMME ON "MONTESINHO"
content: Portugal's INTERNATIONAL RESEARCH PROGRAMME ON "MONTESINHO" (2020 - Ongoing). The International Research Programme of Montesinho is oriented to promote the scientific valorisation of the Natural Park of Montesinho through the development of R&D activities. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research and innovation for society strategy. It has the following objective(s): To promote the scientific valorisation of the Natural Park of Montesinho through the development of R&D activities in 5 areas, considered strategic: observation and knowledge of the Earth (including the use of satellite information and its integration in advanced information processing and artificial intelligence systems); climate and climate change; socio-cultural interaction dynamics over time; sustainable agriculture; biodiversity and biological resources, natural and cultural heritages and sustainable regional development. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: MALAYSIA GREATER RESEARCH NETWORK SYSTEM
content: Malaysia's MALAYSIA GREATER RESEARCH NETWORK SYSTEM (2013 - Ongoing). MyGRANTS collects all application information including details of each project, researcher and HEI while monitoring grant-related information which includes KPI achievements such as publications, talent, intellectual property and other related information for MOHE's four (4) main grant schemes: (i) Fundamental Research Grant Scheme (FRGS); (ii) Prototype Research Grant Scheme (PRGS); (iii) Transdisciplinary Research Grant Scheme (TRGS); and (iv) Long-term Research Grant Scheme (LRGS). It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): MyGRANTS is an on-line platform that was developed for the implementation and monitoring of all research programs/ projects under the MOHE Fundamental Research Fund Program which includes application, evaluation, approval and monitoring processes of grants/ research projects. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Information services and access to datasets as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: MALAYSIA PARTNERSHIP AND ALLIANCES IN RESEARCH GRANT
content: Malaysia's MALAYSIA PARTNERSHIP AND ALLIANCES IN RESEARCH GRANT (2011 - Ongoing). Matching grants from partner countries for the implementation of research in accordance with the agreed ratio for the development of research capacity and competence; as well as strengthening the network of cooperation through the organization of appropriate programs. It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To drive Malaysian research excellence through partnership and strategic international collaboration. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: TRANSDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME
content: Malaysia's TRANSDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME (2014 - Ongoing). TRGS funding scheme funds basic and exploratory research that can generate new theories, concepts and ideas for the development of knowledge and each research program must involve a minimum of three (3) projects under different research domains from the same University. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): TRGS is aimed to build collaborations across various research clusters and is transdisciplinary in nature, to place Malaysia on the world map in terms of fundamental research in specific research clusters. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: LONG-TERM RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME
content: Malaysia's LONG-TERM RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME (2011 - Ongoing). LRGS can also generate leading new theories and ideas in areas that are strategic for the expansion of knowledge frontiers. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Research and innovation for developing countries. It has the following objective(s): LRGS is fundamental research that involves a more extensive scope; and a long period of time and requires a high level of commitment. LRGS can generate new theories and ideas that are at the forefront of strategic niches for the expansion of knowledge frontiers. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Malaysia
heading: LONG-TERM RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME- JEJAK SARJANA ULUNG
content: Malaysia's LONG-TERM RESEARCH GRANT SCHEME- JEJAK SARJANA ULUNG (2021 - Ongoing). The Long-Term Research Grant Scheme-Jejak Sarjana Ulung (LRGS-JSU) is able to promote high-risk, high-value and transformative research that are ambitious and paradigm pioneer in specific focus areas. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, High-risk high-reward research, Research and innovation for developing countries. It has the following objective(s): LRGS-JSU aims to transcend the norms of existing fundamental research limits by producing new and original ideas that would have a major impact on the prosperity of Malaysians and international society. LRGS-JSU is a fundamental research that involves an extensive scope, a long duration and requires a high level of commitment. LRGS-JSU can also produce cutting-edge new theories and ideas in strategic areas for the expansion of knowledge frontiers. For LRGS-JSU, applications under the field of Science must collaborate with an international research laboratory such as an international research laboratory where a Nobel Prize winner has served. While for non-Science fields, applicants must collaborate with relevant international agencies/ bodies. Examples of collaborations are joint publications, joint research, joint grants or other relevant collaborations (relevant documents must be submitted as evidence). It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: T-AP: RECOVERY, RENEWAL AND RESILIENCE IN A POST-PANDEMIC WORLD
content: Germany's T-AP: RECOVERY, RENEWAL AND RESILIENCE IN A POST-PANDEMIC WORLD (2021 - Ongoing). T-AP supports joint multilateral research on the medium- and long-term social effects of the corona pandemic from an international and transnational comparative perspective to promote the scientific cooperation of German universities and non-university research institutions with European, South and North American and South African universities and research institutions as well as the integration of researchers from German institutions and their topics in multilateral research networks. It is part of the following theme(s): Building more resilient societies and economies, Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research and innovation for developing countries, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Facilitate a cross-border exchange of knowledge through the promotion of scientific cooperation. Reduce inequalities and vulnerabilities. Build a more resilient, inclusive and sustainable society. Foster democratic governance and political participation. Advance responsible and inclusive digital innovation and ensure effective and accurate communication and media. It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malta
heading: SUPPORT SCHEME FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION PROJECTS IN THE FIELDS OF ENERGY AND WATER
content: Malta's SUPPORT SCHEME FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION PROJECTS IN THE FIELDS OF ENERGY AND WATER (2020 - Ongoing). The R&I Scheme seeks to support R&I projects whose objectives are in line with national policies in the energy and water sectors It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): The Scheme is intended to boost and guide the direction of national R&I in the fields of energy and water over the upcoming decade. These fields bring together some of the most significant challenges being faced at a national level, where rapid population and economic growth as well as the impacts of climate change exacerbate pre-existing pressures stemming from Malta’s specificities. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TURKEY VISION 2035 TECHNOLOGY FORESIGHT
content: Türkiye's TURKEY VISION 2035 TECHNOLOGY FORESIGHT (2021 - Ongoing). “Turkey 2035 Technology Foresight Study" was initiated in October 2020 under the auspices of the STIPC and with the technical support of TUBITAK in order to determine strategic potential areas and emerging technologies that would scale up our economic and social benefits by 2035. The Study is planned to be completed in the second half of 2021. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Mitigating long-term impacts of COVID-19, STI plan or strategy, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): To determine strategic priority areas and potential emerging technologies that would scale up our economic and social benefits by 2035. To determine the main megatrends in order to analyze the current and early signals of economic, social, cultural, technological and ecological transformation for the next 15 years and beyond. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: COVID-19 STRATEGIC R&D PROJECT CALL
content: Türkiye's COVID-19 STRATEGIC R&D PROJECT CALL (2020 - Ongoing). TUSEB provides various project supports primarily for the development of existing infrastructure facilities in the fields of pharmaceutical products, precision medicine, system biology and bioinformatics, medical devices and vaccine production. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): To support project proposals aimed at developing innovative approaches to the diagnosis, follow-up and treatment of Covid-19 disease (biomarker and diagnostic kit). It uses Project grants for public research, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Brazil
heading: NATIONAL PLATFORM FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Brazil's NATIONAL PLATFORM FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE (2021 - Ongoing). The National Research Infrastructure Platform (PNIPE) systematically maps and gathers information on research infrastructures in Scientific, Technological and Innovation Institutions (STIs) in the country, enabling access for the scientific and technological community and companies to existing laboratory facilities and research equipment, promoting their shared use. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Provide the scientific and technological community access to information on existing research infrastructures, including their location, applications and conditions of use. Foster the research infrastructure’s potential of innovation by giving visibility and insights for companies to cooperatively improve their products and develop new technologies. Encourage the shared use of resources and collaboration between research groups from different areas, institutions and regions, consolidating collaborations between them. Optimize the use of laboratory facilities and scientific research equipment to avoid fragmentation and duplicated efforts. Optimize the use of public resources in the preventive and corrective maintenance of existing infrastructures, as well as in the creation of new facilities and new equipment acquisition. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Germany
heading: SUPPORT NETWORK FOR INTERDISCIPLINARY SOCIAL POLICY RESEARCH
content: Germany's SUPPORT NETWORK FOR INTERDISCIPLINARY SOCIAL POLICY RESEARCH (2016 - Ongoing). The FIS supports endowed chairs, young professionals groups and research projects. Researchers are to establish themselves in social policy research and universities are to expand or establish new structures for social policy and social law research. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): Strengthen independent social policy research. It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: MOBILITY FUTURE LABORATORY 2050
content: Germany's MOBILITY FUTURE LABORATORY 2050 (2020 - Ongoing). The funding of systemic, transdisciplinary and implementation-oriented mobility research is intended to show ways in which the complex mobility system can be made more sustainable. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Secure the individual mobility of people and improve the quality of life and environment, especially in cities. Strengthen the innovative capacity of the German mobility sector. Create a sound basis for sustainable innovation and transformation management. Identify starting points, barriers and incentive options for the adaptation of sustainable forms of mobility, possible risks and long-term need for action for traffic and urban policy and planning (among others). Better understand interactions and effects within the mobility system as well as between mobility and other sectors. Provide orientation for forward-looking and directional policy and planning through comprehensive sustainability assessments. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Germany
heading: DIGITAL GREENTECH - ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNOLOGY MEETS DIGITALIZATION
content: Germany's DIGITAL GREENTECH - ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNOLOGY MEETS DIGITALIZATION (2020 - Ongoing). The German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) supports research and development projects to link digital technologies with environmental technologies with the aim of helping to conserve natural resources or to reduce environmental pollution. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research and innovation for society strategy. It has the following objective(s): Promote the development of innovative, sustainable products, procedures and services in the application fields of water management, sustainable land management and geo-technology as well as resource efficiency and circular economy. Support experts in developing environmental technology and information and communication technologies and in working together in interdisciplinary teams, focusing on: using data intelligently, networking systems, creating autonomous systems, and digital interactions. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: HUNGARIAN STARTUP UNIVERSITY PROGRAM
content: Hungary's HUNGARIAN STARTUP UNIVERSITY PROGRAM (2020 - Ongoing). The Hungarian Startup University Program is the first higher education level e-learning startup course of Hungary. It is part of the following theme(s): Entrepreneurship capabilities and culture, High-risk high-reward research, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the Program is to introduce students to the startup world and the innovation ecosystem. It is important that students learn a solution-oriented way of thinking, understand the functioning of company guidelines and get familiar with the major steps, tools, methods and characteristics of building a startup. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Malaysia
heading: MCMC DIGITAL SOCIETY RESEARCH GRANT
content: Malaysia's MCMC DIGITAL SOCIETY RESEARCH GRANT (2020 - Ongoing). DSRG is approved annually subject to review. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, Science, technology and innovation culture. It has the following objective(s): The objective of the DSRG is to enable the availability of research/ data on topical issues to build greater understanding of current implications and challenges of digital communications and services landscape for the communications and multimedia sector. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Estonia
heading: NATIONAL RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP STRATEGY
content:
Estonia's NATIONAL RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP STRATEGY (2021 - Ongoing). The national Research, Development, Innovation and Entrepreneurship strategy for the period of 2021-2035 defines five priority areas (RDIE focus areas):
The national strategy will also define five priority areas for Estonian RDIE:
1. Digital solutions horizontally through other sectors
2. Health technologies and services
3. Valorisation and more effective use of local resources
4 Smart and sustainable solutions for energy
5. Viable Estonian society, language and culture It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI plan or strategy, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Horizontal support for research capacity and entrepreneurship. Knowledge transfer and its mechanisms (e.g. increasing knowledge transfer capacity of the R&D institutions, building the ‘knowledge networks’ and business-academia links through the movement of employees between the academic, private and public sector; support for entrepreneurial PhD programmes; support for cooperation and co-creation between the academic, business and public sector within the national priority areas; strengthening the RD&I absorption capacity in the society and building RD&I-favourable policy environment through the network of research and development advisors in the public sector and in the private sector’s associations, and other activities). It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Türkiye
heading: GENERAL DIRECTORATE OF AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND POLICIES
content: Türkiye's GENERAL DIRECTORATE OF AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND POLICIES (1991 - Ongoing). There are 49 research institutes affiliated to TAGEM throughout the country, including central, regional and subject-based institutes. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To make effort to enhance the capacity of R&D in agricultural technologies To encourage the participation of academicians and researchers in related scientific fields in research activities To improve research database and to monitor and evaluate the projects regularly To transfer the results of the R&D to the users To provide economic, social and environmental benefits to Turkey through concluding high quality agricultural R&D that meets the country needs It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Republic of North Macedonia
heading: INNOVATION VOUCHERS
content: Republic of North Macedonia's INNOVATION VOUCHERS (2020 - Ongoing). By subsidizing contractual research by HEIs and PROs as service providers, FITD enhances the innovation activities in SMEs. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the innovation vouchers is to encourage cooperation between the academia (HEIs and PROs) and the private sector and encourage firms to introduce innovation. It uses Innovation vouchers as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Republic of North Macedonia
heading: CHALLENGE FOR ESTABLISHMENT OF FAB LABS "YOUTH CREATES"
content: Republic of North Macedonia's CHALLENGE FOR ESTABLISHMENT OF FAB LABS "YOUTH CREATES" (2021 - Ongoing). Through this challenge, FITD will support the establishment of 2-3 fab labs within HEIs and/or PROs which will serve as case studies for development of policy to support the establishment, operations and sustainability of fab labs or similar innovation infrastructure. It is part of the following theme(s): Entrepreneurship capabilities and culture, Research infrastructures, STEM skills, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation. It has the following objective(s): To provide access to advanced technology and mentoring for young people (15-29 years of age) to enable them to produce a prototype or small production of an innovative product which can be tested in a lab or on the market. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Science and innovation challenges, prizes and awards as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: TURKISH ENERGY, NUCLEAR AND MINERAL RESEARCH AGENCY (TENMAK)
content:
Türkiye's TURKISH ENERGY, NUCLEAR AND MINERAL RESEARCH AGENCY (TENMAK) (2020 - Ongoing). With the Presidential Decree Law numbered 57 published in the Official Gazette edition 31082 and dated 28/3/2020 TENMAK was established related to the Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources with special budget. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): To carry out cooperation and coordination with the public and private sector, to have encourage and support R&D activities, developing programs and projects done for this purpose. To make or have all kinds of research, development, innovation, design, technology acquisition, production, testing, localization studies done in order to ensure the wide use of the products developed as a result of R&D activities To promote the transformation of the outputs obtained as a result of R&D activities into commercial value and to support intellectual property rights To carry out all kinds of activities related to radioactive waste management and to establish radioactive waste facilities. To provide measurement, analysis, dosimetry, calibration, metrology, irradiation, intervention, technical support, inspection, evaluation and consultancy services and other services related to its field of duty. - To prepare training programs and provide training
- To collect and disseminate information, to carry out periodic and non-periodic publication activities, to support such publications, to provide scientific support services such as data banks, libraries, archives.
- To organize and support scientific meetings such as national and international congresses, seminars, and to contribute and participate in them. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: FUNDING PROGRAMME FOR THE INTEGRATION OF THE CENTRAL EASTERN AND SOUTH EASTERN EUROPEAN REGION IN THE EUROPEAN RESEARCH AREA
content:
Germany's FUNDING PROGRAMME FOR THE INTEGRATION OF THE CENTRAL EASTERN AND SOUTH EASTERN EUROPEAN REGION IN THE EUROPEAN RESEARCH AREA (2018 - Ongoing). Funding programme intended to pursue the long-term goal of integrating the target region into the ERA by making use of joint research and innovation projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding, ERA-related strategies, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Network with partners from the Middle East and Southeast Europe.
Joint development of grant applications to boost knowledge transfer and development of long-term partnerships. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms, Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Poland
heading: BEKKER PROGRAMME
content: Poland's BEKKER PROGRAMME (2018 - Ongoing). Mobility programme for outgoing PhD students and scientists. The Programme is open to PhD students and scientists representing all fields and disciplines of science as well as artistic disciplines. There are also no restrictions regarding countries where the Host Institutions are located. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Internationalisation in public research, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the Programme is to support the international mobility of PhD students, scientists and academic teachers in pursuit of scientific excellence by enabling them to conduct their research in renowned foreign institutions around the world. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Türkiye
heading: 6550 LAW ON SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES - INTERNATIONALISATION CRITERIA
content: Türkiye's 6550 LAW ON SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES - INTERNATIONALISATION CRITERIA (2014 - Ongoing). Internationalization is included in the evaluation criteria of research centers supported by Law No. 6550. It is part of the following theme(s): Internationalisation in public research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To enhance competitiveness and sustainability of research infrastructures. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: New Zealand
heading: MBIE SCIENCE WHITIANGA FELLOWSHIP
content: New Zealand's MBIE SCIENCE WHITIANGA FELLOWSHIP (2021 - Ongoing). The MBIE Science Whitinga Fellowship will provide support of around $10 million over two years for 30 excellent early career researchers impacted by COVID-19 in the New Zealand research science system. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): To support the retention and development of early career researchers with the potential to excel in a research environment in any field It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Hungary
heading: HORIZON EUROPE ACCELERATOR NATIONAL SUPPORT SCHEME
content: Hungary's HORIZON EUROPE ACCELERATOR NATIONAL SUPPORT SCHEME (2021 - Ongoing). The call for proposal aims to improve the Hungarian performance in EIC Accelerator. It is part of the following theme(s): Financial support to business R&D and innovation, High-risk high-reward research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): The programme supports the elaboration of the business plan. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: PROJECTS TO PROMOTE INTERDISCIPLINARY AND MULTIDISCIPLINARY R&D ACTIVITIES IN THE MONTESINHO NATURAL PARK
content: Portugal's PROJECTS TO PROMOTE INTERDISCIPLINARY AND MULTIDISCIPLINARY R&D ACTIVITIES IN THE MONTESINHO NATURAL PARK (2020 - Ongoing). Promotion of interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary R&D activities to be carried out in the Montesinho Natural Park It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Earth observation and knowledge: understand and monitor Montesinho Natural Park region Climate and climate change: integrated study of atmosphere, land and space interactions in Montesinho Natural Park region Sustainable agricultural systems Socio-cultural dynamics Biodiversity and biological resources, natural and cultural heritage, and sustainable regional development It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Canada
heading: COLLABORATIVE HEALTH RESEARCH PROJECTS
content: Canada's COLLABORATIVE HEALTH RESEARCH PROJECTS (2018 - Ongoing). Support for interdisciplinary, collaborative research projects involving any field of the natural sciences or engineering and any field of the health sciences. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Commercialisation of public research results, Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Mission-oriented innovation policies, STEM skills. It has the following objective(s): Translate research results to knowledge/technology for users and other stakeholders. Encourage the NSERC and CIHR research communities to collaborate and integrate their expertise. Advance interdisciplinary research leading to knowledge and technologies with the potential to benefit Canada by improving the Canadian healthcare system and/or services and potentially lead to economic opportunities in Canada. Train highly qualified personnel in collaborative and interdisciplinary research relevant to health. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Greece
heading: SECTORAL SCIENTIFIC COUNCIL ON DATA AND AI POLICY OF THE NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
content: Greece's SECTORAL SCIENTIFIC COUNCIL ON DATA AND AI POLICY OF THE NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR RESEARCH AND INNOVATION (2021 - Ongoing). This is a Sectorial Scientific Council on Data and AI (Artificial Intelligence) Policy of the National Council for Research and Innovation (NCRI). It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Ethics of emerging technologies, Evaluation and impact assessment, Horizontal policy coordination, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): Focus on AI and Data Policy (including AI ethics) It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts), Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Wallonia
heading: AGRONOMIC RESEARCH PLAN
content: Belgium - Wallonia's AGRONOMIC RESEARCH PLAN (2017 - Ongoing). The plan sets the strategic and operational objectives to help support walloon agriculture It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To improve the efficiency of research by federating and coordinating the actors of Walloon agronomic research. To prioritise research efforts in line with the expectations of the agricultural and food sectors. To improve the transfer of the results to the beneficiaries. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Spain
heading: RICORS' FINANCING
content: Spain's RICORS' FINANCING (2021 - Ongoing). Regulation of the granting of aid for the creation and configuration of Cooperative Research Networks Oriented to Results in Health (RICOR) in specific fields of action It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To promote health research oriented to patient results by coordinating the NHS and all the R&D stakeholders at national level including society. To establish R&D&I between research groups from different Regions, directing their research activity towards common objectives that allow obtaining results that can be transferred to the population. It uses Project grants for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Spain
heading: COORDINATION OF HEALTH RESEARCH INSTITUTES
content: Spain's COORDINATION OF HEALTH RESEARCH INSTITUTES (2004 - Ongoing). There are currently 31 IIS accredited by the ISCIII. They bring together 162 institutions: hospitals and centers of the National Health System; universities; public research organizations such as the CSIC; other health and research centers; institutions that have research activity in the health area and work cooperatively to meet the objectives that each IIS establishes in its Strategic Plan. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Consolidation of research centers, whose nucleus are the health centers of the SNS, as centers for the generation and transfer of knowledge to promote innovation, in response to the health priorities at state and European level. It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation
heading: WEAVE - RESEARCH FUNDING WITHOUT BORDERS
content: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation's WEAVE - RESEARCH FUNDING WITHOUT BORDERS (2021 - Ongoing). PDR Weave offers to researchers the possibility to submit proposals for collaborative projects under the PDR instrument in the call for Credits and Projects with European partner agencies within the Weave network, as well as participate in calls for projects from other European agencies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To support the internationalisation of research It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Kazakhstan
heading: VENTURE CAPITAL FUNDING LAW
content: Kazakhstan's VENTURE CAPITAL FUNDING LAW (2018 - Ongoing). The law provides the development of the venture capital market in Kazakhstan It is part of the following theme(s): Financial support to business R&D and innovation, High-risk high-reward research, Targeted support to SMEs, Targeted support to young innovative enterprises. It has the following objective(s): - to define the legal status of venture funds - to assess the effectiveness of state support for innovative projects funded by venture capital funds - to implement new contractual instruments (shareholder agreement, option agreement) It uses Equity financing as policy instruments.

title: Estonia
heading: TARGET GRANTS FOR SOLVING COVID-19 PROBLEMS
content: Estonia's TARGET GRANTS FOR SOLVING COVID-19 PROBLEMS (2020 - Ongoing). Target grants for funding applied research and experimental development projects for developing the prototypes for innovative solutions, products, and services in five thematic areas, related to Covid-19 crisis. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Enhancing the capacity of the society to hinder the spread of SARS-CoV2 and other similar viruses as well as at preventing and solving the problems caused by viruses through supporting applied research and experimental development projects in the thematic areas. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Estonia
heading: RESEARCH FUNDING TO PREVENT AND MONITOR THE SPREAD OF COVID-19
content: Estonia's RESEARCH FUNDING TO PREVENT AND MONITOR THE SPREAD OF COVID-19 (2021 - Ongoing). The funding was initiated to support COVID-19 specific research, including monitoring the spread of the virus and the epidemiological situation in Estonia. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Stimulus for STI systems, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): To apply the best available and emerging knowledge in Estonia to enable evidence-based decision-making to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 virus in the country and relieve the negative outcomes of the pandemic. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Ukraine
heading: THE CONCEPT OF THE STATE PROGRAM OF DEVELOPMENT OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES TO 2026
content: Ukraine's THE CONCEPT OF THE STATE PROGRAM OF DEVELOPMENT OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES TO 2026 (2021 - Ongoing). This Concept defines purpose, problems, strategic goals, establishment and operation of research infrastructures, basic tools and mechanisms for the development of research infrastructures It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The purpose of the Regulation is to create the necessary organizational, legal and financial prerequisites for the development of research infrastructures in Ukraine, increase their competitiveness, as well as the development of science and innovation in terms of access to advanced research infrastructures in the EU by approving the State Program for Research Infrastructures Development in Ukraine to 2026 It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Korea
heading: THE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY KNOWLEDGE INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE KOREA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFORMATION
content: Korea's THE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY KNOWLEDGE INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE KOREA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFORMATION (2019 - Ongoing). Information system to broaden access to science and technology (S&T) knowledge resources by building a national open science environment for core S&T information and research including theses, reports, research data, and R&D information. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): Identify and link disaggregate and ad hoc national and international data scattered to ensure essential data is captured within a unified system. Provide sustainable and reliable S&T information and data. Share, manage and analyze research data and build a national research data platform. Build an Open Access (OA)-based platform of national S&T resources to capture and make publicly available the outcomes of government-funded research and (R&D) projects. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: THE KOREA OPEN ACCESS PLATFORM FOR RESEARCHERS OF THE KOREA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFORMATION
content: Korea's THE KOREA OPEN ACCESS PLATFORM FOR RESEARCHERS OF THE KOREA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY INFORMATION (2020 - Ongoing). Open access (OA) academic information ecosystem created by establishing a virtuous cycle from collection to dissemination of open access articles. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): KOAR Portal assists in the discovery and monitoring of OA trends and OA content. KOAR Collab provides a platform to enable co-authorship, pre-print archiving and open commentary. KOAR Repository assists as a self-archiving service for researchers and journals. KOAR Safe provides information on fake, predatory, and questionable journals and conferences to reduce predatory publishing practices. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Republic of North Macedonia
heading: RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP OF THE REPUBLIC OF NORTH MACEDONIA
content: Republic of North Macedonia's RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE ROADMAP OF THE REPUBLIC OF NORTH MACEDONIA (2021 - Ongoing). The Research Infrastructure Roadmap of the Republic of North Macedonia is prepared in 2021 by support of regional Cooperation Council It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, STI plan or strategy, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): The main purpose of the Roadmap is to present the existing research potential of North Macedonia with the aim to set principles for the future development of research infrastructures and to propose recommendations aimed at strengthening research sector and thus societal development as a whole. It assists decision makers how to better leverage investments in research infrastructures to ensure their national and international relevance, as well as to ensure their availability to the entire research and business community in the national economy and beyond. The ultimate goal of the Roadmap is to ensure a long-term commitment of the decision makers for the systematic support of strong research and innovation in North Macedonia, striving for the development of RIs that are relevant beyond national borders, in highly competitive scientific areas, which will allow the research ecosystem to be shaped into a gateway for global research challenges. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation
heading: SURVEY OF HEALTH, AGEING AND RETIREMENT IN EUROPE - WALLONIA-BRUSSELS FEDERATION
content: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation's SURVEY OF HEALTH, AGEING AND RETIREMENT IN EUROPE - WALLONIA-BRUSSELS FEDERATION (2012 - Ongoing). Survey of Health, Ageing and Retirement in Europe (SHARE ERIC), conducted in and funded by Wallonia-Brussels Federation. It is part of the following theme(s): ERA-related strategies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To study the effects of health, social, economic and environmental policies over the life-course of European citizens and beyond. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Portugal
heading: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL COOPERATION AGREEMENTS BETWEEN FCT AND FUNDAÇÃO “LA CAIXA”
content: Portugal's SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL COOPERATION AGREEMENTS BETWEEN FCT AND FUNDAÇÃO “LA CAIXA” (2018 - Ongoing). Iberian multidisciplinar initiative of research and innovation. Part of the goPORTUGAL Initiative, aimed at stimulating the internationalisation of Portuguese R&I. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To support and stimulate new research and innovation activities and the positioning of Portugal in the Iberian Peninsula and in Europe It uses Project grants for public research, Project grants for public research, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Italy
heading: ITALIAN STRATEGY FOR HYDROGEN RESEARCH
content: Italy's ITALIAN STRATEGY FOR HYDROGEN RESEARCH (2020 - Ongoing). An Italian strategy for hydrogen research, in synergy with the European strategy It is part of the following theme(s): International STI governance policy, Public research strategies, Research infrastructures, STI plan or strategy, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): - enhance the competitiveness of Italian research products and the chances of success in tenders European Competitors (Horizon Europe); - be in synergy with the initiatives of Italian industry and local administrations, in order to increase the transfer of research results; - increase the resources allocated to the various research and development sectors concerning hydrogen, and in particularly to basic research, to bridge the gap with other European countries. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Poland
heading: CHANSE
content:
Poland's CHANSE (2021 - Ongoing). 1. Fund collaborative international research projects in humanities and social sciences.
2. Support knowledge exchange between researchers and non-academic stakeholders.
3. Deliver a broad range of academic, societal and economic impacts
4. Promote diversity in the following aspects: gender, geographical and academic age balance. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): The main objective is to announce call for international research projects entitled Transformations: Social and cultural dynamics in the digital age.
The tasks of CHANSE programme also include financing of the high-quality international research projects and support of cooperation between scientists and various interest groups such as: NGOs, cultural institutions, lawmakers, decision-makers, schools, etc. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Spain
heading: FUNDING PROGRAMME FOR EXCELLENT SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH "MARÍA DE GUZMAN"
content: Spain's FUNDING PROGRAMME FOR EXCELLENT SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH "MARÍA DE GUZMAN" (2021 - Ongoing). A new funding call is being launched in 2021 for supporting Open Science digital infrastructures in the institutions of the National R&D System. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Open science and enhanced access to publications and research data. It has the following objective(s): To enhance and favor research of excellence by promoting Open Science through the reinforcement of institutional infrastructures for storage, long term preservation, dissemination and management of scientific outcomes. It uses Information services and access to datasets, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
heading: ANNUAL GRANTS FOR THE SUPPORT OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES FOR PUBLIC UNIVERSITIES IN FEDERATION OF BIH
content: Bosnia and Herzegovina's ANNUAL GRANTS FOR THE SUPPORT OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES FOR PUBLIC UNIVERSITIES IN FEDERATION OF BIH (2012 - Ongoing). Ministry of Education and Science FBiH has 10 different annual grant programs in the area of science and development, open for public universities in Federation of BiH. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): 1. Improvement of the scientific and research infrastructure. 2. Support of the scientific development of scientific personel 3. Support of the scientific publishing development and publishing the results of scientific activities 4. Support of the international scientific and technology cooperation 5. Support of the international scientific and research projects 6. Support of the work of university libraries It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: United Kingdom
heading: CLEAN ENERGY INNOVATION FACILITY
content: United Kingdom's CLEAN ENERGY INNOVATION FACILITY (2019 - Ongoing). Grant funding that supports clean energy research, development & demonstration (RD&D). It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To accelerate innovative clean technologies in key sectors in developing countries. To help improve the performance of innovative technologies. To accelerate the clean energy transition to avoid the most severe impacts of climate change in developing countries. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: United Kingdom
heading: THE INDUSTRIAL STRATEGY CHALLENGE FUND FOR CLEAN GROWTH CHALLENGES
content: United Kingdom's THE INDUSTRIAL STRATEGY CHALLENGE FUND FOR CLEAN GROWTH CHALLENGES (2016 - Ongoing). The Industrial Strategy Challenge Fund’s clean growth challenges are maximising the advantages from a global shift to clean growth, by supporting businesses and researchers (depending on challenge) to the development, manufacture and use of low-carbon technologies, systems and services. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To drive innovation and collaboration, develop new solutions and create jobs and prosperity. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: CLEAN GROWTH STRATEGY: LEADING THE WAY TO A LOW CARBON FUTURE
content: United Kingdom's CLEAN GROWTH STRATEGY: LEADING THE WAY TO A LOW CARBON FUTURE (2017 - Ongoing). This strategy sets out a comprehensive set of policies and proposals that aim to accelerate the pace of ‘clean growth’, i.e. deliver increased economic growth and decreased emissions. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To meet our national commitments to economic growth and emissions reduction at the lowest possible net cost to UK taxpayers, consumers and businesses. To maximise the social and economic benefits for the UK from this transition. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Poland
heading: NEW TECHNOLOGIES IN THE FIELD OF ENERGY
content: Poland's NEW TECHNOLOGIES IN THE FIELD OF ENERGY (2020 - Ongoing). The main goal of this strategic program is to support the achievement of Poland's climate neutrality by implementing solutions increasing the country's energy security and increasing the competitiveness of the Polish economy. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Increase the overall energy mix of the country by 20-50% (compared to the level from 2020). It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: THE INDIGENOUS OFF-DIESEL INITIATIVE
content: Canada's THE INDIGENOUS OFF-DIESEL INITIATIVE (2019 - Ongoing). Initiative aimed at supporting deep capacity building and funding for community-driven clean energy planning and renewable energy projects in remote Indigenous communities that will support the transition away from a reliance on diesel for heat and power. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Gender balance and inclusiveness, Green energy transitions, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Science, technology and innovation culture, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation. It has the following objective(s): Support remote Indigenous communities in developing and implementing ambitious plans to reduce diesel use for heat and power. It uses Project grants for public research, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Argentina
heading: NATIONAL PLAN FOR SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION 2030
content: Argentina's NATIONAL PLAN FOR SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION 2030 (2020 - Ongoing). Elaboration of the policies, strategies and instruments that should guide the activities of generation of knowledge and development of technologies of the science, technology and innovation sector (STI) towards the goals and results demanded by the development path outlined for our country. It is part of the following theme(s): Building more resilient societies and economies, Competitive research funding, Horizontal policy coordination, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Public research strategies, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): To guarantee the production of scientific-technological knowledge will be oriented towards the integration of the industrial network and the increase of its density, the sustainable use of natural assets and the conformation or the strengthening of its value chains, with a special focus on the systemic and synergistic development of dynamic competitive advantages in the direction of structural change. It uses Project grants for public research, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Project grants for public research, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities, Strategies, agendas and plans, Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts), Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: Czech Republic
heading: THE CENTRE FOR GENDER & SCIENCE
content:
Czech Republic's THE CENTRE FOR GENDER & SCIENCE (2001 - Ongoing). The only specialized gender and science centre in the Czech Republic focused on research, policy and practice. It is part of the following theme(s): Embedding sex- and gender-specific analysis in research, ERA-related strategies, Gender balance and inclusiveness, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): carry out research into gender inequity in research. Specifically we study women’s and men’s careers in research, career advancement, excellence and research assessment, the position of early-career researchers and PhDs, mobility and the transformation of research and innovation and research and innovation policy from a gender perspective monitor evolution of gender equality in Czech research overtime serve as experts on expert groups and advisory bodies in the Czech Republic (Office of the Government, Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports, Czech Science Foundation) and at the EU level support public research and higher education institutions to launch cultural and institutional changes for gender equality through gender equality plans stimulate debates and petition for measures and steps to eliminate discrimination and gender inequalities in science;
raise awareness about gender issues in science and give visibility to the achievements of women scientists’ to the general public participate in international projects and cooperate with similarly orientated support and research organizations abroad, especially in Europe It uses Centres of excellence grants, Formal consultation of stakeholders or experts, Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments.

title: Iceland
heading: POLICY ON ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
content: Iceland's POLICY ON ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (2021 - Ongoing). Policy on how Iceland relates to AI It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Ethics of emerging technologies. It has the following objective(s): To set a policy tackling challenges and opportunities set by AI It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Norway
heading: CENTRE FOR ENERGY RESEARCH
content: Norway's CENTRE FOR ENERGY RESEARCH (2006 - Ongoing). Originally established as the Energy programme in 2006, NUPI’s Centre for Energy Research is an interdisciplinary research centre covering international relations and economic issues related to the field of energy. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Research on international energy issues and Norway’s role in the international energy arena It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation
heading: HORIZON EUROPE INCENTIVE
content: Belgium - Wallonia-Brussels Federation's HORIZON EUROPE INCENTIVE (2021 - Ongoing). Financial support for researchers having submitted an application to the EU framework programme for research and innovation Horizon Europe It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): To encourage researchers from the French-speaking Community in Belgium to apply to Horizon Europe funding schemes. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: REGIONAL R&D CENTERS
content: Chile's REGIONAL R&D CENTERS (2001 - Ongoing). Fund for the creation and strengthening of Regional research and development centers, which aims to increase, expand and decentralize capacities and resources for R&D in Chile, through associative research work. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Promote scientific and technological development in Chile’s regions, by working jointly with regional governments and research centers, according to the needs and priorities determined in each region for its economic and social development. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: FUNDING OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT FOR CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE
content: Chile's FUNDING OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT FOR CENTRES OF EXCELLENCE (2010 - Ongoing). The Centers will install scientific capabilities, through the funding of sophisticated and innovative scientific equipment that encourages and facilitates the development of research of excellence in the national territory. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Contribute to cover a part of the needs of the STI National System in high-cost research equipment and infrastructure. It uses Centres of excellence grants as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: COVID-19 RESEARCH PROJECTS
content: Chile's COVID-19 RESEARCH PROJECTS (2020 - Ongoing). The National Research and Development Agency (ANID) finances research projects on topics associated with the COVID-19 pandemic.
