It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Stimulus for STI systems, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Promote research and knowledge transfer to strengthen global, national and local capacities that can contribute to the investigation of the COVID-19 disease. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: COVID-19 NATIONAL CHALLENGES
content: Chile's COVID-19 NATIONAL CHALLENGES (2020 - Ongoing). Fund for create and devolp diagnostic technologies for COVID19 and other viral pathologies that affect human health. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Create diagnostic technologies for COVID19 and other viral pathologies that affect human health. Generate solutions for the local demand for personal protection elements to face COVID19. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Colombia
heading: TAX INCENTIVES FOR INVESTMENT IN STI
content: Colombia's TAX INCENTIVES FOR INVESTMENT IN STI (1992 - Ongoing). This initiative is an incentive for the development of science, technology and innovation projects by companies in alliance with actors recognized by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation, granting investors and / or executors, deductions and tax discounts. Similarly, the initiative strengthens the infrastructure for research in recognized educational institutions and research and technological development centers, through exemption from VAT on the import of equipment and elements, and encourage the participation of personnel in science, technology and innovation projects through Non-Constitutive Income from Income and / or Occasional Profit. It is part of the following theme(s): Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To encourage investment in R + D + I and promote competitiveness in companies and the development of high-impact research for the country. Deduction and Discount for investments in Science, Technology and Innovation projects and exemption from Value Added Tax for imports of equipment and items. Certification of income not constituting income or occasional gain. Tax credit for investments in Science, Technology and Innovation projects. Donation for STI activities. Tax incentives for linking doctors to the business sector. It uses Tax or social contributions relief for firms investing in R&D and innovation, Tax relief for individuals supporting R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Colombia
heading: RECOGNITION OF ACTORS
content: Colombia's RECOGNITION OF ACTORS (2017 - Ongoing). Acknowledgment and closing of capacity gaps in STI. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Structuring of guidelines, advice and technical support for the recognition of capacities in science, technology and innovation of the Actors of the National System of Science, Technology and Innovation – SNCTI. Definition of guidelines and accompaniment for the development of the Model of measurement of research groups, technological development or innovation and recognition of researchers of the National System of Science, Technology and Innovation. Definition of guidelines and accompaniment for the development of the Sciometric Model for the Indexation of Specialized National Scientific Journals - PUBLINDEX Promote, accompany and grant acknowledgment to the capacities in science, technology and innovation activities of different actors of the National System of Science, Technology and Innovation - SNCTI. It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies, Networking and collaborative platforms, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Mexico
heading: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ECOLOGY AND CLIMATE CHANGE
content: Mexico's NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ECOLOGY AND CLIMATE CHANGE (2012 - Ongoing). The INECC is a decentralized public body dependent on the Ministry of the Environment and Natural Resources. It is part of the following theme(s): Green energy transitions, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To promote environmental protection and ecological balance, as well as to issue recommendations to the corresponding authorities with the aim of mitigating climate change. To promote research, dissemination, study, awareness, development of technologies; To promote initiatives, standards, conventions, agreements and legislation in general in matters of environmental protection, ecological balance, sustainable development and climate change. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body, Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Cyprus
heading: COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL R&I STRATEGY
content: Cyprus's COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL R&I STRATEGY (2021 - Ongoing). The National Strategy, which is under preparation by the DMRID, will address/promote the priorities of the Government in the field of R&I and the needs and challenges of the national R&I ecosystem. The review of the Smart Specialisation Strategy of Cyprus, will complement the National Strategy. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, ERA-related strategies, Gender balance and inclusiveness, High-risk high-reward research, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Public research strategies, Research and innovation for society strategy, Research careers, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy, Structural change of the public research system, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Research Excellence and facilitating international networking of the national R&I ecosystem. Focus on Human Resources, Research Infrastructures, Open Science and International Cooperation. Business Innovation - enhancing and supporting Innovation and promoting Entrepreneurship. Focus on the commercialisation of research results, the support to enterprises and the attraction of innovative and high tech companies to Cyprus. Thematic priorities with high added value to the economy and society. Focus on the review of the Smart Specialisation Strategy, the participation in EU Funding Programmes and initiatives with thematic concentration, including to Horizon Europe Partnerships and the contribution of R&I to finding solutions to problems/issues the public sector is experiencing. Ensuring sufficient budget for R&I. Focus on the efficient utilisation of public funding, the increase of private R&I investments and the increase of funding from EU Programmes. National Communication Policy for R&I. Focus on the promotion of R&I culture, the facilitation of collaborations of the national R&I ecosystem both within the country and with international partners and the promotion of Cyprus as a regional Centre for R&I (Eastern Mediterranean - Middle East - North Africa region ). It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION OF THE R&D BUDGET
content: United Kingdom's ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION OF THE R&D BUDGET (2009 - Ongoing). The Health and Social Care Research and Development (HSC R&D) Division is part of the Public Health Agency and is responsible for the administration and coordination of the HSC R&D budget on behalf of Department of Health, Northern Ireland (DoH NI). It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Benefit the health, wellbeing and prosperity of the Northern Ireland population. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: FUNDING SCOTLAND'S FURTHER AND HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS
content: United Kingdom's FUNDING SCOTLAND'S FURTHER AND HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS (2005 - Ongoing). The Scottish Funding Council is the non-departmental public body charged with funding Scotland's further and higher education institutions, including their research and development, It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It has the following objective(s): To maintain – and improve – Scotland’s world-leading position in university research, and maximise its impact through a combination of strategic investment and innovative policies. To support the competitiveness of Scotland’s research base through a range of investments and the training and development of postgraduate teaching and research students. It aims to develop and sustain a dynamic and internationally competitive research sector that makes a major contribution to economic prosperity, national wellbeing and the expansion of knowledge. It uses Project grants for public research, Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments.

title: Costa Rica
heading: EU-CELAC WORKING GROUP ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Costa Rica's EU-CELAC WORKING GROUP ON RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE (2017 - Ongoing). The EU-CELAC Working Group on Research Infrastructures (WG RI) It is part of the following theme(s): International mobility of human resources, International STI governance policy, Internationalisation in public research, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To support policy coordination and the exchange of information to mobilise and strengthen RI cooperation between both regions, contributing to solve the global challenges while facilitating researchers’ mobility and the international access of RI It uses Horizontal STI coordination bodies as policy instruments.

title: Costa Rica
heading: COSTA RICAN SPACE AGENCY
content: Costa Rica's COSTA RICAN SPACE AGENCY (2021 - Ongoing). Creation of the Costa Rican Space Agency It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research, Horizontal policy coordination, National space strategies and policy coordination. It has the following objective(s): Develop research, technological innovation, collaboration and articulation projects focused on solving humanity's problems in terms of generating scientific space knowledge, space exploration and resource management inside and outside planet Earth, within the framework of development objectives. Sustainable Development of the United Nations (UN), with a peaceful approach and focused on social welfare. It uses Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Spain
heading: FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO SPANISH UNIVERSITIES PARTICIPATING IN THE "EUROPEAN UNIVERSITIES" PROGRAMME
content: Spain's FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO SPANISH UNIVERSITIES PARTICIPATING IN THE "EUROPEAN UNIVERSITIES" PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). Call for applications addressed to the Spanish universities for the presentation of projects in the Call of the European Commission "European University Network" It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To support participation to the the European Commission "European University Network" programme. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: European Union
heading: INVESTEU RESEARCH, INNOVATION AND DIGITISATION WINDOW
content: European Union's INVESTEU RESEARCH, INNOVATION AND DIGITISATION WINDOW (2021 - Ongoing). The InvestEU Programme will provide the EU with crucial long-term funding, crowding in private investments in support of a sustainable recovery and helping build a greener, more digital and more resilient European economy. It is part of the following theme(s): Access to finance for innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The InvestEU Fund is a market-based and demand-driven instrument, with strong emphasis on EU policy priorities. It supports the following 4 Policy Windows, focusing on investments where the EU can add the most value. The research, innovation and digitalisation window will finance projects in research and innovation, taking research results to the market, digitisation of industry, scaling up larger innovative companies, artificial intelligence and more. It uses Debt guarantees and risk sharing schemes as policy instruments.

title: Italy
heading: CALL FOR COVID-19 RESEARCH
content: Italy's CALL FOR COVID-19 RESEARCH (2020 - Ongoing). Call for Covid-19 research It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): To provide transferable results in a short time that have an explicit applicative orientation and the ambition to provide potentially useful information to guide the choices of the national health service, patients and citizens in actions to combat the COVID-19 epidemic. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Serbia
heading: THE LAW ON SCIENCE AND RESEARCH
content: Serbia's THE LAW ON SCIENCE AND RESEARCH (2019 - Ongoing). Regulates the system of science and research in the Republic of Serbia It is part of the following theme(s): Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Planning and realisation of public interest in science and research Quality assurance and development of scientific research, legal status, Establishment and management of institutes, Acquisition of research titles Institutional financing and other financing instruments, record keeping etc It uses Science and technology regulation as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: AFRICAN ORIGIN PLATFORM
content: South Africa's AFRICAN ORIGIN PLATFORM (2021 - Ongoing). The African Origins Platform (AOP) is a discipline-and transdisciplinary-based and demand-driven funding instrument. It is restricted to the field of palaeosciences, widely defined. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The objectives of AOP are to:•To contribute to knowledge production about South Africa’s palaeosciences in the Natural Sciences, Social Sciences and the Humanities. •To achieve world-class research in the palaeosciences, including a renewed prioritization of previously identified vulnerable or critical skill areas (as per the 2012 Palaeosciences Strategy). •To advance or develop paradigms, theories and methodological innovation relating to the palaeosciences. •To develop a comprehensive pipeline of human capacity in the palaeosciences, from past graduate training to emerging researchers, to established researchers. •To ensure meaningful public awareness activities soasto raise the national and international visibility of South African palaeosciences research; and •To develop sustainable and inclusive community engagement activities. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: South Africa
heading: BLACK ACADEMICS ADVANCEMENT PROGRAMME FRAMEWORK
content: South Africa's BLACK ACADEMICS ADVANCEMENT PROGRAMME FRAMEWORK (2020 - Ongoing). This programme is a directed intervention aimed at promoting the development of Blackacademics specifically, BlackSouth Africancitizensand, academic staff with disabilities,byaccelerating thetraining of Doctoraland post-PhDcandidatestoenhance their research training and accelerate their progression to become established researchers. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Gender balance and inclusiveness, Research careers, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): the objectives of the Black Academics Advancement Programmeare to:Support academics, particularly Black South African females and persons with disabilities, employed atpublic universities in South Africa to attain a Doctoralqualificationandpost-PhDresearch training; Promote the attainment of an NRF rating by Black South African early-career academics,especially Blackand female researchers and persons with disabilities. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: Competitive Programme for Rated Researchers (CPRR)
content: South Africa's Competitive Programme for Rated Researchers (CPRR) (2021 - Ongoing). The CPRR is a highly competitive discipline-based funding instrumentwhich supports both basic and applied research as the foundation of knowledge production in the disciplines of the Humanities, Social and Natural sciences. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): The objectives of the funding instrumentare:- To contribute to the development of a sound fundamental basis to scientificand scholarly endeavour in South Africa, in the Humanities, Natural and Social Science disciplines; -To contribute to knowledge production across the research spectrum; -To achieve world-class research and to develop the associated human capacity; and -To advance or develop paradigms, theories and methodological innovation across the research spectrum. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: EARTH SYSTEMS SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAMME
content: South Africa's EARTH SYSTEMS SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). The ESSRP is a research programme located within the Global Change Grand Challenge(GCGC)and provides opportunities for targeted research grants and human capital development through studentsupport. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): •To provide a coherent and identifiable base for thought leadership in ESS, that addresses key questions in the field. •To improve the continuity, coordination and coherence of efforts in ESS for global change research and towards national socio-economic benefits. •To facilitate the development of observation infrastructure and modelling capacity as a key component of sustained global change research. •To facilitate cooperation and collaboration among individuals and entities engaged in global change research both locally and internationally focusing on both current and existing future areas of investment. •To facilitate the integration generally of ESS research in global change and, specifically modelling frameworks, and their implementation. •To systematize information about the diverse efforts in ESS research in global change in South Africa, and the evolving national and international risks, and facilitate its access to a wide range of users and decision makers nationally and internationally. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: FOUNDATIONAL BIODIVERSITY INFORMATION PROGRAMME
content: South Africa's FOUNDATIONAL BIODIVERSITY INFORMATION PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). The FBIP addresses the generation, mobilization and integration of foundational biodiversity knowledge and information so that it can be managed and disseminated for addressing societal needs. The Programme is fully aligned to international and national obligations and objectives including the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD), the Intergovernmental Platform on Biodiversity & Ecosystem Services (IPBES), National Biodiversity Act, the National Biodiversity Strategy & Action Plan, the Global Change and Bio-economy Grand Challenges of DSIand its programme on Indigenous Knowledge Systems. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the Foundational Biodiversity Information Programme(FBIP) is to fund the generation, mobilizationand integration of priority foundational biodiversity knowledge and information so that this can be managed, secured and disseminated to address the needs of society, the Department of Science & Innovation(DSI) Global Change Programme and the bio-economy. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: TRANS-ATLANTIC PLATFORM COVID-19 CALL
content: South Africa's TRANS-ATLANTIC PLATFORM COVID-19 CALL (2021 - Ongoing). Funding Programme for a total of 10 projects/consortia will be funded. Each project will be provided a max of R750 000 for over 36 months to be paid in annual instamment of R250 000 per annum per project. It is part of the following theme(s): Building more resilient societies and economies, Competitive research funding, Governance arrangements to tackle COVID-19, Mitigating long-term impacts of COVID-19, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): The NRF will support all interdisciplinary research projects focused on the five challenges of this call, i.e. 1) Reducing inequalities and vulnerabilities 2) Building a more resilient and sustainable society 3) Fostering democratic governance and political participation 4) Advancing responsible and inclusive digital innovation 5) Ensuring effective and accurate communication and media It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Chile
heading: AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION PROJECTS OF PUBLIC INTEREST
content: Chile's AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION PROJECTS OF PUBLIC INTEREST (1995 - Ongoing). Support funds for the implementation of innovation initiatives in the national forestry sector and the associated agri-food chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To promote an innovative sector provide financial incentives to third parties, for the development and implementation of initiatives and / or innovative solutions that seek to solve problems or take opportunities associated with the strategic challenges of FIA, linked to the national forestry sector and / or the associated agri-food chain. These obstacles must be common and transversal for at least a subset of companies and / or producers in the sector. It uses Procurement programmes for R&D and innovation, Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: South Africa
heading: TECHNOLOGY HUMAN RESOURCES INDUSTRY PROGRAMME
content: South Africa's TECHNOLOGY HUMAN RESOURCES INDUSTRY PROGRAMME (1992 - Ongoing). THRIP is a partnership programme funded by the Department of Trade and Industry (the dti) and managed by the National Research Foundation (NRF). On a cost-sharing basis with industry, It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, International mobility of human resources, Intersectoral mobility, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): THRIP supports science, engineering and technology research collaborations focused on addressing the technology needs of participating firms and encouraging the development and mobility of research personnel and students among participating organisations. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: South Africa
heading: SOUTH AFRICAN RESEARCH CHAIRS INITIATIVE -
content: South Africa's SOUTH AFRICAN RESEARCH CHAIRS INITIATIVE - (2006 - Ongoing). The South African Research Chairs Initiative (SARChI) was established in 2006 by the Department of Science and Technology (DST) and the National Research Foundation (NRF). It is designed to attract and retain excellence in research and innovation at South African public universities through the establishment of Research Chairs at public universities in South Africa with a long-term investment trajectory of up to fifteen years. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Internationalisation in public research, Third-party funding. It has the following objective(s): The main goal of the Research Chairs initiative is to strengthen and improve research and innovation capacity of public universities for producing high quality postgraduate students and research and innovation outputs. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Chile
heading: AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION PROJECTS OF PRIVATE INTEREST
content: Chile's AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION PROJECTS OF PRIVATE INTEREST (1995 - Ongoing). Support funds for the implementation of innovation initiatives in the national forestry sector and the associated agri-food chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Targeted support to SMEs. It has the following objective(s): To provide financial incentives to third parties for the development and adoption of innovative solutions that seek to solve problems or take opportunities associated with the strategic challenges of FIA, linked to the national forestry sector and / or the associated agri-food chain. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION CONSULTING
content: Chile's AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION CONSULTING (1995 - Ongoing). Support funds for the implementation of innovation initiatives in the national forestry sector and the associated agri-food chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To contribute to the generation of knowledge and the development of innovation capacities, making available to a group of actors linked to the national forestry sector and / or the associated agri-food chain, the advice of national or international experts in order to to identify technological and / or productive gaps, and facilitate the application of innovative solutions. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION EVENTS
content: Chile's AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION EVENTS (2001 - Ongoing). Support funds for the implementation of innovation initiatives in the national forestry sector and the associated agri-food chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To contribute to the generation of knowledge and the development of innovation capacities, through events to disseminate information and/or innovation experiences to different actors linked to the innovation ecosystem of the forestry sector and/or the associated agri-food chain , to enable and strengthen innovation processes. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Chile
heading: AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION TOURS
content: Chile's AGRICULTURAL INNOVATION TOURS (1995 - Ongoing). Support funds for the implementation of innovation initiatives in the national forestry sector and the associated agri-food chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation. It has the following objective(s): To contribute to the generation of knowledge and the development of innovation capacities, through tours to learn about innovative solutions that are developed nationally or internationally, and that can be applied to the reality of the national forestry sector and / or in the associated agri-food chain. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Cyprus
heading: ACTION PLAN FOR HUMAN CAPITAL IN RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
content: Cyprus's ACTION PLAN FOR HUMAN CAPITAL IN RESEARCH AND INNOVATION (2021 - Ongoing). Actions and initiatives to tackle issues related to human capital in research and innovation It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Doctoral and postdoctoral researchers, Embedding sex- and gender-specific analysis in research, ERA-related strategies, Gender balance and inclusiveness, Research careers, STEM skills, STI human resources strategies. It has the following objective(s): A new action plan will be developed by the DMRID, on the basis of relevant ERA priorities and actions, with activities focused on researchers, research careers, work-life balance and gender equality. The plan, inter alia, will focus on the scientific diaspora and actions to promote collaborations and investments. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION DRAFT DECADAL PLAN 2020
content:
South Africa's SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION DRAFT DECADAL PLAN 2020 (2021 - Ongoing). The Decadal Plan serves as an implementation plan for the 2019 White
Paper on Science Technlogy and Innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, STI plan or strategy, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): The Decadal Plan seeks to respond to the Phase II (2020-2024) and III (2025-2030) of attaining NDP targets for STI, which propose that innovation is earmarked to improve the productivity and competitiveness of key sectors of the South African economy and to contributing to higher GDP growth rates overall. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Cyprus
heading: ACTION PLAN FOR OPTIMAL UTILISATION OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES
content: Cyprus's ACTION PLAN FOR OPTIMAL UTILISATION OF RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURES (2021 - Ongoing). An action plan is under development to promote better utilisation of research infrastructures set-up using public funding. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Structural change of the public research system. It has the following objective(s): To update the mapping of RIs in Cyprus, including RIs from the private sector. To explore the legislative and regulatory framework for the optimal utilisation of Research Infrastructures (RIs). To examine the need for creating a platform for publishing information on RIs and facilitating access to RIs. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: SOUTHERN AFRICAN SYSTEMS ANALYSIS CENTRE
content: South Africa's SOUTHERN AFRICAN SYSTEMS ANALYSIS CENTRE (2011 - Ongoing). The Southern African Systems Analysis Centre (SASAC), launched in November 2011 is a multi-year initiative coordinated by the University of the Western Cape, in partnership with the Universities’ of Limpopo and the Witwatersrand, and Stellenbosch. This initiative takes cognisance of additional and multi-level systems analysis capacity interventions, and a comprehensive approach to policy related activities in South- and Southern Africa. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, Horizontal policy coordination, Research careers. It has the following objective(s): The aim of the SASAC PhD programme is to provide an opportunity for excellent young doctoral students to advance their research under the direct supervision of senior scientists from South African and UK-based research and higher education institutions and IIASA, and at the same time contribute to IIASA’s ongoing scientific agenda and to the DST’s strategic research agenda as documented in the Grand Challenges It uses Fellowships and postgraduate loans and scholarships as policy instruments.

title: South Africa
heading: R&D TAX INCENTIVE
content: South Africa's R&D TAX INCENTIVE (2006 - Ongoing). Research and Development (R&D) Tax Incentive is administered by the Department of Science and Technology (DST), along with the South African Revenue Service (SARS) and the National Treasury, remains ongoing until at least 2022, It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): The R&D Tax Incentives are administered with an objective to promote the R&D investment in South Africa and complements the government expenditure on R&D activities It uses Tax or social contributions relief for firms investing in R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Ireland
heading: STRATEGY 2025 SHAPING OUR FUTURE
content:
Ireland's STRATEGY 2025 SHAPING OUR FUTURE (2021 - Ongoing). Science Foundation Ireland’s new strategy, Shaping Our Future It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research, Multi-stakeholder engagement, Research and innovation for society strategy, STI human resources strategies, STI plan or strategy, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Science Foundation Ireland’s new strategy has two core ambitions: Delivering Today and Preparing for Tomorrow. To deliver on our vision for Ireland we will develop more top talent, build on Ireland’s excellent research base, and maximise the tangible benefits for our economy and society, addressing current
challenges and supporting quality jobs and a competitive economy. As a small country, Ireland can best compete by developing a cohesive research ecosystem capable of taking first mover advantage in new and emergent fields. SFI’s new strategy emphasises anticipating what’s next and adapting our approach to lead in these new areas of discovery. To achieve this, SFI will engage and collaborate more widely and deeply with all stakeholders. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments.

title: Portugal
heading: STE(A)M IT PROJECT
content: Portugal's STE(A)M IT PROJECT (2019 - Ongoing). STEAM IT is an interdisciplinary stem approach, that, Impacting policy makers, teachers, school leaders, career advisors and industry, aims to strengthen the educational landscape by promoting innovative and cross-disciplinary approaches to STE(A)M teaching in education. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, STEM skills. It has the following objective(s): (1) create and test of a conceptual framework of reference for integrated STE(A)M education; (2) develop a capacity building programme for primary schools teachers and secondary STEM .teachers, based on this framework, with a particular focus on the contextualization of STEM teaching, especially through industry-education cooperation (3) further ensure the contextualization of the integrated STEM teaching by establishing a network of guidance counsellors/career advisors in schools promoting the attractiveness of STEM jobs to their classes. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Mexico
heading: FRONTIER SCIENCE
content: Mexico's FRONTIER SCIENCE (2019 - Ongoing). To promote frontier science that uses new ideas, models, concepts and methodologies to contribute to the understanding of phenomena, processes and realities, achieving substantive advances in scientific knowledge. It is part of the following theme(s): Commercialisation of public research results, Competitive research funding, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To support proposals that generate cutting-edge, original and transformative scientific knowledge; that promote collaboration between researchers with complementary skills, knowledge, experience and infrastructures, and that train new scientists capable of undertaking an independent practice, with special emphasis on postgraduate students and post-docs. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Mexico
heading: HORIZONTAL KNOWLEDGE NETWORKS
content:
Mexico's HORIZONTAL KNOWLEDGE NETWORKS (2020 - Ongoing). Conacyt encourages the creation of spaces and mechanisms for the understanding and solution of local problems where horizontal dialogue between traditional
and solutions to local problems where horizontal dialogue between traditional and diverse knowledge and the development of science, technology and
and diverse knowledge with the development of science, technology and innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Cross-disciplinary research, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Support the development of research projects that have a direct impact on the solution of local problems in the context of the current COVID-19 pandemic, through collaboration between organised social groups and research institutions, higher education and regional or municipal bodies, established as Horizontal Knowledge Networks, promoting equal dialogue between different actors and the resolution of problems that concern and affect society in different local spaces. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Mexico
heading: SUPPORT PROGRAMMES FOR SCIENTIFIC, TECHNOLOGICAL AND INNOVATION ACTIVITIES
content: Mexico's SUPPORT PROGRAMMES FOR SCIENTIFIC, TECHNOLOGICAL AND INNOVATION ACTIVITIES (2009 - Ongoing). It is a Conacyt budget programme whose objective is to support, encourage and promote projects in research, development, public communication of science and liaison, aimed at increasing and improving the pool of scientific and technological capabilities and skills, which strengthen the National System of Science, Technology and Innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Business innovation policy strategies, Competitive research funding, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): Promote activities directly linked to the development of scientific, technological and innovation activities. Financiar Proyectos de investigación científica, básica o aplicada, destinada a incrementar el acervo del conocimiento nacional. To finance basic or applied scientific research projects aimed at increasing the stock of national knowledge. Encourage the training and inclusion of specialised human resources for the development of scientific, technological and innovation activities in strategic sectors. Strengthen, consolidate and renew the infrastructure for the development of scientific, technological and innovation activities. Contribute to and promote international cooperation in science, technology and innovation. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Mexico
heading: STRENGTHENING SCIENTIFIC INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Mexico's STRENGTHENING SCIENTIFIC INFRASTRUCTURE (2003 - Ongoing). This support is granted through the Call for Support for the Strengthening and Development of Scientific and Technological Infrastructure. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To provide complementary financial resources to research institutions for the renewal or updating of their scientific equipment. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures as policy instruments.

title: Mexico
heading: NATIONAL STRATEGIC PROGRAMMES
content: Mexico's NATIONAL STRATEGIC PROGRAMMES (2019 - Ongoing). The Pronaces organise research efforts around specific national problems which, because of their importance and seriousness, require urgent attention and a comprehensive, deep and broad solution. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Cross-disciplinary research, Mission-oriented innovation policies, Research and innovation for society strategy, Stimulus for STI systems, Transfer and linkages strategies. It has the following objective(s): Investigate the causes of problems and provide solutions to them, from a multidimensional and interdisciplinary perspective. The Pronaces constitute the platforms for collaboration and convergence of the academic and technological community; they allow a more effective and efficient use of public resources, for the benefit of the population and the environment, and lead to greater independence in addressing national challenges. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Chile
heading: NETWORK OF UNIVERSITY RESEARCH LABORATORIES FOR DIAGNOSTICS
content: Chile's NETWORK OF UNIVERSITY RESEARCH LABORATORIES FOR DIAGNOSTICS (2020 - Ongoing). A network of university research laboratories was created, converting them into emergency diagnostic centers for COVID-19. It is part of the following theme(s): Mitigating long-term impacts of COVID-19, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): Network of university laboratories with the objective of increasing diagnostic capacity in the short term and strengthening the national diagnostic network in the long term. It uses Institutional funding for public research, Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: Mexico
heading: BUDGETARY PROGRAM F003
content:
Mexico's BUDGETARY PROGRAM F003 (2021 - Ongoing). Budgetary program for the financing of research projects, technological development and innovation, and scholarships It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research, International STI governance policy. It has the following objective(s): Promote the advancement of universal knowledge, including frontier research in
all areas and fields of knowledge, as well as the development of the humanities, sciences,
technologies and innovation, It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.

title: Montenegro
heading: OFFICIAL PRODUCER OF STATISTICAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
content: Montenegro's OFFICIAL PRODUCER OF STATISTICAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (2015 - Ongoing). As the official producer of statistical research and development (R&D) in Montenegro, Ministry of Education, Science, Culture and Sports collects data that provide all mandatory indicators with breakdowns defined in the EU Commission Implementing Regulation for statistics on science and technology (995/2012), in line with the methodological guidelines defined in the Guidelines for collecting and reporting data on research and experimental development. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Strategic policy intelligence. It has the following objective(s): R&D statistics provide internationally comparable data on total R&D spending and R&D staff. It uses Policy intelligence (e.g. evaluations, benchmarking and forecasts) as policy instruments.

title: Montenegro
heading: GRANTS TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN HORIZON AND COST PROGRAMMES
content: Montenegro's GRANTS TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN HORIZON AND COST PROGRAMMES (2017 - Ongoing). Grants to encourage participation in Horizon and COST programmes are aimed at increasing participation of Montenegrin institutions in Horizon 2020 and COST, as well as other international research and innovation programmes. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Internationalisation in public research. It has the following objective(s): The increased participation of Montenegrin institutions in Horizon 2020 and COST, as well as other international research and innovation programmes. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Montenegro
heading: SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY PARK OF MONTENEGRO
content: Montenegro's SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY PARK OF MONTENEGRO (2020 - Ongoing). Science and Technology Park of Montenegro (STP) is a priority infrastructure project of the Government of Montenegro. It is part of the following theme(s): Cluster policies, Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The STP was established with a view to integrating and stimulating innovative, scientific, entrepreneurial and economic capacities in Montenegro, and will be directly involved in the implementation of certain measures and instruments of support to the academic and business community defined by the S3 Strategy, with the mission of strengthening the links between the business sector and the scientific and academic community and creating innovative start-ups. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Technology extension and business advisory services as policy instruments.

title: Montenegro
heading: NATIONAL ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE
content: Montenegro's NATIONAL ROADMAP FOR RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE (2015 - Ongoing). In 2015, the Council for Scientific Research Activity adopted the National Roadmap for Research Infrastructure 2015-2020. In 2019, the document was revised due to significant changes that occurred in the meantime as a result of the introduction of various research and innovation funding instruments, which led to positive developments in the field of research infrastructures. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, STI plan or strategy. It has the following objective(s): Providing a detailed overview of research infrastructures available in Montenegro, as well as defining priorities and sources of funding in this area. Recognising the potential for regional and large European research infrastructures as well as identifying priority activities for the coming period. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Sweden
heading: A STRATEGY FOR SWEDISH PRTICIPATION IN HORIZON EUROPE
content: Sweden's A STRATEGY FOR SWEDISH PRTICIPATION IN HORIZON EUROPE (2021 - Ongoing). Overarching strategy for Swedish participation It is part of the following theme(s): ERA-related strategies, High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): To ensure that Swedish particiation is as effective as possible It uses Strategies, agendas and plans as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Ireland
heading: NORTH-SOUTH RESEARCH PROGRAMME
content: Ireland's NORTH-SOUTH RESEARCH PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). The programme will bring individual researchers, research teams and third level institutions North and South together, collaborating across a range of areas and work programmes. It is part of the following theme(s): Collaborative research and innovation, Competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): This funding, provided through the Shared Island Fund, will support the deepening of links between higher education institutions, researchers and research communities on the island of Ireland. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Romania
heading: SOLUTIONS
content: Romania's SOLUTIONS (2020 - Ongoing). Research to solve societal challenges It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research, Research and innovation for society strategy, Stimulus for STI systems. It has the following objective(s): Top-down objectives to limit the effects of COVID 19 It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Colombia
heading: CENTER FOR PUBLIC INNOVATION
content: Colombia's CENTER FOR PUBLIC INNOVATION (2013 - Ongoing). Colombia’s Center for Digital Public Innovation is an initiative of the MinTIC that works with innovation methods that stimulate the use of digital technologies to promote the State's digital transformation. It works as: laboratory, providing tailor-made support to solve challenges by applying emerging technologies; knowledge agency, coordinating capsules and events on digital innovation, and as a catalyst for the ecosystem, through projects and spaces that connect ecosystem actors. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): To promote the implementation of digital government policy in public entities. To stimulate the public innovation ecosystem and be the most excellent promoter of its digital dimension. It uses Dedicated support to research infrastructures, Creation or reform of governance structure or public body as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: France
heading: ANR call "OH Risk"
content: France's ANR call "OH Risk" (2014 - Ongoing). "OH Risk" is one of the instruments of the "At the Frontiers of Research" component announced in July 2013 when the ANR Work Programme 2014 was published. The aim of the "OH Risk" 2014 call for proposals is to fund exploratory research projects involving a very high level of scientific risk but with strong potential for scientific, technological and possibly economic impacts. It is part of the following theme(s): High-risk high-reward research. It has the following objective(s): Its aim is to foster the exploration of new highly-innovative research channels, as yet unexplored, characterised by both a very high level of scientific risk and the prospect of spin-offs with exceptionally high potential if they succeed. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments. and it has a budget of 1M-5M euros.

title: France
heading: ARIANEWORKS
content:
France's ARIANEWORKS (2019 - Ongoing). Set up by French space agency CNES and ArianeGroup, ArianeWorks is an innovation-boosting acceleration platform for future launcher development.

Its main mission is to speed up implementation of the Themis programme, the low-cost, reusable first stage demonstrator. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures, Stimulating demand for innovation and market creation. It has the following objective(s): Accelerate the innovation process, in order to prepare for future developments of Ariane.

ArianeWorks aims to reduce the time between the formulation of an idea and its realisation. Teams work together in a highly flexible environment, using an iterative design/testing approach.

The first project of ArianeWorks is called Themis. It is a multi-purpose, low-cost, reusable first stage rocket demonstrator. It has two main objectives: halve the cost of launches and greatly reduce their environmental impact. In the longer term, ArianeWorks intends to use its New Space-inspired innovation methods for other missions. Inspire and involve new players, such as pioneering start-ups, laboratories, SMEs and manufacturers.

ArianeWorks accelerates innovation at grassroots level, with cost reduction as a key priority. ArianeWorks also acts as a pathfinder, ables to accurately assess the technological context in order to make the right choices within the shortest timescales. This calls for an approach resolutely geared towards open innovation, to encourage the exchange of expertise and spawn a ground-breaking new ecosystem. It uses Networking and collaborative platforms as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: NET ZERO ACCELERATOR INITIATIVE
content:
Canada's NET ZERO ACCELERATOR INITIATIVE (2022 - Ongoing). CAD 8 billion over seven years for a Strategic Innovation Fund – Net Zero Accelerator.
While this fund is of general application, it is anticipated that it will include investments in emerging energy technologies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To help decarbonise heavy industry, commercialise clean technologies and help meaningfully accelerate domestic greenhouse gas emissions reductions (GHG) by 2030. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Canada
heading: 2030 EMISSIONS REDUCTION PLAN: CLEAN AIR, STRONG ECONOMY
content: Canada's 2030 EMISSIONS REDUCTION PLAN: CLEAN AIR, STRONG ECONOMY (2022 - Ongoing). The 2030 Emissions Reduction Plan includes new investments and provides a roadmap to how Canada will meet its enhanced Paris Agreement target to reduce emissions by 40-45% from 2005 levels by 2030, including actions on Clean Technology and Climate Innovation. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To accelerate both the development of clean technologies and their deployment. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: 2022 IMMEDIATE ACTION PROGRAMME
content: Germany's 2022 IMMEDIATE ACTION PROGRAMME (2022 - Ongoing). Amended Climate Change Act providing an additional eight billion euros for coal-free industrial activities, green hydrogen and green steel, as well as energy-focused building refurbishments and climate-friendly traffic. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To achieve climate neutrality in Germany by 2045. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: FUTURE NUCLEAR ENABLING FUND
content: United Kingdom's FUTURE NUCLEAR ENABLING FUND (2022 - Ongoing). The FNEF provides £120 million in total to support a limited number of nuclear projects through grant funding to be awarded following a competitive process. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To help mature potential nuclear projects ahead of any government process to select the next nuclear projects. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: ADVANCED NUCLEAR FUND
content: United Kingdom's ADVANCED NUCLEAR FUND (2022 - Ongoing). The Advanced Nuclear Fund provides up to £385 million to invest in the next generation of nuclear technologies. This includes up to £215 million for Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) and up to £170 million for a research and development programme. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To develop a domestic smaller-scale power plant technology design. To deliver an Advanced Modular Reactor (AMR) demonstration by the early 2030s. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United Kingdom
heading: DIRECT AIR CAPTURE AND OTHER GREENHOUSE GAS REMOVAL TECHNOLOGIES COMPETITION
content: United Kingdom's DIRECT AIR CAPTURE AND OTHER GREENHOUSE GAS REMOVAL TECHNOLOGIES COMPETITION (2020 - Ongoing). This competition provides up to GBP 100 million of new research and development funding to help develop direct air capture (DAC) technologies in the UK. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To support the development of Greenhouse Gas Removals (GGR) technologies to help them achieve commercialisation. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: TECHNOLOGY-BASED ENERGY SOLUTIONS: INNOVATIONS FOR NET ZERO PROGRAMME
content: United States's TECHNOLOGY-BASED ENERGY SOLUTIONS: INNOVATIONS FOR NET ZERO PROGRAMME (2021 - Ongoing). Call for Ignition Grants by the United States-India Science & Technology Endowment Fund (USISTEF), in partnership with Social Alpha, a non-profit organisation promoting S&T entrepreneurship, which supports India-US S&T-based entrepreneurial initiatives that address the development and implementation of next-generation clean and renewable energy, energy storage, and carbon sequestration. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To identify and support ‘technology showstoppers’ or promising joint India-US S&T-based entrepreneurial initiatives to tackle climate and clean energy challenges. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Japan
heading: DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY FOR CO2 SEPARATION, CAPTURE, ETC
content: Japan's DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY FOR CO2 SEPARATION, CAPTURE, ETC (2022 - Ongoing). Up to 38.23 billion yen for promoting the development of innovative materials that can separate CO2 with low energy costs. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To make the power sector and heat demand carbon neutral. To reduce the energy and costs required for separating and capturing CO2. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Japan
heading: MOONSHOT GOAL 4
content: Japan's MOONSHOT GOAL 4 (2019 - Ongoing). Research and Development Program with a total budget of YEN 100 billion focuses on the realization of sustainable resource circulation to recover the global environment by 2050 and includes R&D funding of YEN 20 billion (USD 200 million) for multiple innovative technologies, including DAC. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Solutions to the global warming problem (the Cool Earth) and environmental pollution problem (the Clean Earth) through realization of sustainable resource circulation for the global environment. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: PERTE FOR RENEWABLES ENERGIES, RENEWABLE HYDROGEN AND STORAGE
content: Spain's PERTE FOR RENEWABLES ENERGIES, RENEWABLE HYDROGEN AND STORAGE (2021 - Ongoing). Strategic Project for the Recovery and Economic Transformation (PERTE in Spanish) of Renewable Energies, Renewable Hydrogen and Storage. The government is allocating EUR 6.9 billion to innovative green energy technologies, expecting that the money would further mobilise close to EUR 9.5 billion from the private sector. Of the total sum, EUR 1.56 billion will go towards the development of renewable hydrogen projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To boost R&D and the value chain associated to hydrogen technologies: for new test or manufacturing lines for hydrogen components, for prototypes of new hydrogen-powered vehicles or demonstrators of large electrolysers to produce renewable hydrogen on a large scale. To boost R&D projects in the field of energy storage. To promote pilot projects for energy communities that are linked to social innovation and citizen participation in the generation of renewables, energy efficiency or electric mobility. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: RENEWABLE HYDROGEN STRATEGY
content: Spain's RENEWABLE HYDROGEN STRATEGY (2020 - Ongoing). The Hydrogen Roadmap provides a vision for the development of a favourable environment for the supply and demand of renewable hydrogen, in the medium and long term. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To provide significant support to R&D in the green hydrogen field, allowing Spain to produce its own high-power electrolyzers in the medium term, as well as be a pioneer country in the development of green hydrogen-related industry. Creation of hydrogen clusters, and defines the sectors where the deployment of hydrogen technologies have greater potential. It uses Strategies, agendas and plans, Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: CALL FOR INNOVATIVE ENERGY STORAGE PROJECTS
content: Spain's CALL FOR INNOVATIVE ENERGY STORAGE PROJECTS (2022 - Ongoing). Endowed with 50 million, it is part of a support line of the Recovery Plan with 150 million allocated to support R&D initiatives, including pilot projects for commercial use. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To give flexibility to the energy system and improving the integration of renewable energies. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Spain
heading: GREEN HYDROGEN THROUGHOUT THE VALUE CHAIN CALL
content:
Spain's GREEN HYDROGEN THROUGHOUT THE VALUE CHAIN CALL (2021 - Ongoing). Endowed with 250 million euros, the call is distributed in 4 aid programs to strengthen the innovative value chain of renewable hydrogen:
• Large electrolysers: 100 million euros. Focused on the manufacture of this equipment and integration in real industrial contexts.
• Hydrogen vehicles: 80 million euros. The universalisation of transport powered by fuel cells.
• Industrial and experimental research: 40 million euros.
• Improvement of capacities and technological progress in testing and manufacturing lines: 30 million euros. More focused on R&D. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To promote technical knowledge and productive capacity by developing technological advancements and prototypes throughout the hydrogen value chain, as well as testing facilities and new manufacturing lines. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Italy
heading: FUNDING FOR PUBLIC R&D ON CLEAN ENERGY
content: Italy's FUNDING FOR PUBLIC R&D ON CLEAN ENERGY (2022 - Ongoing). Calls for the allocation of EUR 20 million funds for research projects developed by public research organizations (institutions and universities) in the field of hydrogen. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Production of green hydrogen; innovative technologies for storage and transport; fuel cells for stationary or mobility applications; intelligent systems for the management of hydrogen-based infrastructures. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Australia
heading: HYGATE PROGRAM
content: Australia's HYGATE PROGRAM (2021 - Ongoing). Australia-Germany Hydrogen Accord with combined investment of approximately $130 million for RD&D projects along the hydrogen supply chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Facilitating industry partnerships on demonstration projects in Australian hydrogen hubs. Exploring opportunities to supply hydrogen and its derivatives to Germany. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Germany
heading: HYGATE PROGRAM
content: Germany's HYGATE PROGRAM (2021 - Ongoing). Australia-Germany Hydrogen Accord with combined investment of approximately $130 million for RD&D projects along the hydrogen supply chain. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Facilitating industry partnerships on demonstration projects in Australian hydrogen hubs. Exploring opportunities to supply hydrogen and its derivatives to Germany. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: FUND FOR DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF CCUS
content: Korea's FUND FOR DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF CCUS (2021 - Ongoing). USD 1.2 billion to develop CO2 storage It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To support country’s efforts to carbon neutrality by 2050 It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Korea
heading: LARGE-SCALE R&D PROJECTS
content: Korea's LARGE-SCALE R&D PROJECTS (2021 - Ongoing). Korea announced support for large-scale R&D projects for novel batteries worth KRW 500 billion (USD 0.4 billion) It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): nan It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: ENERGY STORAGE DEMONSTRATION AND PILOT GRANT PROGRAM
content: United States's ENERGY STORAGE DEMONSTRATION AND PILOT GRANT PROGRAM (2022 - Ongoing). $355 million to enter into agreements to carry out 3 energy storage system demonstration projects. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To improve the security of critical infrastructure and emergency response systems, improve the reliability of transmission and distribution systems, particularly in rural areas, including high-energy cost rural areas. To optimize transmission or distribution system operation and power quality to defer or avoid costs of replacing or upgrading electric grid infrastructure, including transformers and substations. To supply energy at peak periods of demand on the electric grid or during periods of significant variation of electric grid supply. To reduce peak loads of homes and businesses, improve and advance power conversion systems and provide ancillary services for grid stability and management. To integrate renewable energy resource production, increase the feasibility of microgrids (grid-connected or islanded mode) and enable the use of stored energy in forms other than electricity to support the natural gas system and other industrial processes. To integrate fast charging of electric vehicles and improve energy efficiency. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: INDUSTRIAL EMISSIONS DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS
content: United States's INDUSTRIAL EMISSIONS DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS (2022 - Ongoing). $500 million to fund demonstration projects that test and validate technologies that reduce industrial emissions. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): Achieve emissions reduction in high emissions industrial materials production processes, including production processes for iron, steel, steel mill products, aluminum, cement, concrete, glass, pulp, paper, and industrial ceramics. Achieve emissions reduction in medium- and high-temperature heat generation. Achieve emissions reduction in chemical production processes, including by incorporating, if appropriate and practicable, principles, practices, and methodologies of sustainable chemistry and engineering. Leverage smart manufacturing technologies and principles, digital manufacturing technologies, and advanced data analytics to develop advanced technologies and practices in information, automation, monitoring, computation, sensing, modeling, and networking. Leverage the principles of sustainable manufacturing to minimize the potential negative environmental impacts of manufacturing while conserving energy and resources. Increase the energy efficiency of industrial processes. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: PROGRAM UPGRADING ELECTRIC GRID AND ENSURING RELIABILITY AND RESILIENCY
content: United States's PROGRAM UPGRADING ELECTRIC GRID AND ENSURING RELIABILITY AND RESILIENCY (2022 - Ongoing). $5 billion to provide federal financial assistance to demonstrate innovative approaches to transmission, storage, and distribution infrastructure to harden and enhance resilience and reliability; and to demonstrate new approaches to enhance regional grid resilience. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To demonstrate innovative approaches to transmission, storage, and distribution infrastructure to harden and enhance resilience and reliability. To demonstrate new approaches to enhance regional grid resilience, implemented through States by public and rural electric cooperative entities on a cost-shared basis. It uses Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: FUNDING PHOTOVOLTAICS RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
content: United States's FUNDING PHOTOVOLTAICS RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (2022 - Ongoing). USD 29 million in funding for projects that reduce costs and supply chain vulnerabilities, further develop durable and recyclable solar technologies, and advance perovskite photovoltaic (PV) technologies toward commercialization. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To reduce costs and supply chain vulnerabilities, further develop durable and recyclable solar technologies, and advance perovskite photovoltaic (PV) technologies toward commercialization. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: ENERGY EARTHSHOTS INITIATIVE
content: United States's ENERGY EARTHSHOTS INITIATIVE (2021 - Ongoing). There are three current Energy Earthshots: Hydrogen ShotTM, Long Duration Storage ShotTM and Carbon Negative ShotTM. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To accelerate breakthroughs of more abundant, affordable, and reliable clean energy solutions within the decade. To drive the major innovation breakthroughs that we know we must achieve to solve the climate crisis, reach our 2050 net-zero carbon goals, and create the jobs of the new clean energy economy. To drive integrated program development across the U.S. Department of Energy's science and applied energy offices and ARPA-E and take an ‘all R&D community’ approach to leading science and technology innovations to address tough technological challenges and cost hurdles, and rapidly advance solutions to help achieve our climate and economic competitiveness goals. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: REGIONAL CLEAN HYDROGEN HUBS
content: United States's REGIONAL CLEAN HYDROGEN HUBS (2022 - Ongoing). Endowed with USD 8 billion, the initiative funds projects that demonstrate the production, processing, delivery, storage, and end-use of, clean hydrogen through regional clean hydrogen hubs, which are networks of clean hydrogen producers, potential clean hydrogen consumers, and connective infrastructure located in close proximity. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To support the development of at least 4 regional clean hydrogen hubs to improve clean hydrogen production, processing, delivery, storage, and end use. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: Bulgaria
heading: Science Portal
content:
Bulgaria's Science Portal (2019 - Ongoing). The Science Portal is developed and serves as a source of true and up-to-date information about upcoming thematic events, opportunities for international cooperation and scholarship programs, as well as for popularizing the results and achievements of the work of Bulgarian scientists. It is part of the following theme(s): Cross-disciplinary research. It has the following objective(s): Communicating to the general public and all interested parties, incl. foreign users information about the work and achievements of Bulgarian scientific organizations, teams and scientists.

Promotion of results from the implementation of the national scientific programs and the research infrastructures included in the updated National Road Map for %Research Infrastructure through videos, interviews and articles/publications.

Promotion of events from the Science Directorate's calendar, incl. "Pythagoras" awards, "Young talents" contest, etc. It uses Public awareness campaigns and other outreach activities as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: Bulgaria
heading: RESINFRA@DR (Danube Transnational Programme INTERREG)
content: Bulgaria's RESINFRA@DR (Danube Transnational Programme INTERREG) (2017 - Ongoing). ResInfra @DR focused on research infrastructures in the Danube macro‐region and it offered mutual learning opportunities for policy makers and the policy delivery organisations involved in the financing, and parent organisations arranging the operation of research infrastructures. It is part of the following theme(s): Research infrastructures. It has the following objective(s): The project mission was to improve framework conditions for research infrastructure and innovation in the Danube region. ResInfra@DR facilitated enhanced transnational cooperation and a macro-regional scope of the sustainable development of research infrastructures. It uses nan as policy instruments. and it has a budget of Less than 1M euros.

title: France
heading: FRANCE 2030 – RENEWABLE ENERGY
content: France's FRANCE 2030 – RENEWABLE ENERGY (2022 - Ongoing). Investment of 1 bn on floating wind turbine, Photovoltaic cells, energy network, and others renewable energies. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To develop and industrialise new technologies for renewable energy production. It uses Grants for business R&D and innovation, Project grants for public research as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: CRITICAL MINERALS RESEARCH PROGRAM REQUEST FOR INFORMATION
content: United States's CRITICAL MINERALS RESEARCH PROGRAM REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (2022 - Ongoing). USD675 million grant program funded by the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. This Request for Information (RFI) issued by the Department of Energy solicits feedback from industry, academia, research laboratories, government agencies, state and local coalitions, labor unions, tribes, community-based organizations, and others, on the structure of the program, timing and distribution of funds, and selection criteria. It is part of the following theme(s): Competitive research funding, Financial support to business R&D and innovation, Green energy transitions. It has the following objective(s): To address vulnerabilities in the domestic critical minerals supply chain. Specifically, the program will develop materials, components and technologies, promote efficient production and use, circular economy approaches, and ensure a long-term, diverse, secure, and sustainable supply of critical materials. It uses Project grants for public research, Grants for business R&D and innovation as policy instruments.

title: United States
heading: FUNDING TO ADVANCE CLEAN ENERGY BREAKTHROUGHS AT ENERGY RESEARCH CENTERS
content: United States's FUNDING TO ADVANCE CLEAN ENERGY BREAKTHROUGHS AT ENERGY RESEARCH CENTERS (2022 - Ongoing). USD 420 million funding opportunity for DOE’s Energy Frontier Research Centers (EFRC). It is part of the following theme(s): Green energy transitions, Non-competitive research funding. It has the following objective(s): To advance climate solutions through early-stage research on clean energy technology, advanced and low-carbon manufacturing, and quantum information science to contribute to the national goal of becoming a zero-emission economy by 2050. It uses Institutional funding for public research as policy instruments.
